loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a single woman. She describes herself to be dynamic and reliable. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to have a large boutique within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 35 years old, married to David and blessed with 3 children. She has a retail shop and has been running the business for 5 years. She will be using the loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, milk, rice, maize flour and soap detergents for sell so as to sell to more customers and make more income to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes are to expand her retail shop by opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking oil, milk, rice, maize flour and soap detergents for sell so as to sell to more customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 48 years old. Jean works very hard to provide for her family.

Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Jean has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, vinegar, candies, biscuits and other groceries. 

In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rosaria

texts.en:
Rosaria is 57 years old and a mother of six children, four are currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 so as to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development.

Rosaria operates a general retail where she sells all household commodities. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs e.g. flour, sugar, tea leaves and cooking fat hence add stock to her general retail shop for increased income to be able to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs e.g. flour, sugar and cooking fat hence add stock to her general retail shop for increased income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 66 years old and a mother of 5 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 in order to benefit from the trainings especially on enterprise development.

She practices poultry farming as her economic activity.  She works as a caretaker in a spiritual home to supplement her income. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds and chicks to enable her add stock to her poultry farming. This will enable her increase her income to meet her family's basic needs e.g. food and clothing.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and chicks to add stock to her poulty farming business for increased income to meet family's expenses eg. food and clothing.

loans.name: Angaza Kamiruri Youth Group

texts.en:
Godfrey is the name of the gentleman raising his hand in the photograph. He is a member of Angaza Kamiruri youth group. He is forty six years old, married and a father of four.
He does maize and beans farming as his economic activity. He has greatly benefited from the hand in hand eastern Africa training which equipped him with skills to effectively manage his business. 

He is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. He hopes this will enable him boost his proceeds and hence increase his income. He will therefore be able to improve the living standards of his family which include quality education and modern housing.
 
Godfrey is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To  purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds that will increase farm yield for more income for family needs like quality education and help build a modern house .

loans.name: Dianakoh Group

texts.en:
Amadu is a forty-year-old businessman.  He is a member of “Dianakoh“ solidarity group. “Dianakoh” is a solidarity group of three women and two men.  (in the group picture, Amadu is in the middle).

Amadu has been in the palm oil business for the past 13 years. He works at his business six days a week from 8 am to 6 pm. He established his business to help support his children in school.  He pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profit he gets from the business.

Amadu and his group members need a total of 5,000,000 SLL of which Amadu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which he will use to buy an additional 50 gallons of palm oil for his business. He hopes that this loan will help him generate more profit to support his family. Amadu is married and has four children ages twenty-seven, sixteen, thirteen and ten; they are all school-going children.

In the future, Amadu plans to generate more money to provide university education for his children . He believes educating his children to university level will better the lives of his family.

Amadu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy an additional 50 gallons of palm oil for his business

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VENCEDORAS” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mirian es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de CDs, venta de gorros, venta de papa, venta de comida, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mirian es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra  de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la capacitación y los ahorros que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Las Vencedoras" is beginning their ninth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima. It is made up of nine members, and headed by a board of directors, with Mirian as their president. The businesses that the members of the communal association conduct are varied, and include: selling meat, selling clothing, selling CDs, selling hats, selling potatoes, selling food, and selling fruit. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit micro-entrepreneurs including Mirian. She comments that eight years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of her sister, who was already a client. Now she has a business selling meat, a trade she learned from her sister several years ago. 

The present loan they are seeking is for raising capital for purchasing meat at wholesale, which will be purchased from the wholesale vendors in La Paz, and later sold in her shop. This business allows her to generate income to support her extended family, as she is single. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mirian replies that she likes the training and the savings the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 42 years old and works as a construction assistant. She is married and the mother of 2 kids. Her husband is a mason and sometimes the couple work together. 

Aurelia needs a loan to buy construction materials that she will sell to other masons. This is a good business and Aurelia wants to take the chance.  

She hopes you can help because she wants to save money to finish the construction of her own house.  As you can see in the picture, the place needs work.  Also in the picture is one of her kids.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Titanic Grp Group

texts.en:
Elikana is aged in his late 30s. He is married and has got one son and two daughters who are still schooling. For five years now, he has been supporting his family by running a fish business (including sangara, a type of fish that comes from fresh water). He starts his business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This is his second credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous credit, paid back successfully, to raise his business capital and bought fishes. 

Elikana dreams to raise much more capital and improve to a nice working environment. He managed to receive some extra income, which he used to cover school fees and house expenses. 

He will share this loan with his group, Titanic, which totals eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

With his second credit request, Elikana will buy stock of sato, sangara and other fish for his business to resell.

loans.use: to buy stock of tilapia and sangara to resell for his business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 46 años de edad, vive en casa de material rustico, es madre soltera cuenta con tres hijos, vive en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, café y arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, raspadillas, gaseosas, entre otros, desde hace 10 años de experiencia en el rubro, cuenta con clientela de la zona y los transportistas de zonas aledañas, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de bebidas gaseosas y aumentar su stock en el negocio y arreglos a local, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 46 year old who lives in a rustic house.  She is a single mother with three children.  She lives in the district of Pucará.  The population there is dedicated to agriculture, especially to the cultivation of fruits, coffee and rice, and commerce and cattle.  It is located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the mountains of northern Perú.  

She makes a living selling juices, snow cones, and soft drinks, among others.  She has 10 years experience, and has a good clientele from the region, and of drivers from further areas.  She is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks and increase the stock in her store, and make repairs to her store, with which she will generate a better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and increase the stock of her store, and make repairs in the store's infrastructure.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Ujamaa Group consists of five members who are closely related in terms of friendship and type of business involvement. The name of group suggests the type of people who normally help each other to alleviate hardship. 

Suzana is one of the members who is involved with a shop, selling general items such as sugar, soaps, rice, cooking oil, drinks, kerosene, etc. She is in her early 40s, married and has five children who are at school. She starts working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. each working day and is able to make a very good profit each month.

This is her first credit with the group who joined to request a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Kiva's partner. She will use this credit to buy shop inventory of rice, maize and baking flour, soaps, oils, etc. She dreams to improve her shop more and be able to buy a car. 

Suzana will share this loan with her group, Ujamaa, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop inventory of rice, maize and baking flour, soaps, oils, etc.

loans.name: Twigire 2 Group

texts.en:
Verena is the group leader aged 37 years. She is married with 8 children, aged between 1-15 years. This group is a subgroup of Twigire, which means being self-dependent.They sell different products and they would wish to expand their business for them to have better standards of living.

She owns a shop and she has been in this business for the past six years.

With the loan she would like to refill her store by buying more home consumption products such as rice, sugar, biscuits,etc.

She wishes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more home consumption products to sell.

loans.name: Umurava Group

texts.en:
Umurava is a group led by Agnes, who is 53 years old. The group name means “hardworking” in English. She is married with four children aged between 23 and 33 years. She has a shop and has been doing in a business for the past eight years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Lago San Jorge Group

texts.en:
About half way up the intense drop from Solola to Panajachel squats the quaint village of San Jorge. In the breathtaking town with perfect views of the lake Atitlan in every corner resides the trust bank “Mujeres Lago San Jorge”, composed of 10 women.

With her child in hand and her ears perked, Juana (the group's elected president) thoughtfully listened as the Friendship Bridge loan officer gave this month’s training session on family planning. 34-year-old Juana, a mother of four, is the owner of a shop which specializes in selling goods for daily consumption. 

Having been with Friendship Bridge for various years, Juana hopes to continue her endearing development by reinvesting the loan she will receive into purchasing a larger variety of goods to expand her store as well as her clientele basis. By doing so she holds the aspirations to one day move into a bigger store in a better location. 

The money made from her store is put towards the proper education and correct nourishment for her children, for which she gives much credit to Friendship Bridge. 

Aside from the family planning session which she received that day, as a part of Friendship Bridge’s Microcredit Plus program, Juana and others are given monthly, non-formal education sessions that include topics such as health, business, and specific subjects about women.   

Juana and the trust bank Mujeres Lago San Jorge are beyond grateful for the confidence of Kiva investors around the world for giving them this opportunity for growth through their small business. Without these loans, Juana and her companions could be stuck in a poverty trap that holds nothing short of a bleak future.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods to expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Panyebar Group

texts.en:
By jumping on a micro bus in in Solola on the western highlands of Gutemala and taking a rugged, half-constructed road to Santa Clara La Laguna, you will reach the town in which the monthly reunions of the trust bank “Las Mariposas Panyebar” take place. The group is composed by 11 women. 

Standing in the middle, listening attentively is the groups’ secretary, Francisca. Francisca is a married mother of four who has been with Friendship Bridge for an astounding four years. In those magnificent years, Francisca has been able to improve her standard of living and grow her business to levels that she had never thought possible before.With the help of her oldest, Francisca is a women of true grit who makes a living primarily by beekeeping. When Francisca is not working in a storm of stinging insects, she helps her husband and second oldest with their business of buying and flipping cars for profit. 

When asked what she will reinvest the loan into, Francisca replied by saying she would like to purchase new tools and pieces to help with the car business along with replacing any broken parts in regards to her beekeeping. 

As a part of Friendship Bridge’s Microcredit Plus program, Francisca – along with all clients of Friendship Bridge – receives monthly, non-formal education sessions where she learns an array of topics that help promote her self-development. Ranging from topics on health, business, family, and specific subjects about women, Friendship Bridge - along with the loan - provides a guiding hand that can make the difference between living in poverty or not.

The trust bank Las Mariposas Panyebar and all the women involved with Friendship Bridge are incredibly grateful for the confidence of Kiva investors in giving them a chance to pursue development through their small business through micro credit.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and pieces to help with the car business along with replacing any broken parts in regards to her beekeeping.

loans.name: Umoja Grp Group

texts.en:
Marwa is 42 years old, married, and has got 1 son and 2 daughters who are at school. For eight years now, Marwa has been managing his family by running a shop selling maize and baking flour, sweets, soft drinks, etc. He works from 07.am to 09.pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is his third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among Umoja, a two-member-group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous loans, paid back successfully, to buy stocks for the shop. He managed to receive a small profit which he used to cover school fees and household expenses. Marwa dreams to expand his shop to better level. 

He will use this loan to buy stock for his small shop.

loans.use: to buy stock for his small shop.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa,  el se dedica a la venta y compra de materiales reciclables dese hace 8 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando un portón en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene el capital suficiente para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito  para la compra de materiales para la elaboración del portón y pago de mano de obra, para que puedan vivir más seguros con su familia.
texts.en: Jorge is 46 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. He has bought and sold recyclable materials for eight years. With what he earns from this work, he can take care of some of his household expenses. He wants to improve his home by placing a gate in the area shown in the picture, but he does not have enough money to do this. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build the gate and pay for labor so that he can live more safely with his family.

loans.use: purchase materials to build a gate and pay for labor.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noe de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, él se dedica al servicio de transporte de moto taxi desde hace 18 años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir parte de su casa pero como no posee suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito a integral para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así tener un hogar digno para que su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Noe is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He has worked providing motorcycle taxi services for 18 years. He wants to improve his house completing construction on part of the house but he does not have sufficient capital. So he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the construction materials and then he will have a dignified home where his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Veronica has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.en:
Juan Luis, who works alongside his wife, Carmen, is an artisan from Peru who specializes in silver jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver, gemstones, and other jewelry components.

Juan Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"We love to let our imagination run free and be as creative as we want to be. We are inspired by everything we see, even by the discarded pieces from other things we made! We put them together and play with them, like a jigsaw puzzle. I love to see how mistakes can be transformed into beautiful things."

"I'd like to thank everyone who plays a role in this microcredit from the bottom of my heart. These funds will allow us to grow our business and create new designs."

Use the link below to view Juan Luis's silver jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6054

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver, gemstones, and other jewelry components

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a new sales agent for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in slums. He has completed iSmart's sales and marketing training and is beginning to work as a door-to-door sales agent in Nairobi's slum communities. 

iSmart's best-selling product is the clean cookstove, which has an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce the toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health as well as the environment.  

Please help John earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in his community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Wendlanaaba Group

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Adélaïde est la responsable de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.Cette jeune dame gère une boutique et cela fait 4 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Ses clients réclament de plus en plus ses produits  et pour satisfaire la demande, elle a besoin d'un crédit. Avec ce crédit, elle va approvisionner sa boutique en divers articles( lait biscuits,bonbon,riz, l'huile,...). Elle fait des épargnes quotidiennement, ce qui va lui permettre d'assurer la continuité de son activité. Après ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de faire  les dépenses de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adélaïde, age 34, is the head of this group. She is married with four children. This young lady has been running a shop for four years. She is seeking a loan to satisfy an increasing demand from her customers. She will use this credit to bolster her stock of milk, cookies, candy, rice, oil, etc. She puts money aside on a daily basis, which should help to sustain her activity. With the profits from her sales, she can provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to bolster her stock of sugar, milk, cookies, rice, oil, candy, etc.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is working as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya. He's holding a clean-burning cookstove, an incredible product that reduces charcoal consumption by half, saving his customers money that they can spend on other important things like food, health care, or school fees. These cookstoves also reduce toxic emissions, benefiting women and girls who most often bear the burden for cooking. 

Please help Fredrick earn a living bringing these beneficial products to others in his community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Kisesa Grp Group

texts.en:
Shikao is 26 years old and is single. He is a businessman managing a shop serving as an M-PESA fund transfer service, together with selling phones and accessories. It's a type of business that has proved to be good for him, as he is being able to make a fair monthly profit. He starts working from 7 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. per working day. 

This is his second credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Kisesa, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous credit to buy phone accessories and recharged his float. He has paid back successfully his previous loan. Shikao earned some small extra income, which he used to cover his means of living. 

His business dreams are to expand his shop and become a big businessman. He will invest part of this credit request to recharge his float and purchase phone accessories for his shop.

loans.use: to recharge his float and purchase phone accessories for his shop.

loans.name: El Faisán Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario ¨El Faisán¨ está integrando por 3 mujeres quien el día a día, trabajan fuertemente para sacar adelantes a sus familias, y también sintiéndose dichosas de poder tener sus propios negocios y obtener ingresos económicos. 
Quien coordina al grupo es Rosa, de 41 años de edad, soltera y tiene a su responsabilidad a  cuatro hijos, de edades 15, 13, 10 y 8 años. Ellos son su motor de vida y trabaja fuertemente para brindarles una vida segura. Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de Legumbres en el mercado de la ciudad. Les ayudan en su negocio su hijo y una muchacha en la venta de los productos. Con las ganancias obtenidas de los  créditos anteriores pudo materiales para componer su casa y también compro un terreno. Ahora desea el crédito para la inversión en chayote, papa, cebolla dulce y repollo. Las otras compañeras de grupo son Scarleth, 21 años, se dedica a la venta de plátanos. Y Jessy, 33 años a la venta de legumbres.
texts.en:
The ¨El Faisán¨communal bank is made up of 3 women who work hard day by day to get their families ahead and who feel blessed to have their own businesses and generate economic income.

Rosa is the coordinator of the group. She is 41 years old, single and has the responsibility of four children, aged 15, 13, 10 and 8. They are the driving force in her life and she works hard to provide them a secure life. For the past fourteen years she has sold vegetables in a market in the city. Her son and a salesgirl help her selling the products. With the profits obtained from previous loans she bought materials to build a house and also bought a plot of land. Now she wants the loan to invest in chayote, potatoes, onion and cabbage.

The other members of the group are Scarleth, who is 21 years old and sells bananas and Jessy who is 33 years old and sells vegetables.

loans.use: to invest in chayote, potatoes, onion and cabbage.

loans.name: Mario Eduardo

texts.en: Mario Eduardo is 25 years old and single. Three years ago he opened a store where he sells car stereos and security systems. He also does installations and repairs. Mario Eduardo is single and his goal is to grow his business and open a second store. He is asking for a loan to buy inventory such as car stereos and security systems for cars.

loans.use: To buy car stereos and security systems for his store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
At the age of 37, Erlinda is a mother of three children. She wants to give her family a good life; that's why she engaged in a vegetable garden to earn an income and to help her husband in providing for their children. 

To increase her income, she decided to borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for the vegetable garden so that her garden can produce good quality vegetables and she also can harvest plenty of vegetables to be delivered in the market that will generate better income.

For the future, Erlinda plans to save money to use to renovate their family house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Ylder Martin

texts.es:
Yler Martin tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa familiar sin hijos en su poder en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Yler Martín se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Yler Martin espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yler Martin is 37 years old, lives in a family house without any children in the district of Pucará, which is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in the community is calm, and the villagers mainly dedicated themselves to selling and raising small cattle.  

Yler Martín offers transportation service to passengers in his moto-taxi.  He has experience in the sector and has good personal and labor references in the area.  The loan will be used to make repairs and do maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in a bad state.  With this, Yler Martin hopes to offer better service to his clients and generate more income to improve the quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 37-year-old mother of 4. After separating from her husband, Edith started a daycare center in order to sustain her children. She has been running the center from her yard for the last seven years and has encountered a lot of challenges, key among them, a lack of proper facilities which has resulted in a poor turnout as parents opt to take their children to better centers even though they are further away. 

She has decided to improve her center and offer better services in a bid to win back parents and their children. 

She is therefore requesting a Kiva loan to buy and install a shade. This will allow the children the comfort of playing and even eating outside irrespective of weather conditions. "When children are comfortable, they are happy and when they are happy they grow healthy", says Edith. 

The loan will also help her buy new tables and add chairs to her classrooms. 

Edith hopes to run a primary school in the future.

loans.use: to buy and install a shade, and to add more chairs and tables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 12 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The youth who has had her face blanked out is 28 years old and lives in a high risk zone. For the past 12 years she has had a small store located in her house. She has many clients, especially her neighbors. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. so she can have greater income for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1988 and is living in a big city with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband helps her to do business. She has been in business for 8 years and knows well how to be gentle and serve customers. She retails from domestic market to super market. 

She buys and sells kid’s wears and has regular clients every day. She is planning to buy upcoming seasonable clothes and attract more customers. She is asking financial help to buy a new assortment of kid’s wear. She awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to buy upcoming seasonable clothes and attract more customers

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scotia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells used shoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy bales of used shoes. 

Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila has been engaged in a variety store for one year. She is happily married and blessed with two children. Aside from selling a variety of grocery items, she also offers some blouses, pants and shorts.

Jamila would like to seek a loan of PHP15,000 to be used in buying grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, fish sauce, vinegar and soy sauce.

Jamila is hoping for approval of her requested loan to be able to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, fish sauce, vinegar and soy sauce for her variety store

loans.name: Santos Arcadio

texts.es: Santos de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado desde hace 18 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados q se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas y compra de novilla. Para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Santos, age 49, lives in his own house with his wife and their four children.  He has been growing corn and raising livestock for 18 years.  He sells his products at the different markets that are close to his house.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, and a heifer.  He will do this in order to continue with his work.  This way he will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, and a heifer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
For more than 20 years, Elsa manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities ranging from beverages, noodles, assorted canned goods, soft drinks, condiments and toiletries.  She is a 66-year-old married woman with one grown child.  She resides in Talibon, Bohol. 

She needs funds to support her current source of income. 

Elsa has requested a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks like rice, soft drinks and other beverages. 

With the availability of these merchandise, it could boost the content of her store and able to cater to her respective customers. Thus, Elsa could now start to settle her obligations and start to expand her business.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky has been selling his oils, soaps, lotions and incense in San Diego’s southeastern community for four years. In selling his products, Ricky is passionate about providing the highest quality of product at a decent price. 

Ricky first received a $1,000 Kiva loan in 2014 to start building his credit, cover operating costs and increase cash flow. Since then, he has made all of his payments on time and is selling $2,000 of his products on a monthly basis. 

Ricky will be using his new $2,000 Kiva loan to purchase inventory such as body oils, incense, and perfumes in order to keep up with demand.

Ricky is also in the process of applying for his door-to-door license through the City of San Diego, which will give him the opportunity to reach more clientele.

Ricky was laid off from his job as a janitor last year and is currently receiving benefits. With over eight years of sales experience, Ricky is confident that he will be able to generate additional income from this business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as body oils, incense, and perfumes

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Riza is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Riza has a selling seafood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Riza has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Akpaglo

texts.fr: Agée de 61 ans, Akpaglo est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec son enfant. Etant très entreprenante et active dans le développement, Akpaglo vend de l’huile rouge en se promenant dans son quartier. Ce commerce lui permet de bénéficier d’un revenu pour aider son mari à financer l’éducation de leur enfant. Akpaglo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour passer une commande de bidons d’huile rouge, Akpaglo demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Akpaglo, age 61, is married with one child and she lives in Tokoin. With a strong entrepreneurial spirit and a focus on development, Akpaglo sells red oil as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood. The revenue from this activity helps her husband to finance their child’s education. 

Akpaglo stocks up at the market twice a month. She is seeking this loan to order drums of red oil so that she can meet her objectives and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy 3 drums of red oil.

loans.name: Kabuswa Moricho Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Priscah, thirty nine years old, married and has seven children.  She joined hand in hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. From the training she underwent, Priscah have been able to run and manage her business well. 

She does maize and beans farming, and is therefore borrowing from Kiva to buy top dressing fertilizers to boost her crop yield. This will further increase her income hence be in a position to provide for her children’s food, shelter, clothing and education. 

Priscah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy top dressing fertilizer that will help improve on crop yield thus more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old and a mother of five children who are all currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 so as to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development.
She operates a general store selling assorted fruits and vegetables, household commodities and foodstuffs. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables hence add stock in her grocery store to meet her customers demands. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits and vegetables hence add stock to her general store to be able to meet customers demands.

loans.name: Miriam Esmeralda

texts.es: Miriam de 54 años e de dad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 15 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, carnes, pollos etc. para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Miriam is 54 years old and lives in her house with her son. She has dedicated herself to food sales for the past 15 years.  Her business is located in her home and she is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, meats, chickens, etc. to continue her sales and in this way have better income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, meats and chickens, etc.

loans.name: Deonida

texts.en:
Deonida runs a sari-sari(variety store.) She is married with 7 grown children. She resides in Talibon, Bohol. She sells basic commodities like pouch vinegar, edible oil, biscuit, coffee,sugar, canned goods, seasonings and toiletries. She has been engaged in that kind of business for more than 10 years. She needs capital to support her source of income.

She  is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for the store, like  assorted canned goods, shampoo and groceries. Thus, it boost more goods to be display and could attract more consumers to shop. With these, she will be able to augment her income and start to settle her obligations.

Deonida dreams that with the presence of these resources, she will be able to improve her income in order to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store

loans.name: Gertrudez

texts.en:
Gertrudez is a 45 years old, married and has six children to provide for. She is engaged in corn production business to earn for an income and able to help her husband as a farmer in providing her family needs. She aims to increase her income to give her children better lives. So she decided to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for corn production, to produce a good harvest and generate a better income.


Gertrudez plan for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for corn production.

loans.name: Mirian Dianet

texts.es:
Mirian Dianet tiene 28 años de edad, vive sola con su menor hija de 8 años, en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, hace aproximadamente 06 años, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian Dianet is 28 years old.  She lives alone with her younger daughter, age 8.  She lives in the Callayuc district, a community that generally works in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.  It is located in the Cuteryo province, belonging to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

For about six years, Mirian Dianet has worked selling basic necessities such as groceries, among other items.  Her business is located in her home.  She has very good personal and work references.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for the purchase of basic necessities in bulk in order to stock her business and, in this way, generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities in bulk in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessebel is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jessebel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Jessebel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 51 years old and a widow with nine children.

Carmencita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Carmencita has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to build a bathroom at their home for improvement of access to sanitation and water sources.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana works hard to support her family. Cipriana is married and has a food processing business in the Philippines.

Cipriana requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cipriana has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Cipriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Wendyam Victor Group

texts.fr:
Mme VICTOR est responsable du groupe WENDYAM VICTOR. Célibataire, il, est sans enfant. Il a 02personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 05ans. Il s'approvisionne au barrage de Nagrengo.
Il veut s'acheter 10sacs d'engrais et 06boites de herbicide.
Il veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne scolariser ses frères.
texts.en:
Mr. VICTOR is the head of the group WENDYAM VICTOR. He is single with no children. He supports two people. 

Victor is a market gardener, an activity he has been practicing for five years. He buys his stock at the Nagrengo dam. He plans to buy 10 sacks of fertilizers and 6 cartons of herbicides. He plans to reinvest his profits in his activity. His goal is to support his brothers’ education.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizers and 6 cartons of herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve the access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 25 years old. He is married and a young father to two girls aged two and five. He is engaged in selling barbecue during the evenings. He just started this business recently to provide for his family. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP6000 to buy ingredients like meat, cooking oil, pepper, seasoning and spices. Winnie is optimistic of the future and works hard for his family. He plans to make his business successful and explore other business options for sustainability. He and his family live in Badian, Cebu.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, cooking oil, pepper, seasoning and spices

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariunaa, 47 years old, lives alone in her apartment in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as saleswoman at a beauty store since 2013. Before moving to Erdenet, she used to work as quality manager at construction company for 22 years. Her husband has recently passed away. Their two children all live on their own and visit her frequently. 

She is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to buy new furniture such as drawers and closets for personal use. The old furniture became worn out and it became essential to replace with new.

loans.use: to buy new furniture to replace others that are worn out

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: José de 30 años de edad es un hombre trabajador  que vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida con quien hace 3 años lograron comprar su vivienda.  José presta sus servicios de motorista repartidor desde hace 5 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindar el sustento a su familia. José tiene la iniciativa de ampliar la casa ya que es bastante pequeña, por lo que el área de la cocina no tiene un espacio propio, pensando en lo anterior José ha decidido solicitar un crédito  A FUSAI y así poder comprar todos los materiales necesarios  tales como: lámina galvanizada, hierro, ladrillo, cemento y arena para construir el cuarto de la cocina.
texts.en: José  is a 30 year old hard-working man who lives in a house with his life partner.  Three years ago they were able to buy their house. José has lent his service as a delivery cyclist for the past 5 years, and he is happy to be able to provide for his family.  José is taking the initiative to enlarge his house, as the kitchen does not have its own space because the house is so small.  Considering this, José decided to request a loan from A FUSAI to be able to buy the necessary materials like galvanized sheet metal, iron, bricks, cement, and sand to build the kitchen.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, iron, bricks, cement, and sand to build a room for a kitchen.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is a mother of three children and aged 55. To earn a living, she has a sari-sari store business and is able to help her husband in providing for her children needs. She wants to give her family a good living she decided to avai a loan to buy more goods for sell and increase her store inventory that will generate better income.

Ethel plan for the future to save money out from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sell in her sari sari

loans.name: Jory

texts.en:
Jory works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines.

Jory requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Jory would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 28 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Margie has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, cereals, coffee, detergent soap, soft-drinks, biscuits, etc. 

Margie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is 40 years old and has four children. Razel is married and has four children who are in school.

Razel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Razel requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Razel has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Razel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea works hard to support her family. Aurea is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Aurea requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanuts, salt, etc. for her food vending business.

Aurea has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Aurea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, salt, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Libya

texts.en: Libya is 59 years old from Badian, Cebu. For two years, she managed her sari-sari (general) store to earn a living. She is also engaged in selling perfumes, shirts, cologne and shorts. Usually, she sells these items door-to-door to her neighbors. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of cologne, lotion, shirts and shorts. Once her stocks are available it attracts more customers from her community. Her income will be for consumption and savings.

loans.use: to buy cologne, lotion, shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Fris

texts.en: Fris, 41, is married and has four children. To earn a living she raises pigs as a source of income for her family. To increase her income she decided to take out a loan to buy feed for the pigs to produce higher quality pigs and increase sales. Fris plans to save money to renovate her family house.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and water sources.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jovelyn has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Beverly Jil

texts.en:
Beverly Jil is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Beverly Jil is 34 years old and has one child who is in school.

Beverly Jil has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Beverly Jil requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to resell.

Beverly Jil has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Beverly Jil would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to resell.

loans.name: G.s Las Montañitas Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. LA Montañita está conformada por cuatro integrantes tres mujeres y un hombres, madres y padres de familia responsables de diez hijos, todos menores de edad, son originarios de la Paz Centro, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, todos tienen diferentes actividades económicas, y se apoyan mutuamente para sacar adelante a sus familias, y sus negocio,  cumpliendo cada una  con los pagos a tiempo,  para obtener el beneficio del crédito grupal.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Marlene y tiene por actividad económica  es venta de ropa nueva, de forma ambulante y por encargo, tiene cinco años de dedicarse a dicha actividad, la cual inicio por la necesidad de generar ingreso para su familia. El negocio consisten en vender ropa como: Pantalones, shores, faldas, vestidos, blusas, ropa de niños, ropa interior, toallas. Etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo para la venta de ropa al crédito y al contado a clientes fijos y eventuales,  el G.S. la Montañita agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es  Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
G.S. La Montañita is made up of four members, three women and a man, mothers and father who are responsible for ten children who are all minors. They are from la Paz Centro, a place located in the west of the country. They are known for being hard-working, responsible, with a drive to improve themselves. They all have different occupations, and they help each other to help their families get ahead, and also their businesses, meeting every payment on time, to obtain the benefit of a group loan. 
Thanks to her drive to get ahead, the coordinator is Marlene, and her occupation is the sale of new clothing. She is a street vendor and also sells by request. She has had this occupation for five years, which she started because of the need to generate an income for her family. The business consists in selling clothing such as: pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, blouses, children’s clothing, underwear, towels, etc. She tends to her business ten hours a day, offering her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital for the sale of clothing through credit and cash to fixed and new clients. G.S. la Montañita is grateful for the help that Kiva investors bring to people of scarce resources and poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to be able to have decent work.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing such as: pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, blouses, children’s clothing, underwear, towels, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de ganado repasto desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus producto en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para al compra de un ternero y así poder continuar con la crianza para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Ana, who is 48 years old, lives in a house that she owns with her life partner. Her occupation has been farming corn and breeding cattle for 20 years. She sells her products in different markets located close to her home. She is asking for a loan to purchase a calf and be able to continue breeding to have a better economic income.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
Fredelyn is a 49 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living and be able to help her husband in providing for her children needs, she wants to improve their living condition, so she needs to increase her income. Fredelyn decided to borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for corn plants to produce a good harvest and have a good quality of corn to sell in the market that will generate more income.

Fredelyn plan for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her children education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her corn plants.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie, 37, is married and has three children to provide for. As the head of the family, he wants what is the best for his family, so he wants to increase his income. He decided to borrow a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle transport business so that he can serve more passengers to generate more income. Ronnie plans to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Salvacion is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school. Salvacion has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 20 years. Salvacion requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients for her food production business. Salvacion would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Analyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, él se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, hoy se dedica a la comercialización de sorbetes, paletas, helados desde hace 4 años,vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pan y helados por mayor y así poder seguir con sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Guillermo, who is 33 years old, lives in a house that he owns with his life partner and his daughter. He works in the sale of sweet bread and has worked in the sale of sorbets, popsicles, and ice cream for 4 years. He has worked as a street vendor in different neighborhoods, and has many clients. With the sales he makes he manages to settle some household expenses. He is asking for a loan for the purchase of more bread and ice cream at wholesale, and to be able to continue with sales to obtain a better profit.

loans.use: to purchase bread, sorbets, popsicles, and ice cream at wholesale.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 66 years old and is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Florenda requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, bananas, bamboo skewers, etc.

Florenda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Florenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, bananas, bamboo skewers, etc.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su cónyugue y su menor hijo de 10 años, en una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Wilson se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Wilson espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is 32 years old, he lives with his wife and his 10 year old son in a rural zone in the district of Callayuc with is located in the province of Cutervo, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. The inhabitants in this district work mainly in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.
Wilson works breeding and selling small animals, such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, among others. His business is located in his home. He has 15 years of experience in this business, and has good personal and professional references in the area. The loan he asks for will be used to purchase a larger amount of animals, such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and hens, among others, as well as buying balanced feed to fatten them up. With this, Wilson hopes to offer a better product to his clients, which will allow him to generate a larger income and therefore increase his quality of life and of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys, and also balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Edenilson Edgardo

texts.es: Edenilson es una persona de 37 años de edad quien vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus  dos hijos, una niña de 2 años  y un varón de  3 meses de edad. Edenilson es un hombre responsable que con el afán de sacar adelante a su familia se gana la vida en una empresa cercana a su vivienda, desde hace 4 años, por lo que se siente feliz de llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  El piso de la vivienda de Edenilson es bastante rustico, y es por ello que se acumula polvo, lo que está causando enfermedades respiratorias a sus hijos, además desea instalar ventanas para mayor seguridad de su familia, es por ello que ha decidido solicitar a FUSAI un crédito el cual invertirá en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, ventanas y  arena para instalar ventanas y ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en: Edenilson is 37 years old, and lives in his own home with his wife and two children, a two-year-old girl and a three-month-old boy. Edenilson is a responsible man with the drive to help his family get ahead. For four years, he has made a living in a company close to his home, which is why he feels happy to bring the daily bread to his home. The floor in Edenilson’s house is rusty and therefore accumulates dust, which is causing respiratory illnesses in his children. He also wants to install windows to increase the safety of his family. It is for this reason that he has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan, which he will invest in: brick flooring, cement, windows, and sand, to install windows and brick flooring in his house.

loans.use: to invest in: brick flooring, cements, windows, and sand to install windows and brick flooring in his house.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos desde hace 7 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por su buen producto y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mariscos, camarones, langostas etc. todo por mayor  y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 35, lives in his own house with his family.  He has been selling seafood for seven years.  His business is located at his house.  He has a lot of customers because of his good product.  With the sales that he makes he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy shellfish, shrimp, and lobster, etc.  He will buy everything wholesale in order to be able to have better profits.

loans.use: to buy shellfish, shrimp, and lobster, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 61 years old and has seven children.  Rosana is married and has one child who is in school.

Rosana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosana has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: G.s. Rios De Achote Group

texts.es:
El G.S Ríos de Achote, está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras con ocho hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias de Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Estas mujeres tienen diferentes actividades económicas como venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, salón de belleza, se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar, en la actualidad luchan día a día para poder brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es Geronima y tiene por actividad económica el servicio de salón de belleza ubicado en su casa de habitación clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios  El objetivo del crédito es surtir su negocio con productos como: tintes, pinturas de uñas, planchas de cabello, secadoras, tijeras, rollos, tenazas, acetonas, algodón, toallas, estuches de pie etc Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos  G.S. Ríos de Achote agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The G.S Ríos de Achote group has three members. They are single mothers with eight children between them. They are from Achuapa. This area is located in the north of the region. These women have different business activities like selling shoes and  clothes and a beauty salon. They are hard-working and responsible and they're willing to make self-improvements. 
Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they could not study. Currently, they are fighting every day to offer better opportunities to their children. 
Thanks to her efforts and desire to make progress, the coordinator is Geronima. She has a beauty salon located in her home with steady and walk-in customers. She dedicates eight hours to her business every day. The objective of the loan is to supply her business with products like dye, nail polish, flat irons, hair dryers, scissors, curlers, tongs, acetone, towels, and boxes. Since they will be able to make better earnings soon, the group acknowledges that the assistance offered by Kiva lenders to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua will help them to have respectable work.

loans.use: purchase basic materials for her beauty salon like dyes, hair dryers, scissors, etc

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es: Carlos de 32 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor quien vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 6 años de edad quien gracias al apoyo de sus padres se encuentra estudiando. Carlos trabaja en una empresa distribuidora de golosinas como vendedor  desde hace tres años y gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Carlos quiere ampliar su casa por lo que ha decidido construir un  nuevo cuarto que le permita tener una mejor comodidad para lo cual pide a FUSAI un crédito que le permita invertir en: lamina, arena, cemento, hierro, ladrillo y grava para construir un cuarto dormitorio.
texts.en: Carlos, who is 32 years old, is an entrepreneurial man who lives in a house he owns with his wife and his six-year-old son, who thanks to his parents' support is currently in school. For three years, Carlos has worked as a salesperson in a company that distributes candy, and thanks to his effort and hard work has managed to help his family get ahead. Carlos wants to expand his home, which is why he has decided to build a new bedroom which will give him more comfort, which is why he asks FUSAI for a loan which will allow him to invest in: metal sheets, sand, cement, iron, brick, and gravel to build a bedroom.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, sand, cement, iron, brick, and gravel to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 12 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia ya cuenta con clientes establecidos, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no tiene de suficiente capital esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción necesarios y pago de mano de obra y asi puedan vivir mas seguros
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and lives in a house she owns with her family.  She has worked for 12 years selling seafood.  Her business is located in her home and she has an established customer base.  Thanks to the sales she makes, she is able to meet some of her household expenses.  

She wants to improve her home by building a perimeter wall in the location shown in the photograph, but she does not have enough capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary construction materials and to pay laborers so that her family can live more safely.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary construction materials and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 21 years old.
She lives in a wooden house with her young husband, her parents and her little sister. Her family owns 2 hectares of cassava fields, 2 hectares of rice fields and 8 pigs.

In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreyleak makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, fertilizer for the fields and food for the pigs. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk, pay for dyeing and preparation of the loom.

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee una tienda y vende ropa desde hace 13 años,  su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 47 years old, lives in a house she owns with her husband and her daughter. She has owned a store and sold clothing for 13 years. Her business is located in her home. She has many clients, especially her neighbors. With her sales, she manages to settle some household expenses. She is asking for a loan for the purchase of soup, eggs, bulk grains, sodas, candy, sweet bread, etc., and therefore be able to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soup, eggs, bulk grains, sodas, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Estrella Resplandeciente Group

texts.es:
La coordinadora del grupo ¨Estrella Resplandeciente¨, está dirigido por Teresa, ella es una mujer soltera,  emprendedora, trabaja con los préstamos de ADIM, y lleva 9 ciclos. Es un ejemplo de lucha para muchas personas, a sus 62 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y tiene un taller de costura en su domicilio, este negocio lo inicio hace 30 años, con ayuda de un préstamo que le hizo su hermano. Desea el crédito para invertirlo en la tela de la marca sincatex, botones, zypers, repuestos para maquinas. Con las ganancias que obtuvo del crédito anterior compro materiales para componer su casa. Desea ahorrar para comprar una maquina nueva y producir más. 
Las otras socias son Ana de 23 años, vende cosméticos de manera ambulante en la comunidad, Anita de 27 años, vende ropa usada, plata y perfumes; y Maria Elena quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
The coordinator of the group of “Estrella Resplandeciente” is Teresa. She is single and entrepreneurial, she works with ADIM loans and is on her ninth cycle. She is an example of hard work for a lot of people. At 62, she works in the sale of cosmetics and has a sewing workshop in her home. She started this business 30 years ago, with the help of a loan from her brother. She wants the credit to invest in fabric of the sincatex brand, buttons, zippers, and replacements for machines. With the profits she obtained from the previous loan, she bought materials to repair her home. She wishes to save to buy a new machine and produce more.
The other members are Ana, who is 23, and sells cosmetics as a street vendor in the community; Anita, who is 27, who sells used clothing, silver, and perfumes; and Maria Elena, who works in the sale of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to invest in fabric of the sincatex brand, buttons, zippers, and replacements for machines.

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es: Marta de 43 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra sacar adelante a sus dos hijas, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is a 43-year-old single mother who lives in her own house with her two daughters. She makes a living selling clothes traveling through different markets. She has a lot of regular clients because of the quality of the clothing and the good prices. 

With her earnings she is able to support her daughters. She is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale clothing to be able to continue her sales and in that way have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 42 years old and single.

Anita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle. Anita has been raising cattle for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es: Blanca de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de obras artesanales como las que muestra en la fotografía desde hace 24 años, se ha hecho de mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar arcilla, pintura y barniz, y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Blanca is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has been working making and selling handicraft items as shown in the photo for 24 years. She has created a large clientele due to the quality of her work and with her profits she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow her to buy clay, paint and varnish so she can continue with her work and have more income.

loans.use: to buy clay, paint and varnish.

loans.name: Alma Mirasol

texts.es: Doña Alma de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por las zonas aledañas de donde ella reside, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Alma is 50 years old and lives in a house she owns with her parents.  She works selling clothing as a street vendor in the areas around where she lives.  She has many fixed customers thanks to the quality of the clothes she sells and her good prices.  Her sales help meet some of her household's expenses.
