She is requesting this loan to purchase more clothing at wholesale to continue with her sales so she can improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es:
Giovanni es un hombre de 30 años de edad, que desde el año 2007 atiende su propio negocio de compra y recargas de tintas para impresoras.
Todo este negocio empezó en  su juventud donde laboraba en un trabajo similar, adquirió experiencia y conocimiento del tema.

Actualmente trabaja solo, los altos costos de insumos y la falta de capital han sido los principales impedimentos del progreso de este hombre que a pesar de todo sigue firme con su negocio. 

Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda se ha convertido en su prioridad no solo se mantiene a él, tiene pareja y unos padres por los cuales velar, su negocio hasta el momento le ha dado para mantenerse y nada más, pero si aumentara su producción podría ganas un mejor capital, para adecuar sus instalaciones y buscar nuevos clientes.

Giovanni quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de tintas, para duplicar su producción.
texts.en:
Giovanni is a 30-year-old man, who since 2007 has attended to his own business buying and refilling ink for printers. His entire business started in his youth, when he worked in a similar job and gained experience and knowledge on the subject. Currently, he works alone, and the high costs of inputs and lack of capital has been the major impediments to his progress, who despite everything remains firm with his business. 

His priority has become improving the conditions of his household, which not only contains himself but his partner and their parents to look after. His business has until now given him enough to get by and nothing more, but if he increased his production, he could gain more capital to update his facilities and look for new customers. 

Giovanni wants to request a loan to buy ink, in order to duplicate his production.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of ink for the printer.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Dans le quartier de Tokoin vit Yawavi avec ses quatre enfants. Mariée et âgée de 39 ans, Yawavi est revendeuse de maïs et gagne son revenu journalier grâce à cette activité. Yawavi stock sa marchandise dans sa maison et cède ensuite aux clients qui viennent en chercher. Yawavi s’approvisionne au marché six fois par mois. Pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de maïs Yawavi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer un revenu favorable pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawavi, age 39, is a married mother to four children who lives in the district of Tokoin. A reseller of maize, she earns a living on a daily basis through this activity. 

Yawavi stocks up at the market six times per month. She stores her merchandise in her home, and sells to customers who come by to make a purchase. 

Yawavi is seeking this loan to buy sacks of maize. She hopes to make a good profit and help her family to thrive.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesus

texts.es:
Rodrigo es padre de 1 hija y es casado. Aparte de su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años. 

Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

El y su familia viven en zona rural de Medellin en el cual en muchos casos es difícil tener servicios financieros.

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos de plátano.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Rodrigo sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.
 
¡Impacte la vida de Rodrigo y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Rodrigo is the father of one daughter and is married. Apart from his family, he has been making a living from agriculture for 15 years. He learned this business empirically, that is through practice and by observing others. He and his family live in a rural area of Medellín in which it is often difficult to get access to financial services.

He plants to use his loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, pest control products and fertiliser to maintain and support his banana fields. Thanks to this loan, the economy and quality of life of his family will improve, as they will be able to have a higher income.

Rodrigo dreams to finish legalising his land ownership and so to have full control of his land. Impact the life of Rodrigo and his family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, pest control products and fertiliser to maintain and support his banana fields

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un molino de nixtamal desde hace 2 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos
texts.en: The young woman's face has been blurred in the photo because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has owned a corn mill for 2 years which she operates from her home. She has many clients, especially women who make tortillas, as they come to her to grind their corn. From what she earns, she manages to cover her household expenses. She lives in her own house with her life partner and daughter. She is asking for a loan to buy what she needs for her mill such as: belts, disks, blades, etc. This will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy belts, disks, blades, etc.

loans.name: Laylo

texts.ru: Ее зовут Лайло. Ей 23 года. Она живет вместе с родителями. Лайло работает продавщицей на базаре. Она продает свежие фрукты. Лайло за счет этой деятельности обеспечивает родителей. На данный момент ее отец болеет. Лекарства стоят дорого. Лайло собрала деньги, но их не хватает на все лекарства. Лайло обратилась за заемными средствами, чтобы обеспечить отца необходимыми лекарствами для ускорения восстановления здоровья отца.
texts.en: This woman is called Laylo. She is 23 years old. She lives with her parents. Laylo works as a vendor at the market. She sells fresh fruit. Laylo provides for her parents through this activity. At the present time her father is sick. Drugs are expensive. Laylo has collected some money, but not enough for all of the drugs. Laylo has applied to borrow some funds in order to provide her father with the drugs necessary to speed up her father's process of recovering his health.

loans.use: to pay for treatment for her father.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Edmundo es un padre de 57 años de edad, emprendedor y dinámico. 
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de jugos de fruta, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que le colabora en las mañanas, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 11 años que lleva funcionando su negocio. 
El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la compra de dos triciclos que le permitan transportar su productos por toda la ciudad, además necesita utensilios de trabajo y surtido de frutas, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer sus alimentos de una mejor manera, abriendo paso para un mejoramiento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe. 

Edmundo, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edmundo is a 57-year-old father. He is enterprising and dynamic. With the aim of generating income to contribute to the household economy, he decided to start his own business selling fruit juices. He has his wife's support who helps him in the mornings. This way, he has managed to pay family and personal expenses for the 11 years that the business has been running. 

The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy two tricycles that allow him to carry his products all over the city. He also needs work utensils and assorted fruits. This will allow him to continue with his work and offer his food in a better way, opening a step to an improvement in sales and hence on the earnings he receives.

Edmundo, with his spirit of improvement and his projection towards achieving his objectives, is setting the goal of expanding his business to have the capacity to serve a greater amount of customers, thus improving profitability of the facility to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two tricycles, work utensils, and assorted fruits.

loans.name: Mercy Yoheli

texts.es:
Mercy, mayor de edad soltera y con 1 hija, originaria de Tierra Alta, es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la compra y venta de ropa nueva el cual lo realiza ambulante y también en su casa, 

Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, también con muchos deseos de superación personal, tiene clientes tanto al crédito como al contado que recupera quincenal o mensualmente.

Inicio este negocio con fondos propios debido a la necesidad de trabajar y el deseo de mejorar los ingresos en su hogar, tuvo el compromiso de salir adelante con el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ha realizado durante 2 años en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, uno de sus sueños es poder llegar a tener un gran negocio. 

Desde muy temprano ella se levanta a abrir su venta para empezar a vender y poder sacar adelante a su familia. 

El objetivo de este crédito es para poder comprar más mercadería como; zapatos, ropa interior, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros etc. 

Mercy se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo económico que Kiva le brinda a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Mercy, legally of age, is single and has one daughter. She is from Tierra Alta, and is the manager and owner of her small business, which consists of buying and selling new clothes. She carries out her business both on the streets and at her house. 

She is a very hard working and responsible woman, with many dreams of personal improvement. She has customers who pay on credit or with cash.  For the credit customers, she collects payments on a biweekly or monthly basis. She started this business with her own funds, as she needed to work and wanted to improve her household income.

She is committed to getting ahead with effort. She has continued with the work for two years, during which she demonstrated her responsibility in timely payments in appropriate formats. 

One of her dreams is to be able to have a big business. 

She gets up to open her shop and starts selling from the very early hours, in order to get ahead with her family. 

The objective of this loan is to purchase more merchandise such as shoes, underwear, cosmetics, plastic product among others. Mercy feels very grateful for the financial support that Kiva has granted for the people of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as shoes, underwear, cosmetics, plastic products among others.

loans.name: Concepcion De Maria

texts.es: Concepción de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo,  ella se dedica desde hace 18 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Concepción is 40 years old and lives with her husband in a house they own.  She has worked for 18 years making and selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas].  Her business is located in her home, which is in a busy area.  Her sales help her meet some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase chicharrones, cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients so she can continue her work, which generates a good income.

loans.use: to purchase chicharrones, cheese, beans,  corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Felicia

texts.es:
Ana se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como una mujer amable y carismática, con 32 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de alimentos que comenzó hace aproximadamente 7 años; allí tiene la ventaja de tener una muy buena ubicación, pues se encuentra en una zona transitada.

Su experiencia en la cocina la obtuvo con su madre, por lo que su conocimiento en el manejo de lo culinario es amplio. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor de queso, carne, arroz, entre otros, así tendrá más variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es pagar la educación de sus hijos y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old, and her customers characterize her as a friendly, charismatic woman.  She manages her own business, and began selling food about seven years ago.  Fortunately, she has the advantage of a having a good location in a busy area. She gained her experience in the kitchen from her mother, so she has a broad knowledge of culinary management.

She is requesting the support of this loan to purchase whole sale stock such as cheese, meat, rice, and other products.  In this way, she will have a wider variety of food to offer her customers, and satisfy their tastes and needs, which will generate better sales and income so that she can keep striving to meet her medium-term goals: paying for her children’s education, and generating more income from her business in order to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase whole sale stock such as cheese, meat, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Hernan Dario

texts.es:
Hernan, de 52 años, inicio con un negocio de fotografía hace aproximadamente 30 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus hijos y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una camara nueva de fotografía.
Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a sus hijos brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Hernan para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Hernan is 52 years old. He started a photography business approximately 30 years ago in an effort to find an activity that would generate income to survive.

Currently, he finds motivation to work tirelessly for his children and offer them the best for their life and development.

He is asking for a loan to buy a new camera for photography. With this loan he can sustain his business and give his children a better quality of life.

Support Hernan so that he can continue with his activity!

loans.use: to purchase a new camera for photography.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, ropa entre otras cosas desde hace 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 39-year-old single mother who lives in her own house with her two sons. 

She has made a living selling electrical appliances and clothing among other things for 3 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many clients because of the quality of her products and the good prices. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale products to be able to continue selling since that is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances, wholesale food

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una tienda desde hace 41 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and lives with her husband in a house they own.  She has owned a store for 41 years.  It is located in her home and she has many customers, especially her neighbors.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, drinks, snacks, sweet bread, and other items so that she can earn more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, drinks, snacks, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes actualmente vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco pequeños hijos en Tiraque, Cochabamba. Su casa es de construcción rustica hecha de adobe y  techo de calamina. La señora Lourdes debido a varios factores de la vida no pudo estudiar, pero con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo lucha para que sus hijos tengan la educación que ellos no tuvieron. La señora Lourdes se dedica a la producción agrícola, entre los principales cultivos están la papa, papaliza, trigo y cebolla para la venta. Esta gestión tiene la intención de aumentar la producción, ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para capital de operación para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y semillas. Lourdes es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, con esta ayuda ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos en beneficio de su familia
texts.en:
Lourdes lives together with her husband and their five small children in Tiraque, Cochabamba.  Their home is built from adobe and has a corrugated iron roof.  Lourdes was not able to attend school due to various factors, but she is making an effort and working hard so that her children can get the education she was not able to.  

Lourdes is a farmer who grows potatoes, ulloco tubers, wheat, and onion to sell.  She wants to increase her production, so she is requesting a loan to have working capital to purchase agricultural supplies like manure and seeds.  Lourdes is a responsible and hardworking person.  With this help, she will be able to increase her income, which will benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like manure and seeds to increase her production and her income, which will benefit her family.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 51 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Milagros has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Milagros has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Kellys Johanna

texts.es: Kellys, inspirada en su deseo de ser una trabajadora independiente y tener su propio negocio, decidió vender joyas elaboradas en acero, plata, relojes y accesorios, los cuales comercializa en una isla ubicada dentro de un centro comercial en el municipio de Soledad. Sus clientes son visitantes del lugar quienes gracias a su buen servicio y productos de excelente calidad, se han logrado mantener fidelizados.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir sus vitrinas exhibidoras con nuevos diseños de joyería, relojes y accesorios.  Esta inversión pretende incrementar las utilidades al realizar sus compras al por mayor, así mismo logra mejorar su capital de trabajo.   Kellys de 34 años es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y su meta de es mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecer un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Kellys, inspired by her wish to become an independent worker and to have her own business, decided to sell jewelry made of steel, silver, watches, and accessories, which are sold in a kiosk located in a commercial center in the city of Soledad. Her clients are visitors to the area who, thanks to her good service and excellent quality products, she has been able to build loyalty. 

Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to supply her glass exhibit cabinets with new designs of jewelry, watches, and accessories. With this investment, she hopes to increase her earnings to make her purchases wholesale, in this way to be able to increase her work capital. 

Kellys is 34 years old, mother of two young children, and her goal is to increase her income to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to stock her display cabinets with new designs of jewelry, watches, and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Esneider Andres

texts.es:
Esneider de 20 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vida sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Esneider is 20 years old. He has earned the affection of all of his neighbours thanks to his kindness and good sense of humour. He loves his family, which is the main driving force to strive every day and generate a livelihood to survive. 

Even if he did not have enough resources to start his business, this was not an obstacle to fulfil his dream of becoming a businessman. With little money this man opened a grocery store.   

His dreams have no limits. That is why he is requesting a loan he will invest to buy a selection of family's basic goods to stock his business. 

He hopes he can improve his financial condition, have a life without having to worry about money and guarantee his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy a selection of family's basic goods to stock his business.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Guiado por el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda José se volvió en l año 1969 un comerciante independiente, vendiendo ropa principalmente, toda la vende en un carro, el cual a lo largo de los años no ha sufrido modificaciones, este negocio le ha servido para levantar su familia conformada por dos hijos y su esposa, sigue trabajando de la misma manera, pero los tiempos cambian las personas no confían mucho en sus prendas debido a la fachada de su puesto de trabajo lo que ha generado un declive en las ventas.

Josep para hacer de frente a este problema quiere solicitar un préstamo para realizar una adecuación total a su puesto de venta, creando una buena imagen que contraste con la calidad de sus productos, el capital restante lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para hombre y niño.
texts.en:
Led by a desire to improve the condition of his housing, in 1969 Jose returned to working as an independent trader, mainly selling clothing. He sells everything from a cart, which has stayed the same throughout the years. 

This business has allowed him to raise his family, made up of his spouse and two children, so he continues to work in the same way. But times are changing, and people no long trust his garments due to the appearance of his workplace which has caused a decline in his sales.

To fix this problem, Jose wishes to request a loan to totally rework his workplace, creating a good image which will match the quality of his products. He will invest anything left over in clothing for men and children.

loans.use: to make improvements to his work place and to buy a selection of clothing for men and children.

loans.name: Arbey

texts.es:
Arbey es un hombre de 51 años de edad, alegre, contento que se goza la vida, tiene una hermosa familia conformada por dos hijos y su esposa, se dedica a la venta de calzado, en la zona del centro de la ciudad de Medellín.

Pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda son los objetivos diarios de este hombre que hoy quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de calzado, el motivo es las fiesta que se avecinan como lo son el día de padres, la feria de flores, cree mucho en sus habilidades por ello solicita el préstamo ya que esta seguro de pagarlo puntualmente pues dejara una puerta abierta para cuando necesite otro apoyo
texts.en:
Arbey is a happy 51 year old man, who is very content with his life. He has a lovely family made up of his spouse and two children. He sells footwear for a living in the center of the city of Medellín.

His daily goals are to pay for his children's education and to improve their home, so he is requesting a loan to buy shoes, as there are festivals coming up, such as Fathers' Day and the Festival of Flowers. 

He strongly believes in himself because he is sure that he can repay the loan punctually, which will leave the door open for when he needs support in future.

loans.use: to buy a selection of footwear.

loans.name: Byron Dario

texts.es: Byron de 36 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maicillo y maíz, ya tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro con las ventas que el realiza es como logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Byron está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, entre otras cosas para tener un buen cultivo, el es un hombre muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Byron, 36, lives with his life partner and his three children in their own house.  He works in agriculture and mainly grows millet and corn.  He has ten years' experience in the trade and uses his income from sales to cover some of the household expenses.

Byron is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents and other supplies for a good harvest.  He is a very responsible man with a good credit record.  He promises to pay back the loan while giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents and other supplies.

loans.name: Zymyrat

texts.ru: Зымырат, 55 лет, не замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование, работает заведующей кафедрой в педагогическом институте, получая заработную плату ежемесячно 18,595 сом (KGS). Зымырат живет одна, она решила в этом году сделать дома ремонт и утеплить дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку обоев, краски, кафеля и утепление пола в доме.  Свои доходы в дальнейшем Зымырат планирует вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Zymyrat is 55 years old, single, with no children.  She has a higher education and works as the head of a department in a pedagogical institute, where she makes 18,595 som (KGS) per month.  Zymyrat lives alone and has decided to renovate and insulate her home.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some wallpapers, paints, tiles and some floor insulation materials.  In the future, she is planning to use her income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wallpapers, paints, tiles as well as floor insulation materials to renovate her home.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 23 years old and lives in a wooden house with her two parents and her young brother. She just came back from Thailand in order to help her parents. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields. 

She now works for Soieries du Mekong, where her mother, who trained her, is also a weaver. Soieries du Mékong is a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sophy makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family's expenses. 

Thanks to the loan, she will buy silk and pay for dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for dyeing and loom preparation

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y además vende ropa, se dedica a ambas actividades desde hace mas de 5 años, vende los pollos en los pueblos aledaños, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos por mayor y concentrado para poder continuar con la crianza y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elida is a 40-year-old single mother who lives in her own house with her son who works and helps her economically. 

She makes a living breeding and selling chickens and also selling clothing. She has done both activities for more than 5 years. She sells the chickens in the bordering towns. 

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale chickens and pellets to be able to continue raising them and in this way have better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale chickens and pellets

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1978 and is living in small town of hospitable and custom people. She is divorced and has a child. She is responsible, hardworking, communicative business woman. 

She retails women, men, kids wear and summer shoes. She finds a good place for retail and has permanent customers for her goods. She started her business with small items and now she is proud to achieve such levels. 

Recently she appeals to IMON and Kiva to buy additional goods to her working capital at coming season. She hopes her business will be efficient and she could earn money to ensure her child with necessary things. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to add to her working capital

loans.name: Los Exitosos De Laura Caller Group

texts.es: Milagros, es socia del grupo Los exitosos de Laura Caller  donde cumple la función de tesorera, tiene 40 años de edad madre de tres hijos dos mayores de edad y el último de 12 años en edad escolar,Milagros se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo donde dedica de 4 a 6 horas diarias,sus principales clientes son vecinas y gente amiga que ha logrado conocer mediante este negocio,Milagros se siente orgullosa de tener este negocio ya que le ha permitido conocer y tener trato directo con el cliente,Milagros agradece el préstamo que ha logrado conseguir ya que la ayudará a comprar más mercadería como perfumes,joyas, cosméticos,y así poder implementar su negocio que ha puesto en su casa,ya que hay personas que la buscan por el buen producto y atención que reciben de ella, Milagros agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza, a pesar de no concerla y dice Gracias Kiva por el apoyo brindado les aseguro que no les vamos a defraudar.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of the group "Los exitosos de Laura Caller" where she fulfills the role of treasurer. 

She is 40 years old, mother of three children (two adults and a 12-year-old). Milagros makes a living selling beauty products from a catalogue, dedicating 4-6 hours per day. Her main clients are neighbors and friend who she has gotten to know through this business. Milagros feels proud of having this business since it has allowed her to meet and have direct agreements with the client. 

Milagros is grateful for the loan that has allowed her to get her since is will help her to buy more merchandise like perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, and in this way implement the business that has been in her house. Since there are people looking for good products and the attention they receive from her. Milagros is grateful to the Kiva investors for the support and confidence, despite not knowing her she says Thank you, Kiva for the support provided I assure you that I am not going to disappoint.

loans.use: to start her business in the purchase of perfumes, jewelry, and more.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is from Moalboal, Cebu where she and her husband lives. She is engaged in hog raising for ten years now while her husband is into fishing. 

She is asking a loan to buy piglets and feed to sustain her business. With enough feed, Pacita will not resort to feeding her hogs with over ripe fruits and leftover food. In the future, Pacita's dream is to buy a multicab (a kind of custom-made vehicle that can accommodate up to 20 passengers) for additional income.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 37 years old and single. 

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Victoria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, beers, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Cecilia is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Cecilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa works hard to support her family. Felipa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Felipa requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Felipa has been in this business for 15 years now.

Felipa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nelisiwe

texts.en:
Nelisiwe is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Instituteand was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is her story:1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying a Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration. I like Marketing  Management and I enjoy doing consciousness classes. They help me to build my self-esteem, and know more about nature such as living and non-living things and how we should support nature. 
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
I would like to work in good company that will help me to grow as a person. I will like to work for the Rand Water Board. I will teach people how to save water in order for all of us to have water. I would be happy to travel for my job.
3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born in Mpumalanga and raised alone by my mother because my grandmother was working as a domestic worker. My mother battled when raising me as she was still at school. She decided not to have anymore children. I am therefore an only child. When I finished high school,  I moved to Johannesburg to stay with my grandmother and I worked for a few years then I decided to join the Maharishi Institute. I always wanted more in life, and I want to be a successful  business woman. In 2011 I was blessed with the baby girl, I named here Lisedi (meaning light of my life). I want to provide for my family and I don’t want to see them suffer.
4.	What do you like to do in your spare time? I like to go out with my friends or stay at home and read a book or watch movies. Then before I go to sleep, I meditate. On weekends I sometimes take my child for games and eat out.
5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? A Kiva loan will help  me with transport fare as I struggle to find money for the whole month. It will change my attendance as I will always be at school and not find myself in debt.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is 52 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cherly has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Cherly requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Cherly has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cherly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Manuela de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas,  ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y de frijol desde hace 15 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas etc. y así poder continuar con sus cultivos para tener  mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en:
Manuela, age 52, lives in her own home with her life partner and her two daughters. Her main business is growing corn and beans, and for the last fifteen years, she has sold her products in the various markets near her home. With what she earns, she is managing to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides and more. This will allow her to continue growing her crops and earn more more money.

loans.use: buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicide, and more

loans.name: Amrulo

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлен Амруло, которому 52 года. Он проживает на районе А.Джоми вместе с семьей. Амрулло много лен работал на чужбине. Он был вынужден уехать, чтобы прокормить жену и четверых детей. Амруло работал в одном из рынков в России, но из-за финансовой ситуации на рынке Российской Федерации, потерял работу. Весь опыт работы, который он накопил за эти годы, в чужой стране, он все это собрал и хочет открыть свой бизнес в Родном краю. Амруло уже нашел место для бизнеса (на фотографии) и ему осталось только приобрести товар. За счет заемных средств он планирует привести одежды для дальнейшей продажи. Амруло верит, что его поддержат в начинаниях.
texts.en: Amrulo, featured in this photo, is 52 years old.  He and his family live in the A. Jomi district of Tajikistan.  For many years, Amrulo used to work abroad.  He had no choice but to leave his country to feed his wife and four children.  Amrulo used to work as a market vendor in Russia, but because of the financial situation of the Russian market where he worked, he lost his job.  However, he has retained a good work experience from working abroad for so many years and he now wants to open his own business in his native country.  Amrulo has already found a retail outlet (shown in the photo) and now only needs to purchase merchandise.  He is planning to use his loan to bring in clothes for further resale.  He is confident that he will receive some support in this new endeavor.

loans.use: to buy clothes and start a new business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a single mother with an eighteen year old son from the town of Alcantara, Cebu. Dina have been dependent in her hog raising for an income. This has been her business for the last ten years. She would expand her business but she needs an additional capital. 

She is asking a loan from CEVI to buy feed, piglets and pay for the tuition fees of her son. In the future, Dina dreamed of seeing her business becoming sustainable with an increased revenue.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife previously accessed a 19000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.  

She would like to apply for another 19000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business. She is happy with the increased demand of her products especially now that school year has started in the Phils. She is thanking God and and you for your good heart and the financial assistance that will be given her.

Marife dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will become professionals someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carmela is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Carmela has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Carmela requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Carmela has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Carmela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 67 years old and widowed with four children.  

Carmencita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmencita requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carmencita has been in pig fattening for 18 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Carmencita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a bag-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her bag-making for her bag-making business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving her bags.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is the responsible mother of five children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her elder son has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 22 years. Her son is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her son needs to do maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. 

Therefore Khalida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.  With the help of this loan, Khalida's son can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Khalida  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her son's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Khalida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her son's taxi

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada works hard to support her family. Diosdada is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Diosdada requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials and ingredients for her food production business.

Diosdada has been in this business for 9 years now.

Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her three children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, and her son has been running a mobile shop for past 12 years. 
Fareeda's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore Nasreen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that her son can earn more profitable income to manage his business and house hold.
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's mobile phone accessories business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of chicharon to sell to her customers.

Grace has been in this business for 16 years now.

Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of chicharon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 49 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Guadalupe has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Guadalupe requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Guadalupe has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Guadalupe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 56 years old and widow with nine children, one of whom is in school.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries o sell.

Alma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from manicure.

Alma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.   

Monina supports the family through her food-vending business in the Philippines.

She took out an educational loan for her son Christian, who is 15 years old. He is the fifth of six children in the family and is studying for a bachelor of science degree in business administration. Christian is currently in the first of a four-year course of study.

Monina is borrowing PHP 11,000 to pay the tuition fees of her son for the first semester of the 2015-16 school year.

Christian plans to help his parents after graduation by earning income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 49 years old and married with three children.

Melinda is in the agricultural business, planting ornamental plants in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like flower pots, fertilizers, etc. for her business.

Melinda has been planting ornamental plants for 20 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Melinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like flower pots, fertilizers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille works hard to support her family. Lucille is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lucille requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Lucille has been in this business for 10 years now.

Lucille would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rubandi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rubandi, one of Ruma agents. Rubandi lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java, located about five hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He sells mobile airtime credits for his community. Rubandi joined Ruma since 2014. He knew Ruma from one of sales executive who came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try to become an entrepreneur in technology, as well as increase his saving and give more contribution to his community. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Rubandi sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Rubandi improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Rubandi is the one who is seen in the photo. He is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment service for his village community.

loans.name: Toheed

texts.en:
Toheed is a 40-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Toheed's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore Toheed has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his fruit business.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 30 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons and one daughter. Her children are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 7 years and is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Rani is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Rani is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Miski

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Miski, one of Ruma agents. Miski lives in Cirebon, a village area in West Java, located about five hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his child. He sells mobile airtime credits for his community. Miski joined Ruma since 2014. He knew Ruma from one of sales executive who came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try to become an entrepreneur in technology, as well as increase his saving and give more contribution to his community. 

With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Miski sees improvements in his business. As the business grows, he is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Miski improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Miski is the one who is seen in the photo. He is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his village community.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a 49 years old, married and has three children. As a mother she wants what is the best for the family, to achieve this she must increase her family income so that she can give a good living of the family. She decided to take a loan to buy more stocks for selling and increase her store inventory that will generate greater income.

Marisa plan for the future to expand her business from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for selling

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tuvieron cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y uno de 11 años que estudia en escuela, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella. 
Doña Martha es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así ganarse la vida, ella desde hace seis años empezó un negocio de venta de zapatillas por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana y no tiene horarios fijos para salir, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. Así ella se gana la vida y no tiene que depender de nadie.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y sandalias ya que tiene varios pedidos. Lleva más de 3 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Trabajando Juntas credit group meets every two weeks in the canton of Rocafuerte, a location known all over the country for its delicious sweets prepared by locals.

Martha lives in Rocafuerte.  She is 42 years old, separated, and has four children.  Three of them are adults and one is 11 years old and attends school.  Three of her children live with her.

Martha is a woman who has always liked to work and make a living.  Six years ago, she started a business selling shoes door to door by catalog.  She works three or four days a week and does not have a fixed work schedule.  She offers items on credit and collects every week.  This is how she earns her living.  She does not have to depend on anyone.

She is requesting this loan to purchase shoes and sandals since she has several orders.  She has been a member of the credit group for three years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to give her family the best possible.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: Jamshed is a bright man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1986. He is living in a small town with his family. He is married and has one child. He is a student at the University. He studies law and likes his major. He is well known among students and studies with excellence. He wants to graduate with his education to be a good specialist. He has a dream someday to be a professional and famous in his major. He applied to IMON and Kiva and asked for a loan to pay his higher education costs. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Elbert

texts.en:
Elbert is 25 years old and single. As a son he always aims to help his parents with their living. So he is engaged in a transport business to earn an income. He needs to increase his income so that he can provide for his parents' needs. He availed himself of a loan to buy new tires for his motorcycle maintenance so that he can continue to cater for more passengers that will generate greater income.

Elbert's plan for the future is to save money from his business income.

loans.use: to buy new tires for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Madelin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Madelin has been in this business for five years now.

Madelin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 61 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Marylou has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marylou has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora works hard to support her family. Nicanora is married and has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines.

Nicanora requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers.

Nicanora has been in this business for 5 years now.

Nicanora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 34 years old and has four children. Aileen is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Aileen is in the agricultural business in pig fattening in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Aileen has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 45 years old and has five children. Ruth is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ruth has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 30 years old, married and has three children, one currently in school.

Joy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

Joy has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 50-year-old married woman with three children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Beatriz has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

Beatriz has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ma. Merline

texts.en:
Ma. Merline is 33 years old and has three children. Ma. Merline is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Ma. Merline is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Merline requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Merline has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Merline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cumadura Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Hipolita, Pastora María y Nora Isabel) de la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de pulpería, comideria y carniceria; se organizaron hace aproximadamente 6 meses para poder accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. El nombre del Grupo Solidario es en lengua mískita que significa Arcoíris.   

Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitio a Pastora Maria, ampliar el menú de su comideria, comprar insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas y refrescos naturales

Hipólita: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, con cualidades de líder. Tiene 40 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos: 5 son mayores de edad e independientes y 3 adolescente que estudia su secundaria y primaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como albañil. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, vende chiverías y granos básicos en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos e incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This loan group is composed of three women, Hipólita, Pastora María, and Nora Isabel. They are ethnic Miskita women from the town of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who work hard day after day to grow their small businesses. They run a general store, a diner, and a butcher shop. They got together about six months ago so they could access the guaranteed group loans from Pana Pana.  The name of their group means "Rainbow" in the Miskita language.

With their first credit, requested through Pana Pana and financed through Kiva, Pastora María will be able to expand the menu at her diner and buy supplies and ingredients so that she can make her food and natural fruit juices.

Hipólita is the group's coordinator. She's a friendly woman with the qualities of a good leader. She's 40 years old and married, the mother of seven children: five are grown up and independent, and three are adolescents who are in primary and secondary school. Her husband works informally as a bricklayer. With the goal of contributing to the household expenses and her children's education, she sells dairy products and staple grains in space at one of the Bilwi markets. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more merchandise and increase her income. Her goal is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: buy dairy products and staple grains

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 52 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband has been running his own decoration business for 18 years. He husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Robina's husband wants to purchase different kinds of accessories e.g frames, decoration pieces, guilding and other items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for business purpose. Therefore Robina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's decorative accessories business

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is 35 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is married and has six children. Her husband has been working for a public sector organization for many years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shumaila provides sewing services to earn income to contribute to the household. 
She needs such items as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business but due to insufficient funds, she is unable to purchase them. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Shumaila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Dolores requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years now.

Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Suroso

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Suroso. Suroso lives in Kudus, located at east of Semarang, capital of Central Java, 9 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Suroso is happily married. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides electricity bill payment services for his community. He already joined Ruma for a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system; the sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money. Moreover, his community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Suroso is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his communities. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Suroso improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Suroso is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits and electricity bill payment service for his community

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa,  el posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 10 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 47, lives in his own home with his wife. For the last ten years, he has run a small general store out of his home, where he sells a variety of products such as sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, and more. He has a lot of customers thanks to his good prices.

He is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise from wholesale merchants as this is his only source of income, and earning more money helps ensure him a higher quality of life.

loans.use: buy merchandise at wholesale to stock his general store

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 6  hijos, 4 mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Sandra se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, ella de lunes a vienes vende en su casa pero los sábados y domingos pone un puesto en el mercado local en el cual aprovecha los días de feria que es cuando más vende, lleva tres años en este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres para sus ventas. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the loan group Trabajando Juntas (Working Together) meet in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for it's delicious candies that are prepared by locals and recognized throughout the country.

This is where Sandra lives. She is 45 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has six children. Four are grown up, while two, ages 16 and 15, are in high school Her husband is a farmer.

Sandra is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. Monday through Friday, she sells out of her home, but on Saturday and Sunday, she has a stall at a local market where she takes advantage of the fair, when more is sold. She has three years of experience in this work, and through it, she is able to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her sales. She has had three loan cycles in this credit group and she likes the loans because they help her to get ahead. Her goal is to enjoy good health.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie manage a small retail store within her local community.She is 22 years old, married and has two children.She wants to increase her stock of grocery items but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to borrow PHP 7,000. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as seasonings,candies and canned goods to sell.She knows that this amount will enable her to generate better sales and income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as seasonings,candies and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 45 years old, married and has three children to provide. She engaged in a coconut production to earn a living and able to help her husband in providing their children needs. She borrowed a loan to pay for the labor cost in harvesting the coconuts, so that she can get more coconuts to sell that will generate more income that will help her in supplying the needs of her family.

Wilma plan for the future to buy a vehicle for delivery of coconuts to her customers.

loans.use: To pay for the labor cost in harvesting coconuts.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cecilia has been in this business for 23 years now.

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Lucia has been in this business for seven years now.

Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary Gweyn

texts.en:
Mary Gweyn is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.   

Mary Gweyn support the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her son Daffodil, 20 years old and is 1st of 5 children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in the 4th of this 4 year course.

Mary Gweyn is borrowing Php 12,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Daffodil, for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Daffodil plans when he graduates to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay her son's 4th year college tuition fees for his B.Sc. in Business Administration

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
Isidoro es un hombre de 48 años de edad, se separó de su esposa dejándole el hogar para que viviera cómodamente con sus tres hijos, mientras él se construyó un hogar con madera, se dedica a la construcción es oficial de obra, se la pasa reparando y construyendo hogares, aunque no tiene trabajo muy constante, rebusca la manera de generar ingresos pues su mayor sueño es verse construyendo su propio hogar en material (concreto y adobe).

Al tener que invertir sus ahorros en la compra de manera para fabricarse un hogar quedo sin capital para invertir en su negocio, necesita maquinaria y equipo para poder desarrollar su actividad. 

Isidoro quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de herramienta de trabajo, máquina pulidora, corta baldosa, y compra de materiales como cableado y tuberías.
texts.en:
Isidoro is a 48-year-old man. He separated from his wife, leaving her the home so that she could live comfortably with their three children, while he built himself a home out of wood.  He works in construction as a contractor, repairing and building homes, though he doesn't have very consistent work. He is looking for the way to generate income since his greatest dream is to see himself build his own home with concrete and adobe.

When he invested his savings in the purchase of wood to build his home, he was left without capital to invest in his business. He needs machinery and equipment to be able to conduct his business. 

Isodoro wants to request a loan to purchase work tools, a polisher, a tile cutter, and materials like wiring and pipes.

loans.use: to purchase work tools, a polisher, a tile cutter, and materials like wiring and pipes.

loans.name: Frelyn

texts.en:
Frelyn is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Frelyn has a food market business in the Philippines. Frelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan  NWTF  to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

Frelyn has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Frelyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Erlene is married with five children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. 
  
Erlene support the family through her poultry business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her daughter Keziah Rehsh, 17 years old and is 1st of three children in the family, who is studying Physical Theraphy and is currently in the 1st of this 5 year course.

Erlene is borrowing Php 9,000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Keziah Rehsh for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Keziah Rehsh plans, when she graduates to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay 1st year college tuition fees for her daughter in Physical Therapy

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is a responsible mother of 6 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 8 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance to his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Noureen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Noureen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income.  Noureen  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.  Noureen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Quresha

texts.en:
Quresha is a 40-year-old woman and the mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits like apples, bananas, and grapes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Quresha's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But being in an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore, Quresha has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her her husband to increase his fruit business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
