Yasmeen is 48 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of 3 children. Her husband is an electrician and he has been running his electric store for the past 15 years.  He is responsible to feed his entire family and fulfill their needs.

Yasmeen's husband has to purchase electric merchandises e.g wires, tube lights, plug shoes and other electric devices but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to purchase these items for business purpose.
Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase these merchandises as per his business needs. This loan will also allow her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase electrical merchandise for her husband's business

loans.name: Luis Maria

texts.es: A sus 45 años de edad Luis se encuentra desempleado, tiene una familia a la cual mantener, pero este hombre está a punta de dar un gran paso en su vida y será la creación de su propio negocio el cual atenderá desde su casa, va a ser una tienda de abarrotes y necesita tu ayuda para que lo apoyes prestándole capital con el cual Luis comprara vitrinas, estanterías, nevera, congelador, abastecer su negocio con granos, abarrotes, vegetales víveres, este préstamo serpa tan importante para Luis porque le dará la oportunidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para labrar un futuro, de depender de sí mismo, de dejar de buscar trabajo, eso es lo que quiere Luis. Ayudalo
texts.en: At 45 years of age, Luis is unemployed and has a family to support. But, this man is on the verge of taking a big step in his life and it will be the creation of his own business which he will run out of his house. It is going to be a grocery store and he needs your help so that you can support him by loaning him capital with which he can buy display cases, shelving, a refrigerator, a freezer, and stock his business with grains, groceries, vegetables, and provisions. This loan will be so important for Luis because it will give him the opportunity to have a working tool to shape his future, to depend on himself, and to stop searching for work. That is what Luis would like. Support him.

loans.use: purchase display cases, shelving, a refrigerator, a freezer, and stock his business with grains, groceries, vegetables, and provisions.

loans.name: Nyangumi Group

texts.en:
Mengi is a married woman and a mother of three boys and one girl who are at school. She involves with business called DUKA LA REJAREJA (general store) selling different items in retail form. She has been in this business for three years now, working from 7.am to 8:30.pm daily. Mengi is able to make a very small profit per week so she wishes to raise more her income .

This is her second credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy more stock of dry food (rice,beans,maize and baking flour),liters of cooking oil etc. She used the previous first credit, paid it back in full, to restock her shop with missed stocks. Her shop still so small and makes Mengi to spend all of her credit to improve to a higher level. She works hard and dreaming to grow more her shop. With the small income earned, she used to plow it back into the business to grow. 

She will share this loan with her group"NYANGUMI" consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry food, rice, beans, maize and baking flour, liters of cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 49-years-old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living she engages in cassava production. She plants cassava and after harvest she sells it to the market for her customers. To increase her income is a great desire so that she can give a good living to her family, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for cassava plants to produce a good harvest and be able to sell to the market plenty of cassava that can cater to all her customers.

Nena's plan for the future is to save money out from her business income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for cassava plants.

loans.name: Kobila

texts.en:
Kobila is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in a big district with her family. She is married and had one child. Her husband is a taxi driver. She is a capable, responsible, punctual and honest person. She has experience of keeping livestock, but she did not do business yet. She is planning to do a business and earn money to help her husband to feed and ensure their family. Two years ago they moved from their place to another that is close to the domestic market. 

She is willing to buy livestock for breeding and further selling. She asked a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy livestock. 

She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy livestock for breeding and further selling

loans.name: Bella Marina

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Bella, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene un hijo mayor  de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Bella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatos y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer casi  todos los días en sus ratos libres ya que no tiene horario fijo, también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas en las que exhibe sus productos,  deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar algo por su cuenta para beneficio de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos. Lleva más de 4 ciclos en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the loan group Trabajando Juntas (Working Together) meet in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for it's delicious candies that are prepared by locals and recognized throughout the country.

This is where Bella lives. She's 65 years old, married, and has one grown son. Her husband is a salesman. Bella is a homemaker who herself earns money by selling shoes and Avon products (beauty products, including cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). She sells from door to door and goes out almost every day in her free time; she does not keep a fixed schedule. She also sells out of her home where she has several showcases for displaying her products. She sells her products on credit and collects every eight or fifteen days. She has ten years of experience in this work, which has helped her earn something on her own to help out the family.

This loan is to buy additional shoes and beauty products. She has completed more than four loans cycles through the credit group and she likes the loans because they allow her to finance her business. Her goal is to improve her business.

loans.use: buy perfume, cosmetics, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 53-year-old, married and has two children to provide for. She engages in a food stall business to provide for her family's needs. She aims for a better life for her family that's why she decided to borrow a loan to buy more ingredients for a new menu to sell and be able to sell more menus that can generate more income.

Elsa's plan for the future is to save money from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for a new menu to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalis is 39 years old, married and has two children. To earn an income she engaged in a buy and sell sari-sari business and is able also to help her husband in providing for the needs of her family. She decided to borrowed a loan to buy more stocks for sell and able to increase her store inventory that will generate greater income.

Rosalie plan for the future to save money out from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for her store for selling.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is married with three children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.

Shirley supports the family through her poultry business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Ariel, 16 years old, the first of three children in the family, who is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering and is currently in the first of this five-year course.

Shirley is borrowing PHP 23,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Ariel for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Ariel plans when he graduates to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 60 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Aurelia has a general store business in the Philippines. Aurelia requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aurelia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 56 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lerma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lerma requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Lerma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Hector Alonso

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre de 54 años de edad, vive solo no tiene hijos ni pareja, es un comerciante el cual se dedica a atender 12 horas de cada día su negocio de tienda de abarrotes (típica tienda de barrio), el negocio lo inicio en el año 2006, en el momento que quedó desempleado, vago por unos meses buscando laborar pero debido a su falta de educación no pudo encontrar, en ese momento fue que un amigo el surgieron que iniciara un negocio y le recomendó la tienda ya que no necesitaba de mucha experiencia para vender.

Desde entonces Héctor ha estado trabajando, ha tenido inconvenientes como la falta de capital de trabajo, la inseguridad en el sitio de trabajo, los altos costos de insumos.

Héctor quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con abarrotes, granos, dulces, frituras en bolsa, productos de aseo personal, con este préstamo podrá tener tranquilidad de contar con inventario para atender las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hector, 54, lives alone since he has no children nor partner.  He is a merchant and works 12 hours a day in his grocery store (a typical neighborhood store).  He started the business in 2006 when he lost his job.  He had looked for a job for several months but could not find anything because of his lack of education.  That is when a friend suggested he start his own business, a store, as much selling experience was not necessary.

Since then Hector has been working, but he runs into inconveniences such as a lack of capital, insecurity in the workplace and the high cost of supplies.

He is requesting a loan to stock his store with groceries, grains, sweets, packaged fritters and personal care products.  This will give him peace of mind regarding having enough stock to attend to customer demand.

loans.use: To buy groceries, gains, sweets, packaged fritters and personal care items.

loans.name: Gladys Enith

texts.es:
Ella es Gladys una productora agropecuaria que se encuentra esperando un hijo, aprendió del negocio gracias a su marido el cual le regalo una vaca para que ella tuviera la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos.

Gladys tiene 28 años de edad aparte del hijo que está esperando, es madre de otros dos de 9 y 7 años de edad.

Gladys necesita un apoyo económico, para mejorar su propio negocio, quiere comprar 2 vacas y convertirse en la competencia de su pareja, demostrar que ella es capaz de ser una gran empresaria y ser autónoma. 

Este préstamo aumentara su producción considerablemente.
texts.en:
This is Gladys, 28, an agricultural producer who's expecting a child.  She learned the business thanks to her husband, who gave her a cow so she would have the chance to earn her own income.  She's the mother of two other children, ages 9 and 7, in addition to the baby she's expecting.

She needs some help to improve her own business.  She wants to buy two cows and become her husband's competition, to demonstrate that she's capable of being a great businesswoman and to be autonomous.

This loan will increase her production considerably.

loans.use: to buy two cows to triple her production

loans.name: Mario Junior

texts.es:
Mario es un joven de 22 años de edad que inicio un negocio de alquiler de lavadoras para apoyar a su madre en los gastos del hogar, no quiere que ella siga trabajando, quiere brindarle el capital necesario para que se quede en la casa, descanse puesto que se esforzó mucho durante toda su vida para darle una buena calidad de vida, es un chico con un buen corazón y solidario con su familia. 

Mario desea realizar una inversión para ampliar la cobertura de su negocio, por ello solicita un apoyo financiero para completar el dinero que necesita para la compra de 4 lavadoras, poner un aviso luminoso en su casa de alquiler de lavadoras y adaptación del local, construirá estanterías para guardar las lavadoras, ordenadamente.

Apoya a este joven empresario que quiere lucha por un futuro y sacar a su madre del trabajo.
texts.en:
22-year-old Mario is a young man who started a business renting washing machines to help his mother to cover the home expenses. He would like his mother to stop working. He wants to give her the money she needs to stay home and rest, since she worked very hard all her life to give him a good-quality life. He is a goodhearted young man who cares about his family.

Mario wants to invest and expand the coverage of his business. This is why he is requesting financial support to buy four washing machines, install a light sign for his business and make some improvements to his establishment. He will buy shelves to store the machines in an orderly way.

Support this young entrepreneur who wants to fight for his future and help his mother to retire.

loans.use: to buy four washing machines to rent.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 48-year-old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is vegetable seller by profession; her husband sells vegetables, e.g. onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. Her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Sakeena's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for selling purposes so he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn the maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business purposes.

Therefore Sakeena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her husband's business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 47 años de edad residente de Sahagún, una zona rural que necesita apoyo y personas que confíen en ellos y allí está interactuar junto con su socio Kiva, que están dispuestos a ayudar a estas personas.

Francisco no tiene empleo, desea montar un negocio de cría de aves porque es la actividad que mejor sabe realizar, para él es una necesidad dado que tiene que alimentar a su familia conformada por su pareja y dos hijos, por ello pide tu ayuda para tener una herramienta para alimentarlos, con tu préstamo Francisco comprara pollos, materiales para construir galpón y alimento.
texts.en: Francisco is a 47 year old man who lives in Sahagún. It is a rural zone that needs help and people who believe in them. Interactuar and Kiva are ready to help these people. Francisco has no job and he wants to start a business raising chickens as this business is what he knows best. It is necessary for him as he has to feed his family made up of his wife and two children. So he is requesting a loan to have a tool with which to feed them. With his loan Francisco will buy chickens, material to construct a shed and feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens material to build a shed and feed to increase production.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 18 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Safina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Safina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Safina also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Safina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Katerine Del Carmen

texts.es:
Katerine, a sus 23 años de edad es una mujer con visión, emprendedora y muy activa; por falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil conseguir oportunidades de trabajo, por lo cual ha decidido iniciar su propio negocio de venta de calzado. 

Para lo cual requiere el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor de zapatos, chanclas, botas, entre otros, con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes que inicialmente serían familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector y clientes de la sala de belleza que atiende su madre. 

Con esto podrá obtener ingresos para aportar al sustento de su hogar y podrá invertir más en su negocio así, podrá ir avanzando para convertirse en una líder del negocio, ser altamente productiva y muy competitiva a nivel comercial, así podrá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Katerine, 23, is a enterprising and very active woman with a vision.  It has been difficult for her to get work because she lacks work experience, so she decided to start her own business selling footwear.

That's why she needs the loan.  She's going to invest in a wholesale purchase of shoes, sandals, boots, and other footwear, to take advantage of the discounts that are offered.  That way she'll have a wide variety to sell to her customers, who initially will be family members, neighbors, friends in the area, and customers at her mother's beauty salon.

With this she'll be able to earn income to contribute to the support of her household.  She'll also be able to invest more in her business that way.  She'll continue to make progress and become a leader in the business and be highly productive and very competitive at the business level.  She'll improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to make a wholesale purchase of shoes, sandals, boots, and other footwear

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 42 years old woman and mother of six children and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession and he sells fruits apples, bananas, grapes etc. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage house hold.

Gulnaz's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.
Therefore Gulnaz has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Calfonia Grp Group

texts.en:
Jane is a mother of 4 children and is aged in her early 50's. Some of her children are still in school. She is married and supports her family by running a business involves meals where she sells cereals (maize,beans) and maize flour. She has been in this business for 12 years now. Jane works from 07.am to 08.pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fifth credit request to be apportioned among CALFONIA, a six-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loans, paid back fully, to restock more sacks of grain for her business. She earned extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. 

She dreams that one day she will be able to open another business to expand her portfolio. 

Jane will use this loan to buy cereals (maize and beans) and change some of them to flour form to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereals (maize and beans) and change some of them to flour form for selling.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is a 57-year-old widow and has two children to provide for. To earn a living she engaged in a buy-and-sell business and was able to help her husband in providing for her children's daily needs. She aims to increase her income so that she can be able to give her children a good life. She decided to avail herself of a loan to buy more stock to sell and to increase her store inventory to generate a better income.

For the future Cipriana wants to save money to sustain the needs of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a responsible housewife who sells soft drinks in the local community. She is 47 years old and has four children. Due to unavoidable circumstances, she was separated from her husband. Despite this, she has the determination to improve their living standard and give her children a better life. She aspires to further improve the business, but she has insufficient capital. She would like to avail a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more inventory of Pepsi, Gatorade, San Mig., Pale Pilsen, Sparkle, Coke, and Sprite to resell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of Pepsi, Gatorade, San Mig., Pale Pilsen, Sparkle, Coke, and Sprite to resell.

location.town: Brgy. La Torre South, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: María Piedad

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 59 años de edad, está separada pero de esa  relación tienen tres hijos mayores edad e independientes, en su casa vive un nieto que lo crio desde pequeño y que actualmente tiene 17  años de edad y estudia en colegio. 
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), sale a vender sus productos puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 8 años dedicada a esta actividad. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños es tener salud y seguir contando con los créditos.
texts.en:
In the district of Rocafuerte the members of the Trabajando Juntas [Working Together] Credit Group meet every fortnight. This place is known for the delicious sweets that the locals make, which are renowned throughout the country.  

This is where María lives. She is 59 years old, is separated and has 3 grown-up, independent children from her marriage. One of her grandchildren, who she raised since he was small lives in her house. He is currently 17 and is at school. 

María is a woman who likes to be self-sufficient in order to move forward. She makes a living selling products from the Avon and Yanbal catalogues (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She sells her products door-to-door and works three days a week, mostly in the morning as it's easiest for her to complete her route at this time. She sells on credit and customers pay every eight days. She has been doing this for eight years.  

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, jewellery, cosmetics, creams and other products. She has been in the loan group since its beginning and she likes it because of the help that the institution offers. She dreams of being healthy and continuing to receive loans.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, jewellery, cosmetics, creams etc.

loans.name: Maria Edlene

texts.en:
Maria Edlene is 37 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school.

Maria Edlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Maria Edlene has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending pig fattening.

Maria Edlene aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alberta is 50 years old and has two children still in school.

Alberta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Alberta requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Alberta has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 59 years old and has three children. Jasmin is married and has one child still in school.

Jasmin is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jasmin requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jasmin has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Xienghom Group

texts.en:
Noulath’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Noulath and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Noulath and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Noulath’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. 

The children in the picture are the children of parents or guradians that purchased a water filter.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thakhamlerm Group

texts.en:
Seang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Seang and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Seang and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Seang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. 

The children in the picture are the children of parents or guradians that purchased a water filter.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nokkok Group

texts.en:
Siloung understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Siloung knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Siloung purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Siloung is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for eight years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance of his taxi. 

Therefore Yasmeen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Yasmeen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. 

Yasmeen  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in future.

Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Nomthandazo

texts.en:
Nomthandazo is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This her story:1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying a Bachelors degree in Business Administration. I enjoy Project Management, Human Resource Management, ICT and Marketing Management. I also enjoy Philosophy of Consciousness and Sustainable Living.
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel? I want to be project manager where I will be able to do big events. Johannesburg is where I expect to work. Yes, I would like to travel.
3.	 Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children? I was born in  Dobsonville in Soweto. I have four brothers and four sisters. I am a single parent of two boys, aged 9 and 10. They are also in school. I live with my mother who is a pensioner. At times it’s even hard to put food on the table, but somehow it always works out. 
4.	What do you like to do in your spare time? I read a lot. I also do charity work if I have time,  especially during school  holidays. I also do part time work if there is some available.
5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? There will be significant change because it will help me with money for transport to school. At the moment I sometimes miss school because I can’t afford the transport money, so Kiva is going to change a lot of things. I will always be in class and I won’t miss anything.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to build a bathroom at her home to improve access to sanitation and water sources.

loans.name: Zaqro

texts.en:
59-year-old Zaqro lives in a village in economically disadvantaged Gori region. He is a skilled craftsman with different occasional jobs, but he would prefer a steady income. So he bought metal bars and greenhouse film and constructed his own greenhouse.

The next step will be the installation of an efficient drip irrigation system that gives the plants only as much water as they need; nothing is wasted. This is important because water is in short supply and precious in the region. The loan allows Zaqro to buy the necessary water tanks, tubes, and taps, as well as plant containers and good seeds. He is looking forward to working independently and to having good vegetables for sale and for his family.

loans.use: To buy a drip irrigation system, plant containers and seeds for his home-made greenhouse.

loans.name: Samaki Grp Group

texts.en:
Stela, a businesswoman aged mid 30's, is married and has got two boys and daughters who are at school. She has been running a business selling fresh water fish (sato and sangara) for a period of four years now. Stela works from 06.am to 07.pm per working day and is able to make a small profit per month.

In order to reach her dreams (business and life), she joined with SAMAKI, a group consisting of four businesswomen to find capital support. She is now reached the least and attained financial support from Tujijenge via her group. 

This is her fourth credit request, which she will use to improve her business, to buy fish for her business. Stela paid back her previous loans which enabled to buy the fish in demand and took her daughter to school. She used the small profit to cover school fees and for the family welfare. 

Her dreams make herself unable to rest; she wishes one day be able to expand her business and improve her family's welfare.

She will share this loan with her group, 'SAMAKI', which totals four members who will hold each other accountable for paying aback the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Mariam, whom is in her late 40s, is divorced. She has four children, three of whom are grown and one of whom is still in school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the out-of-stock items in her mamalishe (open-air food vending) business, and she has paid back all of her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe stock and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of building her own house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Nia Njema, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock of food items

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: Rano is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a teacher. She wants to start a business in order to help her parents with finances. She is planning to start a business in agriculture. She wants to buy a milk cow to sell dairy products. She hopes to work efficiently and for the welfare of her family. She is requesting financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy a dairy cow. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Domitela

texts.en:
Domitela, 64, wakes up very early in the morning and sleeps late at night because she has to look after her “sari-sari” (variety) store located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. Some customers buy as early as 4:30am or as late as 10:30pm; and she has to meet their needs or else her business will fail due to competition within the area. Her husband, Gil, a retired driver, helps her in her variety store.

Domitela also raises hogs for additional income. She has to save for her and her husband’s urgent needs and medical insurance. She knows that she has to prepare for the future. She plans to expand her business by buying additional piglets. However her wooden pig cage seems vulnerable to breakage or damage that’s why she wants to repair it as early as possible. Domitela would like to ask for PhP 15,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes you are willing to help her so she can increase her profit, sustain their everyday needs, and boost her savings. 

Domitela is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to repair the pig cages for her hog raising business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market so as to meet client needs in wearing new clothes.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living in remote district with her family. She is a widow and has two children. After her husband's death, she has grown up and provided for her children alone. She has experience doing business in agriculture buying and selling livestock. She planned to open a business breeding cattle and further selling. She appealed to IMON and participated in a three-day training for start-up clients. She made a business plan where she wanted to buy several calves for breeding and further selling. She asked for a loan to buy four or five calves and awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to buy several calves for breeding and further selling

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en:
Radilla is 54 years old, married, and has two children. To earn an income and be able to help her husband provide for the family, she runs a sari-sari store business.

She has always dreamed of a beautiful life for her family. To achieve this dream, she must increase her income. That's why she decided to borrow a loan to buy more goods to sell. Increasing her store inventory means she will be able to generate more income.

Radilla's plan for the future is to expand her business out from her business income.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlyn is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Erlyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Erlyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Erlyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Erlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wenceslaus

texts.en:
Wenceslaus is a fourth time borrower of UGAFODE microfinance applying for ugx3,500,000. He is a married young man with two children. He lives in one the rented single rooms in the outskirts of the city.  Wenceslaus is a graduate of one the reputed universities in the country with a bachelors degree in Business Administration. 

From the university, Wenceslaus tried searching for jobs for over two years and he failed to get one. He had to think hard and came up with an idea of becoming a boss of himself. To do it, he thought of starting up a retail shop in the neighborhood of where he lives. The challenge was start up capital.
He went to the village and sold off four of his goats and raised 800,000/= that he used to start the shop. 

With the help of profits and loans from UGAFODE microfinance, he managed to expand his working capital to now 3,000,000/=.

He badly wants to acquire a small piece of land where he will build a small house for his family. He will repay using proceeds from the retail shop. He is a hard working young man.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land so as to build a house for his family

loans.name: Jennie Mae

texts.en:
Jennie Mae is 39 years old and has three children. Jennie Mae is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Jennie Mae is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jennie Mae requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jennie Mae has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennie Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nakathang Group

texts.en:
Noy understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Noy knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Noy purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Noy is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joy is 40 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Joy has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Joy has been in this business for 10 years. Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Napawan Group

texts.en: Vieng’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Vieng and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Vieng and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Vieng’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
It’s not impossible for a tailor to experience an abundant life for her family someday. This is the principle of Erlinda, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, who has operated a tailoring shop together with her husband, Restituto, for 19 years now. They both work hard and save little by little to acquire their own space in the market in the near future. They know that they can earn more profit if they have a space in the market because many people can easily locate them. They believe in a husband-and-wife partnership in realizing their dreams and ensuring their children’s education.

As of now, she needs additional capital of PHP 14,000 to buy additional tailoring materials like fabrics, threads, needles, buttons, and other related stuffs. It will help her produce more clothes, thus giving her extra profit for their everyday needs and savings for the education of their children. She is praying that you will be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.   

Erlinda is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional tailoring materials like fabrics, threads, needles, buttons and other items

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is thankful that she was granted a 23000 PHP loan which she used to buy propeller materials and other products needed in ship propeller making. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a Php 30000 which she will use to buy more propeller materials needed to make ship propellers that she sells to motor boat owners. Her customers are motor boat owners from the different northern islands in the Phils. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial assistance that will be given her. Her earnings will surely help in their daily sustenance and for the school needs of her children.  

Rosanna hopes to grow her business and serve the needs of more boat owners. She dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for propeller materials and other products needed in ship propeller making.

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Anelita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anelita has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tirus

texts.en:
Tirus is a diligent and hardworking 22-year-old farmer from Karingani village in Kenya. He started dairy farming four years ago. Today, he has 2 dairy cows, 3 hens, 6 goats, and a garden with numerous crop varieties. He sells his farm produce at the local market and uses the income to pay for expenses and to grow the business.
  
Tirus is seeking a loan to introduce pigs on his farm. Pig farming will be an important source of income for Tirus. Furthermore, having more products to offer will strengthen his relationship with existing customers and attract new ones.

loans.use: to start pig farming

loans.name: Xang Group

texts.en: Aor’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Aor and her group are excited that the filter is available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Aor and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two-year period, filter users, like Aor’s family, will identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Yoedkeua Group

texts.en: Mung understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Mung knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Mung purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost spent foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Mung is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.  Children in the picture are the children of parents or guardians that purchased a water filter.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira is a clever girl and was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is single and lives with her family. She is a student at a medical college, studying the work of nurse. She likes to work on social projects at her college and loves to be an active student and be an example for youth. 

She hopes to graduate her college and help people who are needing medical support. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to pay her higher education costs. She hopes Kiva lenders will take care about her.

loans.use: to pay her college education costs in nursing

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, estudia, y comenta que sus padres siempre la ayudan en lo que pueden y lo que tienen a su alcance.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería agroindustrial, con lo cual quiere ser una profesional que ayude a las demás personas y también a sus seres queridos. Está poniendo  su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cumplir  con las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Norma is a student from the city of Ybycuí. She remarks that her parents have always helped her as much as they could. She is studying for a career in agro-industrial engineering, and she wants to be a professional who helps other people as well as those close to her. She is putting all that she has into achieving her goals and dreams. She requests this loan to pay for the costs of her degree so that she can continue studying as she has.

loans.use: Pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian, a native from Talibon, Bohol. He is married man, with 5 grown children.  He engages in making clay pots. He produces and sells pots made of clay and a mixture of cement to the local in his community. He has been engages in making pots for more than 20 years now. He needs capital to support his pottery business.

He is asking for a loan to buy materials in producing pots like clay, cement and many others. With these, he could makes more pots to sell. This will cause to improve her income and able to handle his finances. 

Fabian dreams that he will be successful in handling his business to improve the living condition of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for producing clay pots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm produce for sale and to earn more income.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 60 years old and married to Francisco, 69 years old, and they have children. They are survivors of Typhoon Haiyan that swept the Philippines, especially Visayas region, in November 2013. 

Rosario runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental and she continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. However, the income derived from her store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Aside from this, she has some neighbors who have the habit of paying later for those items they get. Sometimes it takes a few days or weeks before they pay. The stability of her business is shaken by this practice because it depletes her capital. She is a considerate person who cannot refuse her neighbors, but she also has to earn enough money for their everyday needs and save some amount for their retirement. Self-employed citizens in the Philippines, especially in some remote areas, have no pension or medical benefits when they retire. They have to rely on their own savings or help from other people. Considering all this, Rosario needs to improve her business. She plans to buy more items, particularly soft drinks, beverages and rice. She is requesting additional capital of PHP 40,000 that will surely boost her income and savings. She’s praying that you have a kind heart to extend support to her. It will go a long, long way. 

Rosario dreams that all her children will be successful and enjoy a better life in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy variety store items like soft drinks, beverages and rice

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Ser la única vendedora grande de mercancía de productos de consumo personal, es una gran ventaja para sacar su negocio adelante, además de ser una promotora de la vida saludable es ideal para que Diana prospere y se anime a triunfar en el emprendimiento y en el difícil mercado. 

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para comprar mercancía y por ello quiere solicitar un crédito para adquirir productos de uso personal como desodorantes, lociones, cremas, y algo de vestuario, de este modo impulsar el uso de estos productos entre sus conocidos y gente del barrio. 

Su principal sueño es tener un negocio estable, un local comercial, mejorar ventas, y que este negocio le dé estabilidad económica y lo suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su hijo.
texts.en: To be the only large vendor of personal use ;products is a great advantage to get a business ahead. Also being a promoter of a healthy life is ideal for Diana to prosper and is encouragement to triumph in her undertaking in a difficult market. Her main difficulty is the lack of capital to buy merchandise so she wants to request a loan to acquire personal use products like deodorant, lotion, cream and some clothing and in this way promote the use of these products amongst her acquaintances and people in her neighborhood. Her main dream is to have a financially stable business and enough money to cover her needs and those of her child.

loans.use: to acquire personal use products like deodorant, lotion, cream and some clothing and in this way promote the use of these products.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a young married mother of 3 children. 10 years ago, she started farming on her husband's 2.8 acre land to help generate income for their family. She does dairy, poultry, and horticultural farming. Her main income sources include milk, eggs, meat, maize/corn and onions. 

She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers.   As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.   
Sharon hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition

loans.use: to buy poultry so as to increase sales and income

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is a young small-holder farmer based in Central Kenya. He started farming three years ago, yet he has been able to acquire two cows, 10 hens and three goats. He also grows bananas, coffee and vegetables. He sells his farm produce at a local market, which is quite a distance from his farm.  To improve his efficiency in his business, Humphrey is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle. The newly acquired motorcycle will be used to ferry produce every day to the market. Also, the motorcycle will create an alternative source of income when he decides to make transportation services available for other members of his community. 

This investment will make him cut the cost of transporting his produce to the market and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a farm transportation motorcycle

loans.name: Luz Alba

texts.es:
Luz Alba  tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes (típica tienda de barrio), vive junto con su esposo no tiene hijos solo se tienen el uno al otro para atender el negocio y generar el dinero necesario para su mantenimiento.

La principal dificultad que ha encontrado Luz Alba para trabajar tranquilamente es la inseguridad en la zona, los altos costos de insumos y la variabilidad en las ventas, aspectos que ha tenido que aprender a mejorar conforme iba ganado experiencia en su tienda.

Luz Alba quiere solicitar un préstamo la razón es que no tiene casi surtido en su negocio y necesita abastecerlo, la prueba está en la foto sus vitrinas están vacías, por ello con el dinero que está solicitando quiere comprar variedad de surtido en abarrotes, granos y refrescos que son los productos de mayor rotación en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Alba owns a grocery store, which is a typical store in her neighborhood.  She lives together with her husband.  They do not have children.  They work together at the grocery store to generate the income necessary to support themselves.

The main difficulty that Luz Alba has encountered is working safely due to the insecurity in the area, the high costs of items, and the variability in sales.  She has had to learn to improve as she has gained experience with her business.

Luz Alba is requesting this loan because she does not have enough stock in her store and she wants to stock it.  The proof is in empty display case in the photo.  With the money, she will buy a variety of merchandise including groceries, grains, and drinks, which are the products that sell most quickly in her store.

loans.use: to stock her business with grains, groceries, and drinks.

loans.name: Dorian Camilo

texts.es:
El señor Dorian es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio con lubricantes de diferentes marcas, de este modo podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes
texts.en:
Dorian is a very experienced motorcycle and auto mechanic. He has acquired many of his skills through short courses at different academies, and the rest he has learned empirically. In addition to his work as a mechanic he also has a small spare parts shop where he sells a variety of auto parts of different brands. 

He is a very hard-working and honest man who knows how important cars are to their owners. This is why he always tries to provide excellent service with good quality, in an efficient manner. 

He is asking for a loan so he can stock his business with a variety of brands of lubricants so he can have products available for his customers.

loans.use: stock his business with different brands of oil.

loans.name: Galdis De Jesus

texts.es:
Galdis es una empresaria de 53 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora, que le gusta el comercio, generar su propio sustento, jamás quiso depender de su marido, por sus propios méritos  esfuerzos monto una distribuidora de bebidas donde trabaja diariamente para crecer y ser la socia de las tiendas del barrio.

Dejar un gran negocio a sus hijos es lo que sueña, no lo que tiene actualmente, trabajara para mínimamente triplicar los pedidos, con los ingresos que obtiene los destina a su hogar reparaciones, compra de alimento, pago de cuentas, en educación para sus hijos es muy juiciosa y sabe distribuir bien el dinero.

Galdis solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de refrescos en grandes cantidades ya que ella no vende por unidad solo por paquetes o cajas.

Este préstamo le ayuda a tener existencias suficientes para llegar a buenos negocios, ofrecer en otras tiendas, mejorar sus ventas dado que su inventario a partir de este momento crecerá.
texts.en:
Galdis is an enterprising 53 year-old businesswoman. She likes trade and also likes to generate her own livelihood because she never wanted to depend on her husband. Through her own efforts she started a beverage distribution company where she works everyday to be able to grow and be a partner of the shops in her neighbourhood.   

Her dream is to leave her children a great business, not what she currently has, and she will work to at least triple orders. She invests the income she earns in her household for repairs, to buy food, pay bills, in education for her children, etc. She is very sensible and knows how to distribute money properly.    

Galdis is requesting a loan to buy a selection of soft drinks in bulk because she does not sell them per unit but bundled. 

This loan helps her to have sufficient stock to be able to make good deals, offer her products to other shops and therefore improve her sales because her stock is going to grow from that moment on.

loans.use: to buy a selection of soft drinks in bulk because she does not sell them per unit but bundled.

loans.name: Berleys De Jesus

texts.es:
Berleys es una joven emprendedora, luchadora, una madre que quiere sacar a sus hijos adelante, salir de la pobreza, superarse y cambiar su realidad, ella tiene un negocio de salsamentaría donde oferta productos de la canasta familiar, bebidas, cervezas y diversión a sus usuarios pues tiene una mesa de billar, es madre de dos princesas de 7 y 5 que son su todo para ella, su adoración su luz y un motivo para dar lo mejor de ella en cada día de trabajo. 

Esta mujer trabaja por pagar la educación de sus hijos, por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por superación personal y como anteriormente se mencionó salir de la pobreza. 

Está decidida a mejorar su negocio, ser más competitiva, captar mayor público, por ello planea hacer una inversión a su negocio, desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frituras, cervezas, bebidas alcohólica, reparar el billar, los tacos, busca tener un negocio atractivo en donde sus clientes disfruten horas de juego y se fidelicen.
texts.en:
Berleys is a young entrepreneur, a fighter, and a mother who wants to get her children ahead, get out of poverty, and improve and change her reality. She has a deli store where she sells basic goods, drinks, and beer, and has fun distractions for its patrons, like a pool table. Berleys is a mother of two princesses who are 7 and 5, and mean the world to her. She adores them; they are her light and a reason to give her all every working day. 

Berkys works to pay for her children’s education, to improve their housing conditions, for personal growth, and as previously mentioned, to get out of poverty.

She is determined to improve her business, become more competitive, and attract more customers. To do this, she plans to make an investment in her business. She wants a loan to purchase assorted fritters, beer, alcoholic beverages, to repair the pool table, and buy tacos, in order to have an appealing business where her customers can enjoy hours of play and be loyal customers.

loans.use: to purchase assorted fritters, beer, alcoholic beverages, to repair the pool table, and buy tacos.

loans.name: Ubaldo Enrique

texts.es:
Ubaldo es un hombre humilde, tímido, organizado que se encuentra sin trabajo, es una persona que desde pequeño le enseñaron a trabajar y gastar su tiempo en algo útil, Ubaldo solicita tu ayuda de ustedes lectores para iniciar un negocio propio, uno del que no lo puedan correr, donde usara todas sus capacidades y empeño para sacarlo adelante y hacer que este le genere tanto a él como a su familia una excelente calidad de vida.

Ubaldo solicita un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de tienda general, el préstamo será para complementar un dinero que tiene con el que comprara nevera, vitrinas, congelados, estanterías y surtido de alimentos de la canasta familiar.

Tu ayuda será muy significativa, esta persona tendrá aun negocio propio, un esperanza y una manera de dar calidad de vida digna y honradamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Ubaldo is a humble, shy, organized man who doesn't have a job. He is a person who was taught from the time he was small to work and spend his time doing something useful. Ubaldo is asking for your help, readers, to start his own business. He will use all of his skills and hard work to get it ahead so that it can generate an excellent standard of living for him and his family.

Ubaldo is asking for a loan to start a general store. The loan will be to complete the amount of money he needs to buy a freezer, display cases, frozen foods, shelves and an inventory of staple food products.  

Your help will be very significant. This person will have his own business, hope, and a way to give his family quality of life in an honorable way.

loans.use: to complete the money he needs to buy a refrigerator, display cases, frozen foods, shelves and inventory of staple food products. He is starting a business.

loans.name: Martha Lucero

texts.es:
Al hablar de Martha no se puede evitar notar que es una agricultora de nacimiento criada y formada con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo, siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia. 

Martha no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultora decidió montar una tienda para complementar sus actividad ya que encontraba mucho tiempo muerto y si hay algo que caracteriza a un agricultor es que no puede estar, quieto tiene que estar trabajando constantemente y es por esta razón que la señora Martha solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de su tienda, básicamente grano y abarrotes, snacks y dulces los cuales complementarían muy bien los ya conocidos productos que distribuye y que incluso vende lo que cultiva en su tierra.

Su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos para comprar el local donde actualmente opera
texts.en: When talking about Martha, you can't help but notice that she is a farmer by birth, raised and formed by the beautiful country values of humility and work. These two values are the most representative in Colombian farmers. Martha, not satisfied with the income she gets as a farmer, decided to set up a store to supplement her job, since she was finding that she had a lot of downtime and if there is something that characterizes a farmer it is that they can not be still. She needs to be constantly working. For this reason, Martha is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her store such as basic grains and groceries, snacks and sweets which will complement the products she already sells. She also sells what she cultivates on her land. Her dream is that God allows her to be healthy in order to work tirelessly and be able to generate a good income to buy the property where she currently sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store: basic grains, groceries, snacks and sweets, which will complement the products she currently sells.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 49 years old. As a married mother of four children, she works hard to support her family and improve their economic situation. Her husband also supports them by working as a driver.

For almost 23 years, Rena has been doing business in agriculture. She is well known among agrarians and friends. She sells her harvested crops at a domestic market. She is planning to process and fertilize her land.

Rena has appealed to Aqroinvest CU and Kiva to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds to prepare her land and have a good harvest next season. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds

loans.name: Waridi Group

texts.en:
Fabiola, who is in her early 30s, is single with one son who is still in school.  She has been running a beauty salon for 10 years now.  She works from 9am to 9:30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fabiola's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her salon equipment and products and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to buy a TV set, a radio, a fridge, two cupboard, four dresses, utensils and a plot of land, to repay her loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products, meet her customers' requests and start selling fabrics in her salon. She dreams of building her own house.

Fabiola, will share this loan with her loan group, Waridi, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date salon product and met her customers' request and start selling fabrics in her salon.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is in his late 20's, married and has two boys and daughters in school. He runs two different business, retail shop and bodaboda (motorbike for transportation), a business he has been with for three years now. He starts working from 6.am to 9.pm per working day with ability to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his sixth credit request which he will use to buy shop inventories and motorbike maintenance. He used the previous loans to make great things, he bought a motorbike which he used to make extra income and bought shop inventories. John received small profit which he used to cover school fees and household cost. He dreams to improve his shop. 

He is so thankful for everyone who enabled making his life and business changing.

loans.use: to buy retail shop inventories and do motorbike maintenance

loans.name: Ruhshona

texts.en:
Ruhshona is a cheerful girl. She was born in the west-northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is living in an ancient, historical, and beautiful city. She is single and lives with her parents. 

She is a third year student. She studies accounting and auditing and likes her major. She is studying with excellent marks and wishes to be a specialist to work in the banking system. Each exam she passes successfully. 

She is asking a loan to pay the tuition fee for her studies. She hopes to be supported and dreams to be useful and helpful to society.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her studies

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is 39 years, married to Emily and he supports 3 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 8 years and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in his farm so as to get a better produce for family use.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in his farm so as to get a better produce for family use.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
You might be the answer to Rosalinda’s prayers!

Here is Rosalinda, a 62 year old woman from Tigbauan, Iloilo. She is married to Rogelio, a 67 year old laborer who still accepts manual work despite his age. Rosalinda feels the sacrifices of her husband that’s why she tries to earn a living to help him and support their expenses. She’s selling RTWs or ready-to-wear apparels like clothes, undergarments, shoes and even bags and umbrellas. She also manages her variety store for fifteen years now. 

However, the usual dilemma of variety store owners like Rosalinda is the long time debts of some customers that depletes her capital. Even her RTW business suffers the same problem. As of now, she needs additional capital to buy more RTW products like clothes, bags, umbrellas and other supplies in her variety store. A PhP 30,000 loan will help her a lot. She can improve her profit so her husband can already retire from manual work at his age of 67. She can also set aside some amount in times of emergency and sickness, because the self-employed like her have no access to pension or medical insurance. 

Rosalinda gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear products and other supplies in her variety store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is lucky that their residence in Tigbauan, Iloilo is located in front of a national high school. It’s prolific for her “sari-sari” (variety) store business and electronic load for cellphones. But the summer season or the past school vacation was not favorable for her business. Her usual customers, the students, were not there to patronize her store. It also happened that her sister was hospitalized and she has to extend financial support. 

Now that the school already opened, she wishes to regain some loses and expenses. She will buy more supplies of grocery items, softdrinks and beverages, biscuits and snacks for her store. She will also reserve supplemental capital for cellphone e-loading. 

A PhP 50,000 loan will be of great help to boost her income. With this, she can continue helping her sick sister. She can support her husband Rafael, a driver, in their everyday needs and save for their child’s education. Elizabeth would like to ensure that their child will finish her college education so as to have a brighter future.

Elizabeth meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
At the age of 51, Basheeran is a married woman and a mother of 3 children. She is hard working lady and needs to improve her family living standards through all her efforts. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. 

She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 63 years old, married to Rosemary and supports a family of 4 children. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 28 years earning KES5,000 per month. 

Henry has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to improve his farming activities in the area. 

His future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund is thankful that he was granted a 10000 PHP loan which he used to buy tires and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 11000 PHP loan to pay for the registration and license of his additional tricycle. He is happy and encouraged with the safe trips and good turnout of his tricycle service. He is thanking God and you for your good heart, the financial assistance that will be given him and his earnings which will surely help cover their daily needs.

Edmund aims to take care of the business God has entrusted him. He wants to give his family a better future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.
