* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tires, maintenance and gas for his tricycle service.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 61 years old and married with two children. 

Anecita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Anecita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm produce for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Luis Ignacio

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive el señor Luis,  tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. 
Don Luis  es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante, el tiene un deposito en el centro de la ciudad donde vende  gas de uso doméstico, agua en bidón, en galones y botellas pequeñas de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 que cierra su local, son muchas las personas de la localidad y sitios vecinos que compran en su local el cual está justo donde paran muchos carros que se transportan a estos sitios lo cual le resulta muy conveniente ya que sus ventas están aseguradas, lleva más de 5 años en este negocio con el cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar agua en todas las variedades que vende y gas de uso doméstico. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para él. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Trabajando Juntas Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton, a place known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by locals.

This is where Luis lives.  He's 23 years old and single, and he lives in his parents' house.  He's a very hardworking young man who likes to work to get ahead.  He has a store in the center of town where he sells gas for home use and water in drums, gallons, and small bottles, in accordance with the needs of his customers.  He works every day from 6 a.m. until he closes at 7 p.m.

A lot of people from the area and neighboring places buy from Luis because his store is right where a lot of cars stop.  This is very convenient for him because it guarantees him sales.  He has been in this business for more than five years and he's making progress.

He's going to use the loan to buy all the varieties of water he sells as well as gas for home use.

Luis has been in the communal bank for five loan cycles and he likes it because the loans are very important for him.  His dream is to keep improving his business.

loans.use: to buy water and gas to sell for home use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry to expand her farming activity due to increased local demand for poultry

loans.name: Nikelwa

texts.en:
Nikelwa is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This her story:1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am tudying a Bachelor of Business Administration degree and I enjoy Human Resources.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel? 
After graduating I would like to get a decent job so that I can get enough money to start my own businesses. I am not intending to work for someone for the rest of my life; I will work to just get start up capital. In those years of working I would like to work in the marketing department and I would like to work here in Johannesburg. In terms of traveling, yes I would like to travel but after I have achieved my goals. 

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children? 
I was born in Port Elizabeth in the Eastern Cape. I have one sister and one brother and they are both younger than me. I am raised by one parent, my mother, and she is a cleaner. I am not married and I do not have children. 

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time? 
In my spare time I like to cook and read. I also enjoy researching my future career path, the path that I want to take. I gather research so that I can know what I need or what is needed when I start working.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? 
The Kiva loan will help me in terms of transport because I stay far away and I can’t afford to come to school every day. I have to skip days so that I can come when we are writing tests and exams.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 30 years old married woman and a mother of 6 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses. She always desires to provide her children with good quality education for their prosperous future. She always desires to provide her children with good quality education for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales for generating more income to cover daily expenses

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, who is in her early 40s is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been planting and selling vegetables for six years now. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Christine's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy seeds grew more vegetables and managed to meet her customer's demand.   She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will us this loan to buy seeds, manure and to extend her shop to be big enough to accommodate her genge items. She dreams of adding more rooms on her two roomed house.

Christine will make sure she pays back her loan  according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and to extend her shop to be big enough to accommodate her genge items.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with two children and both attend school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for seven years. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Thường

texts.en:
Ms Thường is 59 years old and she is a single parent with 2 children.
 
She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for 10 years. Thường lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the lartrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.  This is Thường first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow in order to boost her farming activity

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has owned and operated her home-based store for ten months. She is 33 years of age, married, and has three children. Two of her children are still attending to school, while her youngest child is still infant-aged.

Carmelita would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used in buying 25 sacks of charcoal and grocery items to sell. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted to improve the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of charcoal and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a 57-year-old farmer from Kisiara village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. She is married and has children who help her raise the animals.

Lily applied for a 60,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo because she wants to expand her herd. She will buy an additional cow with her loan. The Kiva-financed cow will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.

Lily needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses; this is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose sigue con sus estudios en la carrera de contabilidad, es una persona que esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder crecer por medio de sus conocimientos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar sus gastos de titulación, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de crecer.
texts.en: José continues studying for his Accounting degree.  He is putting in his best effort in order to become someone in life, and be able to grow through his knowledge.  He says that he used his previous loan to pay for his degree expenses, which was a great help.  Today, he is requesting the loan to pay for the costs of his degree so that he can continue studying as he has been doing.  He is grateful for this new opportunity he is receiving to grow.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early fifties, is single with two children who are still in school. She has been selling clothes and bags for seven years now. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam’s sixth loan from Kiva's field partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy better quality and more up-to-date clothes and bags and repaid all of her loans successfully. She used her profits to pay school fees, rent and household expenses and to repay the loan.

Mariam will use this 1,000,000 TZS loan to buy more inventory to meet her customers’ demands. She will make sure she repays her loan within the scheduled time. She dreams of buying a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and bags to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Remelinda

texts.en:
Sari-sari stores are seen everywhere in the Philippines. Sari-sari means "variety". They provide the people with products mostly needed in everyday survival - from products for personal hygiene such as shampoo, toothpaste, and powder, to condiments, foods, canned goods, and other stuff that is merely low-cost. This is why many of those who want to go with a business often start with being a sari-sari vendor, because with just a small amount of capital, you can automatically operate a store and earn.

It's just like Remelinda, 36 years old, and from Muntinlupa City, Metro Manila. She began being involved in this kind of business five years ago. And through all those years, she was able to provide her three children a living through the income she gets from the store. What she does is basically buy stuff in a large quantity and then display it at her store and sell it at retail, often at a price that is very affordable for people, but is larger than the original price so she can have a profit.

However, you cannot expect a regular and stable income from this, since sales vary from time to time. For this reason, Remelinda wants to ask you for a PHP 50,000 loan that she will use to buy more supplies of products to display in her store. Certainly, this will really help her improve her business and attract more customers.

She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of products to display in her store.

loans.name: Louie Jean

texts.en:
Louie Jean is a 28-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of seven. Her father is a tricycle driver, and her mother is a housewife. Louie Jean has five siblings. Her eldest sister is married, one is unemployed, and the last sister works as a massage therapist. Her older brother works as a security guard in a local warehouse, while her younger brother is in elementary school.

The family’s total monthly income is PHP 16,000 ($359). Louie Jean would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at Bagosphere will allow her to do this. Louie Jean wants to learn about computer technology, boost her self-confidence in dealing with people, help her family, and earn a high salary.

Your generosity in funding her loan will help Louie Jean fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 59 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, Sonia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries o sell.

Sonia has been in this business for three years. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daysy

texts.es:
Daysy vive en la ciudad de Paraguarí, quiere culminar sus estudios en la carrera de contabilidad, para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Comenta que le gustaría poder tener su propia familia algún día. Ella está poniendo todo lo que necesita para poder cumplir sus sueños.
Daysy pide este préstamo para poder pagar con las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Daysy lives in the city of Paraguarí. She wants to finish her studies in Accounting in order to become someone in life. 

She comments that she would like to have her own family some day. She is giving all that she needs to achieve her dreams. 

Daysy asks for this loan to pay for the bills of her courses. By doing so, she can continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she received for her to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay university bills

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es de la ciudad de Pilar, comenta que estudia y a la vez trabaja en un Estudio Contable, para llegar a ser una profesional exitosa, es una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Amelia está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y por medio de sus estudios quiere ser una profesional exitosa para poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Amelia is from the city of Pilar.  She says that, in order to become a successful person, she studies and also works in an accounting firm.   She is a hardworking person who is willing to make sacrifices.  Amelia is studying for a degree in Accounting, and through her studies, she wishes to become a successful professional and get ahead.  She is requesting this loan to pay for the costs of her degree, and to be able to continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 57 years old, married to Milka, and supports a family of four children.

He has been practicing farming for the last 27 years, earning KES 9,000 per month.

Wilson has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Ronard

texts.en:
Ronard is 28 years old, married to Everline, and supports a family that includes two children. He has been practicing livestock farming for the last seven years and earns 8,000 KES per month. 

Ronard has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy animal feed for his animals for high production so he can earn more income.  

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his farming activities. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga is 45 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Nga lives in Thanh Hoa city, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral and is unable to get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that the lartrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is single and lives in Kampala, Uganda with her two children who go to school. She also supports an additional relative. The family lives in a rental that has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

For the last two years Olivia has sold clothes door to door. She works seven days a week, with her major challenges being transportation and bad weather.

Olivia has applied for a 300,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her goal is to establish her business in a permanent spot.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia comenta que su meta es recibirse y ayudar al que necesita. Lo que le gusta es ayudar a las demás personas por medio de lo que aprende, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de Derecho.
Pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder lograr sus metas. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir luchando para ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Cinthia says her goal is to graduate and to help people who are in need. What she likes to do is to help other people through the means that she learned. It is for this reason that she is studying Law. 

She is giving her best to achieve her goals. She asks for this loan to pay for the bills of her courses, and with this she can continue to fight to become someone in life.

loans.use: to pay university bills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as engines, tyres, and windscreens so as to maintain and repair his motorcycle to enable him to offer better transport services to clients.

loans.name: Thêu

texts.en:
Ms Thêu, 62, is a single parent with one child who has raised poultry for the last twenty years. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She and her child live in a low-income section of the village, and market needs are low in this region.

In 2012 Thêu joined Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa to gain access to its loans and has successfully taken out and repaid four prior loans. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Thêu is having no latrine, so today she is requesting a 10,000,000 VND loan to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build one.

Thêu hopes that her new latrine will keep her and her child healthy, with the result that they will be happy and prosperous.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fridge

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old, married, and has four children. Two of her children are in school.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more inventory of groceries to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 24 ans, Akou est une femme mère de deux enfants. Akou habite à Bè et vend des charbons de bois dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Akou s’approvisionne trois fois par mois chez un fournisseur du quartier. Pour commander des sacs de charbon, Akou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Married and aged 24, Akou is the mother of two children. She lives in Bè and sells charcoal in the neighborhood to earn enough income for their well-being. In order to achieve her ends, Akou stocks up three times per month from a supplier in the neighborhood. To order some sacks of charcoal, Akou is asking for this loan to complete her purchase and have an income so as to help her husband with the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy nine sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Macyline

texts.en:
Macyline is a 26-year-old farmer from Kisii, Kenya.  She practices dairy, poultry, goat, and tree farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Macyline is married and has 3 children who help her with the work on the farm.  
Macyline applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.  
Macyline needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mavludaoy

texts.en:
Mavludaoy is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She lives in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. She is a hardworking and goal-oriented person. In order to feed and provide for their family, Mavludaoy and her husband are working. Her husband is an emigrant and works abroad. 

She has many years of experience doing business in agriculture. She kept livestock and also planted agricultural products in her yard. She wants to start a business breeding livestock and selling them in a domestic market. She requested a loan to buy livestock and start the business. She awaits Kiva lenders' compassion and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of products such as cooking oil, baking flour, and sugar to sell to clients who demand such products.

loans.name: Trường

texts.en:
Trường is 30 years old and he is married.  He has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce for more than 10 years.

Trường lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  His family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

For Trường, one of the most critical difficulties that concerns his family is not having a latrine . He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Trường first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Trường hopes in the future to build a new house, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: build a toilet for his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk using his motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 58 years old, married to Janipha and supports a family of 5 children. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 8 years earning KES 12,000 per month. 

John has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to improve his farming activities in the area. 

His future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 29 years old, married to Rhoda, and he supports 2 children.  

Andrew has been selling firewood in the market for the last 2 years and the business earns him KES 12,000 per month. 

Andrew has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase trees to fell and make into firewood for sale to his clients.  He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business sector.  His hope is to be financially stable and be a rich merchant in the region.

loans.use: buy trees for firewood

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia  is 35 years old, a married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 3 children. 

She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Efiat

texts.en:
Efiat is a widow; she has been successfully running a small general store with her son who is also shown in the photo. Her son is really supportive and helps her mother in running their household activities. 

Currently, Efiat requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about their future earnings and wishes to spend the part of income on the betterment of the family members.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, jeans, shoes, and other products.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, esta estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma, por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a su familia y tener los medios para poder ser un profesional exitoso y con ello poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Diego esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida a ir abriéndose camino de esa forma. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su universidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Diego is from the city of Curuguaty. He is studying agricultural engineering, and hopes that, with his education, he can help his family and have the means to become a successful professional and open up a path into the labour market.

Diego is dedicating all his energy to bettering himself through education. He is requesting a loan to cover his university costs, so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for university.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is happy that she was granted a PHP 10000 PHP loan, which she used to buy ingredients for her peanut butter business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her food business she also has a DVD rental business as shown on her photo.

She would now like to apply for another PHP 10000 loan, which she will use to pay for ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, and coconut milk to make peanut butter. Part of the loan she will pay for new DVDs to rent them out. She is truly encouraged by the positive return on her investment. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and for the financial assistance that will be given her. Her earnings will surely help in their daily sustenance and for her children's education.

Marjorie dreams that her business will grow and serve more customers in her neighboring town. She wants all her children to finish school. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar, coconut milk, and oil to make peanut butter and partly to buy DVDs for rent.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children and they attend school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on  retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for eight years. She gets additional income from rental houses, and selling green bananas. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years, married to Samuel and she supports 4 children. 

She has been a farmer to clients for the last 12 years and the business earns her KES 9,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm for a better harvest for family use and sale to clients in the market.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm for a better harvest for family use and sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen  is 49 years, hardworking woman who has 2 children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing. Perveen ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Perveen has requested for a loan amount 55000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian viene de una familia humilde y que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agroindustrial Su anhelo es culminar su carrera con éxito de manera a generar mayores ingresos para su familia y ayudarles.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esta forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cristian comes from a humble family, and is doing his utmost to improve himself and become successful. He is studying for a degree in agro-industrial engineering. He hopes to complete his degree successfully, so that he can increase his family's earnings, and be in a position to help them.

He is requesting a loan to pay for his university costs, so that he can continue studying. He is grateful for this opportunity to be able to improve himself through studying.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Zaphania

texts.en:
Zaphaniah is 45 years old, married to Jane, and supports a family of 6 children.  Zaphaniah has been practicing farming for the last 13 years earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Zaphaniah has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm input for use to yield high production and more income gain.  He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction.   His future hopes and dreams are to financially stable.

loans.use: buy farm input

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 32 years old, married to Winfridah, and he supports 2 children.  He has been selling construction materials for the last 4 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

Evans has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a hammer for crushing big stones into kokoto for sale to customers in need of constructing materials. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business sector. His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: buy a stone hammer

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fátima está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción,  la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, que lucha y se esfuerza por poder mejorar cada día.
La Sra.  Ester es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas en forma ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora que está esforzándose para poder crecer y mejorar cada día, ya que por medio de su negocio tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos.
Ester pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser: remeras, jeans, camisas, blusas y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando, además todas se comprometen a poner su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group Virgen de Fátima is in its cycle No. 5 in the Women's Committee program. The group is from the city Concepción, an area that is a bit far from the center but is still going through growth. It is an area to which access is difficult, and where the people try hard and fight for improvement every day. 

Ms. Ester is one of the members. She is from an area that is far from the center. She is the president of this group, and she works as a street vendor of various clothing garments. She is a very hard working person who is trying hard to grow and to improve every day, as through her business she earns the means to help her family and her loved ones.

Ester asks for this loan to purchase various clothing garments for sale, such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses and others, so that she can continue fighting on each day. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has received. All of the group members also commit to put in their best effort to grow and improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, jeans, shirts, blouses and others

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma previously obtained a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CCT to buy additional groceries and commodities for her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. The loan greatly helped her and her family, as it helped them improve their household.

But Emma would still like to increase her income. She has thus gone into business with a Piso Net kiosk. This allows customers to rent computers for their personal use at a given time rate. One hour’s use of a PC costs 15 PHP, which is affordable for students, working people and even those who simply want to surf the net.

Because of this new and profitable business Emma is applying for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy another computer unit for her kiosk. She hopes that your hearts will be touched, and your support will be with her in her aim to lift her living standards. She hopes for her business to continue expanding and desires for her family to enjoy good health.

All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy another computer unit for her Piso Net kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farm input & implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top-dressing her crops on her farm for a better harvest, for her family's use and to sell to clients in the market.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
At this present generation, computer has obviously been a relevant part of our lives.  You can say that figuratively, computer is like the oxygen everyone needs, from an individual to the biggest institutions within the society.

This is why Mary Lou, 51 years old, a resident of Caloocan City, has chosen to make computer as the mainstream of her current business. She is a mother to her one child and she manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

So how is she running her business then? In the Philippines, we can expect that most of the population cannot afford to buy their own computer unit. As an ease to this, entrepreneurs like Mary Lou offers PC rentals with automatic access to the internet, basically per hour at a given cost. Usually, price ranges from 10 to 15 PHPs per hour which is a hook to the people for its very inexpensive price. 

However, what income Mary Lou gets from her current business is not quite enough to provide all their needs.   So she is planning to expand her business to increase her profit. With this in mind, she is humbly requesting a PHP 15000 loan, which she will utilize to purchase additional computer units and other materials needed for the renovation of her shop. In advance, she would like to say her thanks and deepest appreciation to those who will help her in this vision. 

Mary Lou hopes to have a sustainable livelihood in the near future. At the same time, she prays that her children will have a secured future through finishing their schooling. She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy computers

loans.name: Fikile

texts.en:
Fikile is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story.

1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?

To obtain my Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration and Maharishi Institute offers different education compared to other institutes as we do yoga and meditation before we start class to release the stress that I have received throughout the day. I enjoy Business Law and Ethics and Human Resource Management.  

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?  

To become a financial manager or an analyst in one of the biggest companies here in South Africa to own a mansion in Daifern, I would like to work in Johannesburg if I get to travel it should be around Africa.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children? 

I was born and breed in Alexandra Township, I have a sister but we only share the same father. I live with my grandmother, aunt, cousin and my uncle, my guardian is a nurse. She works at Alexandra clinic. I am not married and I do not have any children. 

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time? 

I like reading novels especially non-fiction and watching inspirational movies.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? 

I will be able to get relief that at least my study fees are being paid and I will also be able to come to school every day without missing any day because I will be getting a stipend which will be helping me with transportation.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Khanyisile

texts.en:
Khanyisile is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute.  This is her story.

1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?

I am currently studying business management the most and I enjoy my SCI and Business classes the most. I enjoy economics, Business Fundamentals and Principles of Business Success. These courses teach me a lot of things that I can use in the future to make my business a success.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel? 

After completing my degree I would love to work in, marketing sector and I would love to have my own catering business. I also want to travel in my job because I live exploring and meeting new people in my life.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?  

I was born in Soweto but I live in Tembisa now with my mom, brother, sister and her children. I also have an older brother who lives in Soweto. My mother is the domestic worker and I do not know what my father does because he left when I was very young and he did not take care of us. I am not yet married and I have no children. My mom is growing old and can no longer work because she needs to rest and I have to work hard in order for me to help her out in the house and to take care of us.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time? 

In my spare time I like to spend quality time with my family, play netball and sing in the choir at school. I also help children out in my community with their school work and teach some sports

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? 

The Kiva loan will help me pay me my fees and it will help me with my transport money for school. It will also make my life easier because with the loan I will be able to further my studies and reduce my stresses for school fees.  This is giving me a better chance of doing  much better in my studies because my mind will be clearer.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Gladiwelly

texts.en:
Gladiwelly is 35 years, married and blessed with 5 children. She has a grocery business and has been running the business for 4 years. She will be using the loan to buy vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and bananas for sell so as to serve more customers and make more income to support her family. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes are to open a grocery store and sell more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and bananas for sell so as to serve more customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: 030913040003.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has worked in agriculture planting vegetables for more than 10 years.  Hồng is a reputable person in the community. She is the group leader of the 030913040003.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 6 members.  She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province in Vietnam, with 3 dependents.

In 2010, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable seedling to grow and sell in the future.  Hồng has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.  The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings to grow and sell in the future.

loans.name: Toeaso

texts.en:
Toeaso is a 44-years-old, and married with 4 children. She runs a very profitable food stall at the town market, catering to very hungry customers day in and day out. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. 

Toeaso has requested a loan to buy two large gas burners, a cooler, a freezer, a gas bottle and a brand new taxi. 

Toeaso has been a member of SPBD since 2007. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also help with her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy two large gas burners, a cooler, a freezer, a gas bottle and a brand new taxi

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona earns a livelihood by engaging in fishing. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her place.  She is 47 year old, a married woman with 2 children ages 15 and 22 year old respectively. Aside from fishing, she also runs a sari-sari(variety) store.  She sells basic household commodities like sugar, noodles, canned goods, and toiletries. She lacks capital to sustain her business.

She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, soap, shampoo and rtw(ready to wear) items like t-shirts, pants and jeans. Thus, she could cater more customers and be able to settle her finances.She could now continue finance the schooling of her youngest child.
 
Ma Chona is determined to improve her both sources of income properly to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, soap, shampoo and rtw

loans.name: Diomedes Alesis

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive don Diomedes,  tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de una hermana. 
El señor Diomedes es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ganarse la vida a punta de trabajo honesto, el en sociedad con un familiar tienen un local en el centro de la ciudad donde venden pañales, artículos de aseo, perfumes y muchos otros productos, allí trabaja todos los días junto a su socia con la cual comparten el trabajo y las ganancias que da el negocio, los fines de semana que es cuando más venden, el está repitiendo el crédito con la fundación ya que quiere aumentar la variedad de productos y así obtener más ganancias pues así mejora su calidad de vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pañales, artículos de aseo, perfumes y todo de lo que ellos venden en su local. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financian su negocio. Sus sueños seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte canton each 15 days the members of the Working Together Credit Group gather. This location is known for the delicious sweets that the locals prepare, recognized all over the country.

Diomedes lives here. He is 61 years old, single, and resides in a sister's house.

Diomedes is a hard-working man who enjoys earning his living through honest work. He, together with another family member, operates a stand in the city center where they sell diapers, cleaning supplies, perfumes and many other products. Here Diomedes labors every day with his partner, with whom he shares the work as well as the earnings the business produces. Weekends are when they sell the most. 

Diomedes is applying anew to the Foundation for a loan, since they wish to augment the variety of their products and, thus, obtain more earnings. In this manner he can improve his quality of life.

This loan will be used to purchase diapers, cleaning supplies, perfumes and other items they sell at their stand. Diomedes has been a member of his Credit Group through six loan cycles and he likes it because with these loan, he can finance his business.

His dreams are to advance along with his business.

loans.use: buy diapers, cleaning supplies, perfumes, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a progressive Kenyan lady from Kisii area who is deeply engaged in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Nancy is married and has a 3-year-old child. Her child is her source of inspiration as she struggles with challenges of running the farm.  

Nancy applied for a loan because she wants to enlarge her dairy farm and generate more income. She plans to use the borrowed money to buy a dairy cow. The Kiva-financed cow will improve her livelihood through increase monthly income derived from additional milk produced.  

Nancy needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her income

loans.name: Pthani

texts.en:
Pthani, age 37, is a married woman and a mother of 6 children. In order to bear her everyday expenses she started her business of agriculture along with her husband. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. Pthani is happily doing her job and can manage her work at home as well. 

Currently Pthani has applied a loan of 55000 PKR, to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.  This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash. She has already availed loans from Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Farzana  is popularly known in her area for her skill in sewing. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 35000. 

With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 62-year-old active borrower of Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of eight children. Her husband is the guardian of her entire family and is responsible for fulfilling all their needs. Her husband has been providing laundry services for the past 20 years, and manage the household. 

Nasreen's husband needs laundry materials such as Surf, bleach, iron, etc. for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he is not in the position to buy all these things for business use. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan, her husband can purchase all these relevant items for his business to provide better laundry services and earn maximum profit to save to fulfill the needs of her family.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his laundry business

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
Sostenes, who is in his mid 30s is married with two children who are in school.  He has been growing and selling vegetables since 2006.  He works from 7am to 5pm daily and is able to make a  good monthly profit. 

This will be Sostenes's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy seeds, manure, water for irrigation and to supply to more customers.  He dreams of building his own house.  

Sostenes will share this loan with his loan group Songa Mbele  which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, water for irigation and to supply to more customers

loans.name: Farangez

texts.en:
Farangez is a kind girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996 and is living in a beautiful city where live hospitable people. She is single and lives with her parents. She is an active, hardworking and capable person. 

She wants to open her beauty salon for women. She is planning to renovate her apartment and buy necessary cosmetics and tools. She participated at a three day training provided by IMON to start-up clients and decided to get a loan to open her own beauty salon. 

She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and support to opening a beauty salon.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon to provide an income

loans.name: Villa Alegre Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 61 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de pollo frito.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por los orígenes de sus pobladores; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del área e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio, de clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Antonia es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello gris largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza (sentada a la derecha, viste blusa celeste). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja, sus hijos son independientes y tienen sus familias, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de continuar con su actividad decidió formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de limpieza, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos y venta de ropa de temporada, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de pollo frito, actividad que realiza en un puesto de venta en la calle en diferentes lugares. Su comida está compuesta por trozos de carne de pollo tierno, a veces enharinados o rebozados, y luego fritos. Lo que distingue a su pollo frito de otras frituras de pollo es que habitualmente las corta por las articulaciones, dejando los huesos y la piel intactos. La piel crujiente bien condimentada, sin exceso de grasa, es el rasgo distintivo de su pollo bien frito; “voy a abrir mi puesto de venta fijo, para eso necesito realizar un techo para cubrir del sol y la lluvia a mis clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es una comida rápida que se consume a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la construcción de un techo. Su sueño es abrir un snack de venta de pollo frito, ella desea realizar la construcción de un techo para su nuevo puesto de venta de pollo frito para cubrir a sus clientes de las inclemencias del tiempo. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año y medio que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Antonia solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un techo para su nuevo puesto de venta de pollo frito para cubrir a sus clientes de las inclemencias del tiempo.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 61-year-old married woman and has two independent children. Her business is selling fried chicken. She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, independent, generous, patient, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is developed on itinerant basis in the area 'plan 3000' characterized by  its population's origins; Ayoreas native tribes and relocated western miners took ownership of the area and began manufacturing and trading. With a hot, subtropical and very humid  climate daytime temperatures vary from 21 to 35 degrees centigrade. 

Antonia has a dark complexion, brown eyes, wears glasses, long gray hair which she wears tied behind the neck, a short stature and median physical build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which is spoken in her family; she speaks Spanish as part of general culture and for the trade she is doing. (Antonia is pictured sitting down on the right, wearing the celestial blouse.) She shares her life with her husband, who works, and her independent children who have their own families. They live in their own house, built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof and brick floor. At home, they have drinking water, electricity and a sewage system. Due to her need to continue with her activity, she decided to form a group of people with businesses such as selling second hand clothes, selling fruit, selling tomatoes, confection of textiles, selling fish, cleaning services, selling pasties, trading cosmetics, and seasonal clothing sales, in order to request a loan and improve her activities. 

Her business is selling fried chicken, an activity performed in a stall in the street in different places. Her food consists of chunks of tender chicken meat, sometimes floured or coated and then fried. What distinguishes her fried chicken from others is that she usually cuts the chicken pieces in the joint, leaving bones and skin intact. The well seasoned crispy skin, without excess fat, is the distinctive feature of her good fried chicken; "I will open my fixed selling place, for that I need to build the roof to cover from the sun and rain my customers …,” she says. The advantage is that is a fast food business and is consumed daily; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to build the roof. Her dream is to open a place to sell snack of fried chicken. She hopes to build the roof for her new place to sell the fried chicken, in order to cover its customers from the inclement weather. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the first year and a half that she has been running this activity.

For these reasons, Antonia is requesting a loan to to build the roof for her new place to sell the fried chicken, in order to cover its customers from the inclement weather.

loans.use: to build the roof for her new place to sell the fried chicken, in order to cover its customers from the inclement weather

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his pastry business to meet high client demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a hammer for crushing big stones into kokoto (small stones) for sale to customers in need of constructing materials

loans.name: Thouymai Group

texts.en:
Tai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Tai and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Tai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Tai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ogopa Sheria Grp Group

texts.en:
Saiga is late 40's married and has five children, four boys and one girl who are still in school. He manages a general store selling dry foods and drinks for five years now. He starts working from 7.am to 6:30.pm per working day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his second credit request, which he will use to increase inventories for his shop;beans,maize and baking flours, sugar, drinks etc. He managed to repay back successfully his previous loan used to improve his shop. He dreams to expand his shop. 
He will share this loan with his loan group"OGOPA SHERIA" consist of two members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventories for his shop; beans,maize and baking flours, sugar,drinks etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm input for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Rodina

texts.en:
Rodina is 49 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Rodina has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rodina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 38 ans, Ama est une femme mère d’un seul enfant. Ama habite à Bè et vend des claies pour la couverture des toits et des habitats dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Ama s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché local de Lomé. Pour commander des claies, Ama demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leur enfant.
texts.en: Married and aged 38, Ama is the mother of an only child. She lives in Bè and sells reeds used to cover roofs and houses in the area in order to earn enough profit for their well-being. To manage this, Ama stocks up once a month at the local market in Lomé. To order some reeds, Ama is requesting this loan so that she can complete her purchase and have income to help her husband with the education of their child.

loans.use: to buy 120 piles of reeds

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 47 ans, Akossiwa est une femme qui vit à Bè  ses trois enfants. Dans son quartier, Akossiwa vend du charbon de bois  à ses clients et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Akossiwa s’approvisionne huit fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Akossiwa demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs charbons de bois et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa, age 47, is a married mother of three who lives in Bè. She sells charcoal around her neighborhood, and manages to earn a living through this activity. In order to meet customer demand, Akossiwa buys charcoal from her suppliers eight times per month. She is seeking this loan to purchase sacks of charcoal, hoping to bolster her revenue and help her husband with the household’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 39 years old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  

Tasleem’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. 

Therefore, Tasleem  has requested for 40000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Mbali

texts.en:
Mbali is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This her story:1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most? I am studying a Bachelor in Business Administration and the classes that I enjoy most are Human Resource Management, Financial Management and Principles of Economics  
2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel? I am going to be a financial manager, I want to go work overseas in America, but for starters I will work here in Johannesburg and gain experience and then go where I want to go. I love traveling so I would like to travel one day.
3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children? I was born in Soweto Meadowlands  but for many years I kept changing where I lived because my mom passed on. I am an only child, and now I do not have parents. I stay with my grandmother who takes very good care of me. My three cousins and two uncles also stay with us as they are all unemployed. I am not married and I do not have any children.
4.	What do you like to do in your spare time? I like reading novels, watching movies, playing tennis with friends
5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? A Kiva loan will help me to have enough money for transport. This will mean that I will be able to come to school early because my current mode of transport (train) is not reliable, so I will be able to use a taxi and be on time.  I will be able to buy all the necessary things that I need and my life will be better.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Pederita

texts.en:
Pederita is married and lives in Aloran, Philippines. For a living, she engages in buying and selling firewood to the local community. Pederita has been doing this for 15 years. 

Since she wants to be more productive, she applied for a loan to pay for more loads of firewood for reselling. 

Pederita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies. She wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to pay for more loads of firewood for resale

loans.name: 01 - Tân Hà - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Quế is 52 years old and married with 3 children. Her children are married but their families' circumstances are difficult. She helps her grand children go to school from her own money.

Quế lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk and general items for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable.

The main hardship that Quế faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk etc to expand the kind of goods in her store. She hope to increase her income to improve her family's life. This is Quế's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Quế hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, to help her grand children, and to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk etc to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maize flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and detergent for sell and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
You’ll experience food cravings when you taste Corazon’s recipes. Since she has a talent for making delicious dishes, Corazon started to sell her specialties five years ago. And until now, her income from this business has helped her family pay for basic necessities and expenses. 

Corazon is 54 years old already. She has four kids with Jonas, a loader, and they live in Pasay City, Philippines. The couple has to ensure their children's future financial security, so they are indeed striving hard to provide for the family today. 

Hoping that you can help her, Corazon would like to ask for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000. She wants to improve her small business, and she would like to use this amount to purchase additional quantities of raw ingredients for her recipes. She expects that through this loan, she can experience an increase in her product sales. 

It is her dream to have their lives in a better condition and to be successful in her field. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional quantities of raw ingredients for her recipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm for a better harvest for family use and sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is 65 years old, widow with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lory is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lory has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 61 years old and married with six children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Corazon has requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Corazon has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 73-year-old farmer from Kabirer village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Ruth is widowed. She has 4 children who are staying with their families but they visit from time to time to check up on her.
  
Ruth applied for a loan because she wants to have a second dairy cow to produce more milk, which is her main income source.  The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income. 

To Ruth, this loan is important because she needs more income to meet her basic needs and afford proper health care.

loans.use: to buy a second dairy cow for more milk production

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 57-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest is 21 and the youngest is 15.   She sells fresh fish to the locals in the community. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells her husband's catch. She needs funds to finance her source of living.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP to buy a motorboat engine. This will help ease in transporting the catch of her husband. Thus, it will augment his husband's yield and it enables Letecia to sold more fish. Slowly, her income  will  be enough for her family and also she could start to expand her fishing business as well.
 
In the future, Letecia is determined to handle her livelihood properly to improve the family's living conditions and be continue finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a motorboat engine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of retail goods for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 47 years old, married to Florence and supports a family of 3 children. 

He has been practicing livestock farming for the last 7 years earning KES5,000 per month.

Samwel has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in area for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his farming activities. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in area for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jembes (hoes) for farming and fertilizers for top dressing his farm crops so as to get better produce for family use and for sale in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jembes for farming and fertilizer for top dressing his crops in his farm so as to get better produce for family use and to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get milk to supply to her customers and make more income to support her family and also to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
It all starts with a dream. 

Wanting to invest someday for a car, expand her business and eventually succeed in life, Clarita, 67 years of age, is now doing her very best to excel in her craft. 

Clarita resides in Caloocan City. She is married to Gregorio, and they have one kid. Currently, Clarita is operating her buy-and-sell business. She is selling different kinds of toys, and the profit she gets from the business covers their family expenses.

To further improve the business, she wants to ask for a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use for buying more products to sell associated with her inventory. With this, she can surely gain more income. Part of what she will gain she will save for future investments, and part will be used for their everyday living. 
 
You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Clarita meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell associated with her inventory.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Meddred is 22 years old and is the second of six children in the family. His mother Virginia supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Meddred is studying for a Bachelor's degree in elementary education and is currently in the third year of this four-year course.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 4,685 to pay tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When Meddred graduates, he plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a widowed woman with seven children. Esterlita is 56 years old and three of her children are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Esterlita sells purified drinking water in the Philippines. Esterlita has been in this business for 16 years.

Esterlita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell and earns additional income from general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 42-year-old man and is married. He looks after his family, which consists of five sons.

He has been running a restaurant for three years. He provides and serves good and fresh food meals to the people who work near his restaurant, which is situated in the main market. A great many shop keepers come into his restaurant to eat delicious food.
