He needs some fresh food items to develop his business, as well as some materials, Therefore, he decided to apply for a loan to buy food supplies and spices, and also some materials that will help him to increase the quality of his work.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and spices and materials that will help him to increase the quality of his work.

loans.name: Kiyenje Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Kiyenje Twimukye group is located in Kakirago village, Bugangari Sub County, Rukungiri district. The group is comprised of men whose major activity is agriculture. Tomas is in a black coat in the group photo is one person who depends on agriculture and goat rearing for a livelihood. He trades in goats to support his family alongside the small pay he earns as a local pastor in his church. His problem has been limited capital. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX600,000 to expand his business by buying more goats for selling. The main challenge is theft around the village and the fluctuating prices of coffee which affects the cash flow. 

Despite all the challenges, Tomas is very determined and positive to change his future.
The group members appreciate UGAFODE for the financial support and literacy training by UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd.

loans.use: To buy goats for selling

loans.name: Munawara

texts.en:
Munawara is a 50 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 4 children. 

She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: 05 - Bào Ngoại - Phường Đông Hương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thảo is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a retail business selling dry food for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover, this job is unstable.

The main hardship that Thảo faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to expand her store for better income. 

This is Thảo first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She hopes that her family life will be improved after using this loan.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her business to do well.  She hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Working hard for your loved ones - it's priceless!

This is Salome, 59, from Caloocan City, Metro Manila. She is currently taking over a variety store business. She's married to Ramon who is currently unemployed. A great challenge indeed, but they both strive for a living for their household.

Salome dreams of having a better life for her kids. The kids are the main reason why she wants to expand her inventory. Here, she really needs your help. She envisions a well developed business but apparently, she's financially challenged at this time. So, to remedy the problem, she would like to ask for a loan worth PHP 12,000. She would use this to purchase more supplies of a greater variety of merchandise to sell, such as grocery items.

She knows that you'll help her with this. This is your time to make an impact in a person's life.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of a greater variety of merchandise to sell, such as grocery items.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Clothing is indeed an unchangeable part of our lives. Due to this mere fact, Lydia, 54, found business herself in clothing industry. She is a very hard working entrepreneur from Intramuros city, Philippines. As of now, she operates a buy-and-sell business of ready-to-wear products such as bridal gowns. Through this, she is able to gain a little profit which she basically uses for primary expenditures within the household. 

She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells them in retail to mostly people within their community. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to favorable prices and the many options they are offered. 

With a humble heart, Lydia would like to avail a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes for her business to expand and succeed. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soap and other washing detergents, tissue paper, toothpaste, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase jembes for farming and fertilizers for top-dressing his crops on his farm to get a better produce for family use and others for sale in the market.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 29-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop and her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Sonia has been running her own beauty salon for the past many years and she contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e. creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Sonia has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Sonia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her salon business

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 42 years, a hardworking woman who has 5 children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. 

She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Shabana’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Shabana has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. 

She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group 2 Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a group leader and 29 years old. She is married with three children between two and seven years old. 

The group is called "Tuzamurane," which means “support each other" in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their business to change their future for the better. She has a shop and has been running a business for six years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Viineem Group

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Dimanche est un jeune dame, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est la responsable de ce groupe qui regroupe des femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Dimanche fait des gâteaux pour vendre et cela fait 3 ans. Pour satisfaire à la demande de ses clients, Dimanche a besoin d'un prêt pour son activité. Elle aimerait acheter de la farine de blé chacun, un bidon d'huile de 20 litre, du sucre, de la levure et tout autre ingrédient nécessaire pour faire des gâteaux pour vendre. Pour protéger l'environnement, cette brave dame utilise du gaz butane pour faire cuire ses gâteaux, donc une partie de l'argent servira aussi à charger son gaz. Dimanche fait ses gâteaux très tôt le matin et elle est installée à proximité des écoles où il y'a beaucoup de passant et c'est ce qui fait sa force. En plus de cet atout, elle est accueillante et propre. Après ses ventes, le bénéfice qu'elle aura lui permettra de continuer son activité et d'aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Dimanche, age 31, is a young lady who is married with four children. She is the head of this group which consists of strong women who practice commercial activities. 

Dimanche has been selling homemade cakes for the past 3 years. To meet customer demand, she is seeking a loan to support her activity. She wants to buy wheat flour, a 20-liter jug of oil, some sugar, some yeast and any other ingredient needed to prepare her cakes. Due to her concern for the environment, she uses butane gas to bake her cakes and will therefore use part of her loan to refuel. 

Dimanche’s strength is that she bakes her cakes very early in the morning, and she conducts her sales near the schools where the traffic is substantial. In addition, she is clean and welcoming. 

Proceeds from her sales will help her to sustain her activity and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, a jug of oil, some sugar, some yeast and any other ingredient needed to prepare her cakes.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 40, resident of Intramuros, Manila City. She is married to Armilfo and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household, while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates an 'Piso-Net' business. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and arcade rental services, wherein customers can pay the services by inserting coins into the machine. There is more need for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the Internet and any social network. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional Piso Net units for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Evelyn dreams to give her family a better and sustainable livelihood.  She always prays for the health of her family. Likewise, she also aspires to expand her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional Piso Net units for her business.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez  is 57 years old, widow as been running a business of milk selling for many years. She has buffaloes for milking purposes and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 4 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income

loans.name: Caribeans Girl Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario CARIBEAN GIRL está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Jeammie Eugenia, Liza Merly y Nora Isabel), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 8 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana  para poder tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de: venta de mariscos, ropa usada y pulperia, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Con el segundo crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por Kiva, le permitieron a las 3 integrantes del grupo solidario diversificar la oferta de productos que venden, por ejemplo  a Jeammie Eugenia, compro insumos e ingredientes para elaborar vigoron y comprar mariscos y pescados para incrementar sus ingresos al vender de manera ambulante.

Jeammie Eugenia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven cordial de 25 años de edad, madre soltera de una pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia y contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años vende de manera ambulante vigoron, fritos, mariscos y pescados. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda, actualmente habita en una vivienda de familiares.
texts.en:
The CARIBEAN GIRL group is made up of three entrepreneurial women (Jeammie Eugenia, Liza Merly y Nora Isabel) who live in the city of Bilwi. They formed 8 months ago with the aim of working together to be able to access Pana Pana loans to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses (selling seafood, used clothing and a grocery store), improve their income and thus improve the quality of life of their families.

The second loan granted by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, allowed the three group members to widen the range of products that they sell. For example Jeammie Eugenia bought supplies and ingredients to make vigoron (a Nicaraguan fast food dish) and buy seafood and fish to increase her income on selling them as a street vendor.

Jeammie Eugenia is the coordinator of the group. She is a friendly young woman, 25 years old, and is the single mother of a small three year old daughter. With the aim of helping her family get ahead and being able to count on her own source of income, for three years she has sold vigoron, fried food, seafood and fish as a street vendor. She is asking for a loan to be able to diversify her products and buy a bale of used clothing in Managua. Her dream is to have her own house, as she currently lives in the house of relatives.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is an 84-year-old farmer from Kabirer village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Helena is married and has 6 children. This year, she and her husband will be marking their 50th Anniversary !

Helena applied for a loan because she wants to increase the number of dairy cows on her farm. She plans to buy an additional cow with the borrowed money in order to increase the quantity of milk produced for sale. 

Through the Kiva-financed cow, Helena will boost her monthly income and improve her the diets of her family.

loans.use: to buy another cow to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 29 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. She is a farmer and she grows cash crops and also does dairy farming. 

She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow and hopes this will enable her to get milk to sell and make more income to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and be able to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and hopes this will enable her to get milk to sell to her customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 46, is a vendor of fruits and vegetables by trade. For 27 years now, her four children witnessed how she endured everything just to find a way to support Danilo, her husband, in generating enough income to provide for the family. 

Milagros didn't finish her studies. Though it was actually a disappointment, she never considers herself a mess. In contrast, she strives even more to prove that success is never far from reach to those who have the guts to take risks and courage to face life. 

She is very enthusiastic and positive in life. In fact, she is very hopeful today that you would allow her to borrow the amount she needed (PHP 50,000 in particular) to garner additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall at the marketplace. Maybe this is also the reason why her colleagues enjoy her company. 

To mention, they regularly meet every week to encourage one another (simultaneously studying the word of God.)She has this living hope. She believes that someday, through hard work, her inventory will grow and that her family condition will stay safe, successful and sound.  

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell at her stall at the marketplace.

loans.name: Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Katupyry” está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 17 mujeres todos ellas vecinas y amigas que se unieron con la esperanza de poder ayudarse las una a las otras, y por medio de ese trabajo unido poder salir adelante por sus familias.
Ramona es una de las personas de este grupo, quien se destaca por ser luchadora, trabajadora y muy sacrificada, ella se dedica a la venta de leche, y comenta que realiza su trabajo desde muy temprano en la mañana para que sus clientes tengan su producto para la hora del desayuno.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere surtirse con más cantidad de leche y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar ya que con ello ayuda a su familia y sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group named “Katupyry” is in its second loan cycle of the programme of the women's committee made up of 17 women, all neighbours and friends who united with the hope of being able to help each other, and through this working together be able to get ahead for their families.

Ramona is one of the people in this group, and stands out for being a fighter, hardworking and very self-sacrificing. She earns a living selling milk and says that she does her work very early in the morning so that her customers have her product in time for breakfast.

She is asking for this loan as she wishes to stock a larger quantity of milk, with which she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is greatful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and improve, as she can then help her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She sales used clothes at the market on retail basis. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality of clothes. 

Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level. She lives in rented house with access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes to help pay for advanced education for her children

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a hospitable woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1984 and is living with her family. She is married and has three children. She has many years of practice doing business in agriculture. She plants agricultural products and sells her harvest in domestic market. 

During years of her activity she tired and got sick, but she does not want to stop doing business. She appeals to IMON asking a loan to be treated at a medical clinic. She hopes would be healthy and to continue her activity to help her husband to ensure their family.

loans.use: to be treated at medical clinic

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 35 years of age, a married woman with four children.  Her oldest child is 9 and the youngest is 2.  She operates a sari-sari(variety) store, selling dried fish, canned goods, cooking oil, shampoo, beverages and other merchandise. Aside from that, she also goes fishing and sells fresh fish. Her husband is also a fisherman. She is the one selling her husband's catch. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 16,000 PHP to buy to buy groceries for the store like beverages, condiments,and assorted groceries. With these, her income will improve and able to pay her obligations. Thus, she will be able to provide her family with nutritious meals and better shelter to live. 

Josephine is doing her best to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store like beverages, condiments,and assorted groceries.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and she runs a small sari-sari (general) store business, selling items like chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, seasoning, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and cooking oil. She also raises hogs for a living. 

Maria and her husband have one child, a 12-year-old son who is currently studying in school.

Maria has requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to expand her business. She would like to buy coffee, candy, chips, seasoning, toiletries, and condiments. This will help her keep her business running for longer periods of time, which will increase her overall income.

loans.use: to buy coffee, candy, chips, seasoning, toiletries, and condiments.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Catalina es de la ciudad de Lambaré, es dueña de un negocio de ventas de bebidas en general, donde cuenta con clientela formada, que siempre compra de ella la variedad de productos que ofrece.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está poniendo todo su empeño para que por medio de su trabajo ayude a su familia. Quiere seguir esforzándose para crecer y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas varias en general, de manera a poder surtir su negocio y darle a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
Catalina is from the city of Lambaré, and owns a business selling beverages in general. She has an established clientele, who always buy from her the variety of products she sells. 

She is a very hard-working person who is devoting all her efforts so that by means of her work she can help her family. She wants to continue doing her best to grow and improve each day. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy various beverages, enabling her to stock her business and give her customers what they ask for.

loans.use: To buy various beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Moncerrate

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores  de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que le gusta conseguir sus propios recursos a base de trabajo, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene unas vitrinas  en su casa en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo, ella vende muy rápido ya que ofrece una gran variedad de prendas y a precios cómodos, deja a crédito  y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene mucha clientela la cual ha logrado en sus 35 años que lleva vendiendo ropa lo cual le encanta ya que se entretiene en sus ventas y también se gana lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su vida cada vez más.
texts.en:
The partners from the Trabajando Juntas Credit Group meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is famous for the delicious sweets locals make, which are renowned all over the country. Mercedes lives in this place, she is 59, married and has five children of legal age from this marriage, three of whom live at home. Her husband is retired.

Mercedes is a woman who likes to get her own resources through work. She works in trade. She has display cabinets with all kinds of clothes at her house to sell them. She sells very quickly because she offers a wide variety of clothes at affordable prices, extends credit to people and charges them every eight days.

She has many customers that she has acquired during the 35 years she has been selling clothes. She loves doing it because she has fun and earns her own money. This loan will be used to buy all kinds of clothes. She has participated in 3 loan cycles with the Credit Group and she likes it because the loans are quick. Her dream is to keep getting ahead and improving her life more and more.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ma. Mae

texts.en:
Ma. May is a 24 year old college graduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 6. Her father works as a farm laborer and her mother works as a dry goods vendor. She has 4 siblings. Ma. May is the youngest in the family.  The family’s total monthly income of Php 12,000($269 ) is barely enough to provide their basic needs.  

Ma. May needs to find means to help the family have more income. That’s why she went through the selection process of Bagosphere’s 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Ma. May wants to have a stable job in a BPO company, and become a successful businesswoman. 

Your generosity will help Ma. May to have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama KUÑA RORY están en el 3er. ciclo con 18 integrantes, ellas se pusieron como meta ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder de esa manera ayudar a sus seres queridos. 
Una de las integrantes la señora Maria, es muy emprendedora se dedica a las ventas, cuenta con un copetín a cercanías de un lugar estratégico donde ofrece minutas, bebidas y golosinas, es bastante amable y con su carisma logra tener muchos clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, golosinas y otros productos para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio y ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is called Kuña Rory and they are in their third loan cycle. With 18 members, they have set as their goal helping one another and that way helping their loved ones.

One of the members is Maria. She is very enterprising and has a small business, a café near a strategic location where she sells snacks, drinks and candy. She is quite friendly, and with her charm, manages to have many customers.  


She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of drinks, candy, and other products, so that she can continue stocking her business and offer a good selection to her customers.

loans.use: To buy drinks, candy, and other products.

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Luthiberta is in her early 40s and is single with two children who are still in school.  For the past four years, she has been a tailor who runs a small shop. Luthiberta works from seven in the morning through nine at night and is able to make a small monthly profit. She has successfully borrowed and repaid three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. Luthiberta used these loans to start a small shop and also increase her sewing equipment and tailoring materials.

Luthiberta is a member of the loan group Mbogo, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy materials for her tailoring business and also buy products for her small shop where she sells soft drinks. Luthiberta is happy with her loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for their support. She will use the profit from her loan to pay school fees, to repay her loan, and cover her household expenses. In the future, Luthiberta dreams of owning a big retail shop.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business and products for her shop where she sells soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail goods to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 25-year-old farmer from Kabirer village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings in an important source of income for her family. Lilian is single-handedly raising three children between the ages of seven and 12. Her children help Lilian with her work from time to time.

Lilian is requesting a loan to start a milk-vending business. She will buy milk from other smallholder dairy farmers to resell. Lilian has 15 years of experience as a dairy farmer and she has learned so much about the dairy market that she wants to start a business around her body of knowledge. She has a wide network of buyers who are able and willing to buy milk from her at favorable prices. Lilian's hope is that her new investment will elevate her family’s livelihood and generate enough monthly income to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy milk from smallholder dairy farmers to resell

loans.name: Dora Mercedes

texts.es:
Dora convirtió  la tecnología su principal  aliada, porque aprovechó la demanda de los niños y adolescentes hacia los vídeo juegos, como una oportunidad para generar ingresos desde su hogar.  Inició con ayuda de su esposo y de su hermano, que la apoyaron para ofrecer los servicios de alquiler de  nintendos. 

Al principio solo tenía un par de televisores, pero con las ganancias y la buena administración ha ido ampliándose. Sin embargo, solicita un préstamo para la compra de una consola de vídeo juego, esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá ofrecer más equipos y en consiguiente atenderá más clientes. Asimismo, ampliará sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dora has made technology her main ally, because she has taken advantage of the demand from children and teens for video games, and used it as an opportunity for generating income by working from home. She started with the help of her husband and her brother, who helped her offer Nintendo rental services. At the beginning she only had a pair of televisions, but with the earnings and good management, she has been gradually expanding. 

However, she is requesting a loan to buy a video game console. This will be a big help to her because she will be able to offer more equipment and thereby serve more customers. As well, she will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a video game console.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 35 years old. He is married to Lispher and supports five children. Wilfred is a small-scale farmer who earns 10,000 KES each month.

Wilfred is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizer and seeds to improve his farm. This will be his first loan. Wilfred plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to repay his loan and improve his family’s living standards. His hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve his farm

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice wants to thank Kiva lenders for her previous loan which allowed her to purchase fertilizer and certified seeds. She was able to earn more income from the increased production of potatoes and she paid school fees for her children after selling her potatoes.

Alice is requesting a loan to buy goats and sheep for slaughter. She has a butcher shop, and her loan will help her to meet the demand for meat. Alice looks forward to improving her business profits, continuing to provide food for her family, and paying school fees for her children. Alice is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for their support and she promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase meat to boost sales in her butcher shop

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: A 48 ans, Nathalie est une femme mariée et avec son  enfant, elle vit dans le quartier de Tokoin. Pour répondre aux besoins de la famille et soutenir son mari, Nathalie vend des graines de bissap servant à fabriquer du jus. Nathalie s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Nathalie nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des graines afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de son enfant.
texts.en: Nathalie is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in the Tokoin neighborhood with her child. In order to meet the needs of the family and support her husband, Nathalie sells hibiscus flower seeds used to make a hibiscus drink. Nathalie gets her supplies from the market five times per month. She needs this loan to purchase seeds in order to make more of a profit and support her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of hibiscus flower seeds.

loans.name: Diaselvia

texts.en:
Diaselvia is 27 years old and live in Badian, Cebu. She has two children aged five and seven.

For two years, she has been selling snacks like fruit, candies, biscuits and chips. She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more stocks of fruit, biscuits, chips and candies.

In the future, she hope to have a big sari-sari (general) store for a better revenue. Her income will be utilized for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fruit, biscuits, chips and candies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients like soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar, and meat and to pay for renovation of her restaurant and buy food for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy feed for his animals, for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 52-year-old farmer from Kipsigak village who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Francisca is married and has three children who help her with the work.

Francisca applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.

Francisca needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses, and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 77 years old, married, and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings, and especially enterprise development.

She is a mixed farmer practicing poultry, vegetable, and dairy farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed, which will enable her to increase egg production. With increased income, she will be able to provide better food, clothing, and education to her children

Loise is grateful to Kiva and their lenders. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed; hence increase egg production for increased income to provide better food, clothing, and education to her children.

loans.name: Songtaaba Hamado Group

texts.fr:
Mr HAMADO est responsable du groupe SONGTAABA HAMADO. Marié, il est père d'un (01) enfant qui est âgé de 05ans. Il ne va pas à l'école.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 06ans. Il s'approvisionne au barrage de Zamyarga.
Il veut s'acheter 01sacs d'engrais.
Il veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne pouvoir scolariser ses enfants dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamado is the leader of Songtaaba Hamado Group. He is married and the father of one child, who is five years old and does not attend school. Mr. Hamado has been involved in market gardening for six years. He gets his supplies at the Zamyarga [dam or roadblock].

Mr. Hamado wants to purchase one sack of fertilizer. He wants to reinvest his profits in his business. His goal is to be able to pay his children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of fertilizer.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is an 18-year old college undergraduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 5. Her father works as a construction laborer while her mother works as a farm laborer. Beverly is the second child and has 2 siblings. Her eldest brother works as a construction laborer, while the youngest is in elementary school.

The family’s total monthly income is PHP 10,000 ($224). This encourages Beverly to find means to help the family. Beverly aims to become a customer service representative, continue her studies and help her family.

Your loan assistance will help Beverly achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en:
Latofat is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is a widow and has four children. She has been working at a medical clinic for about six years. She works in the registration department. She likes her work and takes care of her children alone.

She is a responsible, capable and honest person. Her son is sick and needs to be treated at hospital. She does not have the money to treat her son. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to treat her son in hospital. She hopes to have a healthy son and awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to treat her son in hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs and certified seeds for use for high production and supply to increase her income.

loans.name: Luzpura

texts.en:
Luzpura is 53 years from Ronda, Cebu. She is married with one daughter who is 15 years old.

She has been engaged in raising hogs for a living for the last three years. She usually earns PHP 20,000 every time she sell her fattened hogs. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and sacks of feed to sustain her livelihood.

Luzpura hopes to expand her business someday and make it more profitable for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and sacks of feed

loans.name: Hongthong Group

texts.en:
Pea understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Pea knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Pea purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Pea is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mahakali Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
This group of five women hails from Dahod, India. They are led by Sangitaben, who is standing in the center. Sangitaben is a 47-year-old mother of three children. The household income is INR 10,000, which is insufficient to meet household expenses and pay for the children's education. The monthly savings are just INR 2,000. Hence, Sangitaben thought of starting her business to supplement the family income.

She started her tiffin business, where she packs lunches and sells them. With this business, she is currently earning INR 4,000. But she wants to earn more to support her children's education. Hence, she came up with the idea to avail herself of a loan to expand her business.

She got together with four other women who share similar interests. The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing businesses. All the other women are into selling vegetables in the market. They will use the loan to expand their vegetable businesses and earn more income. They sell tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, cauliflower, cabbage, ginger, ladies finger, onions etc.

Together, the group seeks a loan of INR 75,000. Your loan will help these women earn more and give a good education to their children. It will also pave the way for a good standard of living and happiness among these families.

loans.use: to expand her tiffin business.

loans.name: Kabende Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Barnabas is a member of Kabende Tukurakurane Group, where members guarantee each other for a loan. Barnabas has four children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time, a teacher, where he earns a salary.

He is faced with challenges of price fluctuations that hinder expansion of his business. He is looking forward to educating all his children to higher levels of learning.

He has asked for a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, match boxes, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, match boxes, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for beef.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs and certified seeds for planting for high production and supply to earn more income.

loans.name: Jay Krishna Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
This group of 5 women hail from Dahod, India. They are led by Manjulaben who is standing in the center. Manjulaben is a 36-year-old mother of 2 children. The household income is INR 12,500 which is insufficient to meet the household expenses and pay for the children's education. The monthly savings are just INR 2,500. Hence Manjulaben thought of starting her business to supplement the family income.

Manjulaben started her grocery store business where she sells rice, oil, ghee etc. Through this business she is currently earning INR 5,000. But she wants to earn more to support her children's education. Hence she decided to seek a loan to expand her business. She got together with four other women who share similar interests. The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing businesses too.

Together the group seeks a loan of INR 67,000. Your loan will help these women earn more and give a good education to their children. It will also pave the way for a good standard of living and happiness among these families.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Jyamberemunyarwandakazi Group

texts.en:
JYAMBEREMUNYARWANDAKAZI is a group led by Assia, who is 35 years old. The group name means “Developing women for Rwanda” in English. 

Assia is married with two children aged 15 and 18 years. They both go to school. Assia sells clothes and has been doing this business for the past 12 years. Her group members sell different items but they all have the same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, Assia would like to buy more trousers and shirts for selling. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and shirts for selling.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina, 33, a resident of Intramuros, Manila City. Despite her age, she’s still buckling down; doing everything she can to help her husband, Reynaldo in providing for the family in spite the breadline. She has had a stall for fruits and vegetables for years now and she really longs to improve this. 

Yours now is the chance to help, as Cristina lets you know her sincerest request. She would like to acquire financial assistance worth PHP 8,000 that she’ll utilize in purchasing more stocks of vegetables, fruits and other merchandise products needed for her business. With sound mind and clear hope, she dreams for her family to succeed someday and make a go of her business. And this dream starts now, with you. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing more stocks of vegetables, fruits and other merchandise products needed for her business

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of Battambang province, Cambodia, Neang is 53 years old and a widow. She has six beloved children who are still under her care and only one of them could attend school. Neang earns her living through farming rice and works on others farms for fee. She has been involved in her current businesses, rice farming and a paid worker, for ten years, earning approximately 42,800 KHR per day. Now she is leading a small group to take out this first Kiva loan for 1,700,000 KHR in total.

Neang, with her requested loan portion, will buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice paddy. She believes that with the help of this loan, she can boost her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice paddy

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is a 36-year-old farmer from Kisii area of Kenya who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Mellen is married and has 3 children. The children help her with the work. 

Mellen applied for a loan because she wants to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.
  
Mellen needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a second cow to enlarge her herd and thus her income

loans.name: Baguma

texts.en:
Baguma is a 45-year-old hardworking man with 10 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He produces 'waragi', a local brew in his area, and slaughters cows to add more to his income. He is faced with the challenges of inadequate funding for business sustainability and competition. Despite his hardships, Baguma has future plans of expanding his business to new areas. 

Baguma needs a loan to buy cows for slaughtering to sell.

The extra people in the photo are people at the market, and could not be excluded as the market day is always busy.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering and selling.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en:
Guliston is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1989. Now, she is living in a big city with her family. She is divorced and has two children. Guliston is a tailor. She sews national Tajik women's dresses at home, and has five years practice at serving Tajik women. She sews original, up-to-date clothes and has permanent clients and orders. 

Guliston and her children got sick. She wants to treat her children and herself in the medical clinic. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her family.

loans.use: to treat her children and herself in the medical clinic.

loans.name: Chiv's Group

texts.en: Chiv, 62 years old, is a farmer living in Banteay Meanchey province. He is a father of four children, one of them in school. Chiv has supported his family by farming rice and raising piglets for 20 years. He earns about 72,200 KHR per day and is able to save about 28,000 KHR after offsetting his family expenses. Chiv's main business challenge is still low rice crop yield. Chiv, the leader of this 3-member loan group, will use his portion to build a proper cage to raise his piglets. He hopes to raise his pigs in a timely fashion so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to build a proper cage to raise his piglets

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mary  Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 21-year old vocational undergraduate who lives in La Castellana. She belongs to a family of 7. Her father works as a farm laborer and her mother is a housewife. Mary Joy is the fourth child and has 5 siblings, three of whom are married. The family’s total monthly income of Php 10,000($224) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

This motivates Mary Joy to find means to help the family.  Mary Joy dreams to finish her studies, to have a stable job and help her family. Your support in funding her loan will help Mary Joy have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Soklaing's Group

texts.en: Soklaing, 50 years old, lives in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district and has four children. She has been growing cassava and farming rice for 32 years. Her daily family income is about 116,700 KHR per day. Soklaing's main business challenge is low cassava yield. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan to plow the fields for growing cassava and rice. She hopes to extend her current business.

loans.use: to plow the fields for growing cassava and rice

loans.name: Madar Mahila Mandal-1 Group

texts.en:
This group of five women hails from Dahod, India. They are led by Sabanabibi, who is standing in the center. 

Sabanabibi is a 31-year-old mother of two children. Her household income is 12,000 INR, which is insufficient to meet the household expenses and pay for the children's education. Her monthly savings are just 3,000 INR. Hence Sabanabibi thought of starting her own business to supplement the family's income. She started her variety store which sells products including bangles, earrings, necklaces, etc. With this business she is currently earning 3,500 INR, but she wants to earn more to support her children's education. 

Sabanabibi came up with the idea to avail herself of a loan to expand her business. She got together with four other women who share similar interests. The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing businesses as well. These families earn on average 10,000 INR per month, out of which they are able to save only 2,000 INR. 

Similar to Sabanabibi, Laliben and Sherbanu are also into selling bangles, earrings, necklaces, etc. They will use the loan to expand their variety store and earn more income. Mumtaj and Sabana are into selling fruits. They sell apples, pears, watermelons, pineapples, oranges etc. and they will use the loan to expand their fruit businesses. 

Together, the group seeks a loan of 70,000 INR. Your loan will help these women earn more and give a good education to their children. It will also pave the way for a good standard of living and happiness among these families.

loans.use: to expand her retail business.

loans.name: Jesus Evelyn

texts.es:
La socia Jesús Evelyn pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jesús  Evelyn sigue  con su  negocio de venta de  productos de belleza como colonias, cremas, perfumes entre otros, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes de mujeres.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Group member Jesús Evelyn belongs to the communal bank VELASCO ASTETE, which is located in Cusco district, Cusco province and Cusco department.

Jesús Evelyn is continuing with her business of selling beauty products such as cologne, creams, perfume, and the like. She has been operating this business for some time, and it is working well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She hopes to continue working and in this way continue to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy women's perfume. She is grateful for the loan offered to her and committed to meeting the established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy women's perfume.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Farming is the main source of income of Josephine’s family. They plant and grow rice in their farm. To sustain their daily basic needs like food, Josephine engage herself in buying and selling of used bottles, and plastics around their village. Josephine wishes for a bigger income in able to sustain their daily foods. 

With this, she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy more scrap box, used bottles and plastics to sell. Josephine earnings will invest to their farm needs such as fuel and fertilizers. She hopes to have bigger income and will lessen her worries in providing their farm needs thru income she will earn.

loans.use: to buy more scrap box, used bottles and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is a married woman from Alcantara, Cebu. She is also a Sari-sari (general) store owner, a business that she started three years ago. She has eleven children aged five to twenty. 

Ethel is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy grocery items like noodles, canned goods, eggs, chips, cooking oil, shampoo, conditioner,food for family and tuition fee of her children who are still in school. Ethel plans to expand her store, buy more items to sell specially those that are not yet offered in her store to make the most of her investments. Her profit will be for savings and education of her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like noodles, canned goods, eggs, chips, cooking oil, shampoo, conditioner, food for family and tuition fees of her children

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 35 year old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is in motorcycle transport, the business he started with a hope of earning an income. 

He is looking forward to buying a car that he will use as a taxi and get more profits. His business is affected by bad roads that lead to constant mechanical breakdowns. Patrick intends a loan to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle which has problems due to bad roads

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 36-year old college graduate who lives in Bago City. She is married to Ricardo, a tricyle driver. They have three children aged 14,12,and 11. Her 2 sons are in high school, while her daughter is in elementary. Jean has been running a frozen food business for 3 years that earns her about Php 5,000 per month($112). 

The family’s total monthly income of only Php 10,000 ($224) is not enough to provide even for their basic needs. Thus, when Jean qualified for Bagosphere 2-month training program, she saw a glimmer of hope to uplift her family’s life. Jean wants to work in a BPO company and to have a high salary. 

Jean would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college and your tuition loan assistance might just actualize her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard, in his thirties, is a married father of a 7-month-old boy. He wants to buy a musical instrument since he has been playing with a musical band at different events for about ten years. “I enjoy playing instruments and I’ve loved it since a very young age. But at the same time, I know that this will not secure a living for my family. This is the reason that my wife and I do agriculture, to enhance our income,” said Eduard to the loan officer. 

The family lives in a village where Eduard and his wife have about 1.5 dynym of land where he plants mostly veggies and grains for his family’s use. He also has orchards and sells their fruits. He has two sows and sells piglets to the local market.

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument for playing with a band attending different events

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 57, is a married woman. She is running a small general store to provide her family with the better standard of living. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 4 children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to maximum customers for generating a larger source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income

loans.name: Nadee Group

texts.en:
Khampieu is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Khampieu and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Khampieu and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Khampieu and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs,Khampieu and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Marleny De Jesus

texts.es:
Marleny es una mujer de 42 años de edad, una persona dedicada, amorosa, emprendedora que tomo la decisión de superarse y ser alguien en su vida, por ello inicio con un negocio de venta de ropa principalmente chaquetas y abrigos.

Este negocio ha representado según la señora Marleny una salvación, gracias a sus ganancias su hogar ha tenido una evolución y unas mejores de condiciones de vida increíbles, en su hogar sus hijos pueden soñar con una educación  universitaria ya que tienen dos padres que se están esforzando en grande para cumplir los sueños de sus hijos.

Marleny quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con ropa  de invierno como lo son abrigos, sacos, chaquetas y quiere añadir una venta de bolsos.
texts.en:
Marleny is a dedicated, loving and enterprising 42 year old woman who made the decision to get ahead and be someone in her life.  For this reason she started a business selling clothes, primarily coats and jackets.

This business has meant salvation according to Marleny, as thanks to her profits her home has evolved and she has improved her living conditions incredibly.  In her home her children can now dream of a university education, as they now have two parents who are working extremely hard to make their children's dreams a reality.

Marleny is asking for a loan to stock her business with winter clothes such as coats, jumpers, and jackets, and she wants to also start selling handbags.

loans.use: to stock her business with winter clothes such as coats, jumpers, jackets and to also start selling handbags

loans.name: Nokuthula

texts.en:
Nokuthula is a married mother of 3 young children aged 6, 4 and 6 months old. She is part of a self-help group that wants to build an abattoir in their community. The group has realized the need for a clean, fully-equipped structure to slaughter livestock and package it for selling. They have thus decided to each buy a piece of equipment that will be part of this slaughterhouse. 

Nokuthula is requesting a loan to buy a drum plucker, which is used to "de-feather" chicken in a humane and efficient way. Once completed, the abattoir will provide employment and sustainable income to Nokuthula and, in extension, to the entire community.

loans.use: to buy a drum plucker

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 41 years, married to Gesare and he supports 3 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 12 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing so as to get a better produce for family use.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing so as to get a better produce for family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm for a better harvest for family use and sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Bibisoro

texts.en:
Bibisoro is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973 and she is living in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. She has five year practice doing business in agriculture. She plants agricultural products in her land. 

She is sick. She has no money to be treated. She applied to IMON asking financial support to be treated at a hospital. She would like to be healthy and continue her activity. She awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Soklay

texts.en: Soklay, 32 years old, lives in a rural area in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children; only three of them are in school while the fourth helps to earn income for the family. Soklay farms rice as her main source of income and she has also been selling grocery items to earn extra income to support her family for fifteen years. Soklay, who has never been with VisionFund before, is seeking her first loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy rice seeds and more grocery items for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy herbicides and spray his onions.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has two children. She is an agrarian. She plants cereals, vegetables and breeds livestock. Her husband went to Russia to earn money. Until her husband finds a job, she needs money to feed her family and treat her grandson in hospital. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to treat her grandson at medical center and to spend for family needs.

loans.use: to treat her grandson at a medical center and to spend for family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of sugar, cooking fat and baking flour for making more pastries for sale to her clients and be able to make more income to provide for her family's needs

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses used the previous loan to buy maize flour, rice, salt, and cooking oil to sell. He has a beauty salon, retail shop, carpentry services and motorcycle transport as his sources of income. He started these businesses with a vision of earning an income for his family. He is faced with challenges of limited capital on top of high license fees paid for his businesses that hinders his business growth. Besides that, he has hopes of expanding his business to new areas. Moses is requesting a loan to buy land and construct a residential house.

loans.use: to buy land and construct a residential house.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, 44 years old, is a mother of three children, one of them in school. She lives in Kampong Cham province. Her family's sources of income have come from growing cassava and farming rice for 26 years. Vanna's current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. Her main business challenge is the low price of her cassava. 

Vanna has been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans have helped her to better support her family. She is now leading her 3-member loan group to ask for a loan.  Vanna will use her portion of the loan to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to extend her farmland so as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Seesomxai Group

texts.en: Thong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Thong and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits. Thong and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Thong’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Naxoo Group

texts.en: Mai is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Mai and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Mai and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Mai and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Mai and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mulosharif

texts.en: Mulosharif is a generous man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in the family of farmers. He is living in village with his family. He is married and has three children. From his childhood he was taught to keep livestock and plant agricultural products. He had a hard childhood. With difficulties and challenges he got married and built a house. He has a son who has an eye problem, and needs to have surgery. He asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to pay for his son's surgery. He hopes to be supported so his son will be healthy and can see.

loans.use: to pay for a surgery for his son in a medical clinic.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is 22 years old, and married. She has managed her small farm for almost 2 years. Arzu is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.
Arzu's husband works as a driver. They are blessed with two children. Due to lack of capital for use in her agricultural business, she would like to access a loan amounting to 1500 manats. She will use her loan funds to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm.
She hopes that her farm will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more income with which to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin used the previous loan to buy baby clothing to sell during the Christmas season. He has a boutique and has been in business for 27 years. He earns his side income from rentals and farming. He needs the money to buy building materials such as cement, sand and timber to add on to his rental  houses. He is a hardworking man, but faces a challenge of market competition in his business. He has a dream of educating his children and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, sand and timber to add on to his rental houses.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a careful father. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. He is living in a village with his family. He is married and has two children. He is a hardworking, capable, honest person. When he was a child he worked after school on a farmer’s land and earned money to help his family. He was sick and spent time in the hospital. When he recovered he went to Russia to earn money. Then after coming back home he started to do business in agriculture. He kept livestock and his wife helps and supports him in his business. He has an old and sick mother. He wants to have her treated in the hospital. He requests a loan from Kiva lenders to pay for his mother’s treatment. He hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for his mother’s treatment in hospital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, aged 33, is married to Evans and supports four children. By selling fruits and vegetables, she earns an income that has enabled her to provide for her family's needs. 

Sarah will be using the loan to buy more stocks of tomatoes and vegetables to sell to her customers, thus earning more income to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dream is to open a grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of tomatoes and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and other items where she has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in prices. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, flour and other items

loans.name: Venesio

texts.en:
Venesio is 43 years old married with 9 children, 8 attending school and living in Kasese Uganda. He deals in the buying and selling of dry maize, coffee, ground nuts, rice (agriculture produce) and has been in business since 1998. He earns his side income from farming. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize, beans, rice and ground nuts to buy agriculture produce. He is hardworking and honest but faces a challenge of having limited capital and price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans, rice,and nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for sale to clients to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 27 years, married to Tendeka and she supports two children.She has been running a hair salon for the last one year and the business earns she KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase stocks of already manufactured hair pieces and shampoos for making the hair of clients pretty so as to meet client needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children.Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of already manufactured hair pieces and shampoos for making the hair of clients pretty so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 29 years old, married, and blessed with one child who is currently attending school. She is a vegetable farmer who grows crops such as kale, spinach, cabbage, and carrots. Monicah joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from trainings, especially those focusing on enterprise development. 

Monicah is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure to increase her vegetable production to meet customer demand. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to increase vegetable production

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with six children. For the past five years, she has operated a retail business where she sells soda, flour, sugar, soap, and other items. Peninah’s business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. Peninah successfully repaid her previous loan.

Peninah is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, soda, bread and other items. This will be her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Peninah hopes to be a supplier within five years.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soda, bread, and other items

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman, with 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are regular. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself as self-driven. Gladys has operated a restaurant for the past three years. Her business is well-positioned and her primary customers are locals. Gladys describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient space in which to accommodate customers. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank with her previous loan  successfully repaid. Gladys will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more utensils for her restaurant. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman, with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a food stall where she cooks mandazi or Kenyan donuts. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for making mandazi. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for making mandazi (donuts)

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is a married woman with two children. For the past 20 years, she has operated a retail business where she sells cereals, flour and other items. Emmah's business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge as being price fluctuation. 

This is her  fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank with her previous loans successfully repaid. Emmah will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of maize. Her business goal is to open more business branches within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of food to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her early 30s, is single with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school while the other is still small. She has been selling cosmetics at wholesale prices, door-to-door since 2009. She works from 10:00 am to 5.30 pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of cosmetics, and she has repaid all her loans successfully. She has been happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva's lenders for their support. She used her profits to pay school fees, repay her loan, and cover household expenses. 

Mary will use this loan to further increase her stock of cosmetics so she can sell to many customers. She dreams of opening a shop where she can sell her products in one place.

Mary will make sure she repays her loan according to the scheduled repayment dates.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics so she can sell to many customers.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself as a visionary. For the past eight years, Irine has operated a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in an excellent area and her primary customers are the general public. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. This will enable her to increase her sales; hence, her profit will increase. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. Irine hopes that, in the future, she will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself to be positive-minded. For the past four years, Priscillah has operated a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and other items. Her primary customers are also regular customers.
