This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank with her previous loan successfully repaid. Priscillah will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, cooking oil, flour, etc. to sell. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, cooking oil, flour, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evacate

texts.en:
Evacate is 45 years old and married with five children. All of her children attend school. Since 2010, Evacate has been a fish monger. Although she is faced with the challenge of limited capital, she describes herself as hardworking and has great hopes of expanding her business. 

Evacate is requesting a loan to buy more dry fish to sell. She is a loving mother with a vision of educating her children to university.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. 

Patience operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Patience will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of metal bars, iron rods and welding material for making steel doors and windows to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Karama

texts.en:
Karama is a married man with three children. For the past three years, he has operated a business selling charcoal. Karama’s business is located in a busy place and he has regular primary customers. His biggest business challenge is low stock. 

Karama is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This will be his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. Karama hopes that, in the future, he will have better living conditions.

loans.use: buy more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and seeds for her farming

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE,la socia continua dedicándose a la costura y alquiler de cuartos, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar  apoyando  a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colchas entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner Irma belongs to the communal bank VELASCO ASTETE. The partner continues to make a living at sewing and renting rooms. The partner's business is going well thanks to the everyday effort she puts into the business. The partner hopes to be able to continue working because this is the way to continue supporting her family. 
The partner feels grateful for the loans offered and promises to meet the established payments. The partner asks for a loan to buy bedspreads amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads amongst other things.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, bread, soda, sweets, yoghurt and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, sweets and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, sweets and other items

loans.name: Elsa Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia sigue con su negocio de elaboración de tortas para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia continua trabajando para apoyar  a su familia, a la vez la socia continua trabajando para una empresa privada siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, mantequilla entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank VELASCO ASTETE. The partner continues with her business of making cakes for the various obligations that request her services. The partner's business is going well thanks to the everyday effort she puts into her business, this being the way that the partner continues working to support her family. At the same time, the partner continues working for a private company, this being the way to take her family forward. 
The partner requests a loan to buy flour, butter, and other things. The partner feels grateful for the loan offered and promises to meet the established payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and other things.

loans.name: Jesús María

texts.es: Jesús de 23 años, inició su propio negocio gracias a la activación de obras en construcción en el municipio de Soledad, donde inauguró su restaurante para abastecer la demanda de obreros e ingenieros que laboran en estos proyectos. Su capital inicial se lo proporcionó su padre con la convicción de que su hijo iba a tener éxito; Jesús es muy comprometido con su trabajo, todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. quienes deseen degustar de sus comidas recibirán una atención privilegiada y amable. Su carta de comidas es muy amplia, ofrece almuerzos corrientes los cuales incluyen sopas de verduras, ensaladas, arroces, carnes y refrescos, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual invertirá en víveres para la preparación de las comidas. Con esta inversión podrá capitalizarse y acceder al sistema financiero.  Su meta a largo plazo es aperturar nuevas sucursales de su restaurante e ingresar a la universidad para estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
23-year-old Jesús started his own business thanks to the initiation of construction work in the municipality of Soledad. He opened his restaurant to satisfy the demand of the workers and engineers who work on those projects. His father provided the initial capital, with the conviction that his son was going to be successful.

Jesús is very committed to his work. Every day from 8am until 3pm, anyone who wants to enjoy his food will receive privileged and kind attention. His menu is very large. He offers common foods, including vegetable soup, salads, rice dishes, meats, and soda.

He is currently requesting his first CrediKiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will invest in supplies for food preparation. With this investment, he will be able to advance himself and join the financial system. His long-term goal is to open new branches of his restaurant and to attend college to study a professional career.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 61 years old, married and a mother of five. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development.

Grace practices mixed farming where she grows maize, beans, potato and vegetables and also does dairy farming. She also engages herself in making table mats and sells them locally to supplement her income. 

She is taking a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds for her dairy cow so as to increase milk production. This will enable her to earn more income to pay for her house renovation expenses, buy food and better clothing for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds to increase milk production for increased income to pay for renovation expenses of her house and buy food and better clothing for her children.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es: Claudia tiene 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés y es gracias a su amabilidad y a la calidad de sus productos que ha crecido su clientela, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecha de poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Claudia desea terminar una pared que por el momento solo la cubre con un plástico por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, ladrillo, hierro y grava y así terminar de construir la pared lo antes posible porque se acerca el invierno.
texts.en:
Claudia is 25-years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and their 3-year old son. Claudia makes her living selling sweet breads and french bread. Thanks to her friendliness and the quality of her products, her clientele has grown. Claudia feels happy and satisfied that she is able to help support her household.

Claudia wants to finish building a wall of her house that, at the moment, is covered only by plastic. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, brick, iron and gravel so she can build the wall as soon as possible, as winter is approaching.

loans.use: to purchase sand, brick, iron and gravel so she can finish building a wall for her house as soon as possible as winter is approaching.

loans.name: Rhina Graciela

texts.es: Rhina tiene 43 años de edad y habita en vivienda de su propiedad desde hace 4 años junto a su esposo y su hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio en la cual vende productos como: pan dulce, golosinas, café, azúcar, huevos, etc., con la cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Rhina desea construir el servicio sanitario de su vivienda, para una mayor higiene en la misma, ya que su familia ha tenido problemas de enfermedades por contaminación, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, grava, hierro, cemento y ladrillos para la construir el servicio sanitario de su vivienda y de esta manera contribuir a la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Rhina is 43-years old. She has lived with her husband and 11-year old son in a home on their own property for the last four years. Rhina has a small grocery set up in her home. She sells products such as sweet breads, sweets, coffee, sugar, eggs etc. Through her business, she has been able to get her family ahead.

Rhina wants to build a bathroom for her home so they can enjoy improved hygiene. Her family has had problems with illnesses related to contamination, and so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will use the loan to purchase sand, gravel, iron, cement and bricks so she can build a bathroom for her home and contribute to the health of her household.

loans.use: to purchase sand, gravel, iron, cement and brick to build a bathroom for her home.

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es: Verónica tiene 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo. Ella presta sus servicios en una empresa cercana a su domicilio desde hace varios años. Verónica poco a poco ha logrado construir su vivienda, pero sus ahorros no fueron suficientes para terminar de construir un cuarto dormitorio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: hierro, arena, grava y cemento para la terminar de construir su cuarto dormitorio y de esta manera cumplir su sueño de tener una vivienda digna donde vivir.
texts.en: Verónica, 24, lives in her own residence in the company of her husband. She has been offering her services in a business near her house for a number of years. Verónica, little by little, has been able to construct her house, but her savings were not sufficient to finish the construction of her bedroom. Because of this, she requests a FUSAI loan to buy rebar, sand, gravel, and cement to finish the construction of her bedroom and in this way to fulfill her dream of having a worthy residence to live in.

loans.use: to buy rebar, sand, gravel, and cement to finish the construction of her bedroom.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a Kiva borrower. He has 4 children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, rice, oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, biscuits and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living conditions and a profitable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, biscuits and other items

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, rice, oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, washing soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within 5 years. This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Mukure village where owns a small farm. She keeps dairy animals and grows crops for food and feed. She sells her farm produce at Gathembi which is a local market closest to her home. She has been farming for many years and that has enabled her to build a strong network of clients in Mukure.

The biggest growth constraint that Mary has been dealing with is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests.

With your lending, Mary will be able to access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to increase her farm's productivity.

loans.name: Shishoza Cb Group

texts.en: Pelagie is a group leader; aged 41 years. She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 20 years. The group is called Shishoza, which means “Be carefully” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for making their future better. She has a shop and has been running her business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for resale.

loans.name: Molina Ruiz Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Paola es una madre cabeza de familia de 33 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 5 y 15 su meta es que salir adelante y aprovechar lo que tiene, en el momento genera recursos gracias a su venta de mercancía como lo es ropa, calzado y accesorios y con orgullo y la frente en alto puede decir que esta profesión le ha valido para mantener su hogar e ir mejorando poco a poco la calidad de vida de ellos.

En vista de querer progresar y que tiene un mayor número de clientes, Paola quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa juvenil para hombre y dama, jeans, blusas, camisas, camisetas, abrigos y calzado, con el cual se abastecerá y saldrá a vender sus productos diariamente.
texts.en:
She is Paola, 33, a mother and head of the family. She has three children, 2, 5, and 15. Her goal is to get ahead and to take advantage of what she's has. Presently, she generates resources through the sale of merchandise like clothing, footwear, and accessories and with pride and her head held high she can say that her profession has been valuable for the maintenance of her home and it improves little by little the quality of life for them.
In light of wanting to progress and that she has a greater number of customers, Paola wants to request a loan to buy an assortment of young people's clothing for boys and girls, jeans, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, jackets, and footwear with which she will stock up and go out and sell her products daily.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of young people's clothing for boys and girls, jeans, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, jackets, and footwear with which she will stock up and go out to sell her products daily.

loans.name: Tiisetso

texts.en:
Tiisetso is a single mother of a 14-year old boy and a 12-year old girl. She is employed and works hard to feed her children and pay their school fees. Tiisetso is smart and understands business. She is one of the founding members of a self-help group looking to change their community.

Tiisetso is asking for a loan to buy an eviscerating trough for slaughtering poultry. This equipment will be part of an abattoir being developed by Tiisetso and her group. "I want to play my part in eradicating poverty by employing those in need," says Tiisetso. She is hopeful that in the next 5 years, the abattoir will be supplying meat products across the entire South Africa.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her poultry business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, rice, cooking oil, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices. 

She will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, washing soap, and other items. Her business goal is to expand the business and open more branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment for others. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Johaana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Johaana es una mujer muy trabajadora, que empezó con poca mercadería en su pulpería, junto a su esposo e hijo que le dan todo el soporte además de trabajar con ella atendiendo a los clientes, luego inicio a trabajar con MiCrédito y fue creciendo como comerciante, posteriormente solicito un préstamo a MiCrédito, este impulso su negocio de una manera significativa, dado que pudo comprar nueva mercadería y en mayor cantidad. Es por eso que está muy agradecida con MiCrédito junto a KIVA, por las grandes oportunidades que le han brindado. 
En estos momentos, esta perseverante mujer, desea invertir en su negocio y mejorar la infraestructura del local es por eso que ha vuelto a solicitar un préstamo a MiCrédito, y con este cumplir sus metas.  En un futuro desea tener un distribuidora de granos básicos, además pretende seguir trabajando con el apoyo de financiamientos.
texts.en:
Johaana is a very hard-working woman.  She started with a small amount of merchandise in her general store.  Her husband and son have given her their full support in addition to working with her to attend to her customers.  Later, Johaana started working with MiCrédito, and she grew as a business woman.  After that, she requested a loan from MiCrédito, which propelled her business forward in a significant way.  With the loan, Johaana was able to purchase new merchandise and in greater quantities.  That is why she is grateful to MiCrédito together with KIVA, for the great opportunities they have provided her. 
At this time, this determined woman wants to invest in her business and improve her store's infrastructure.  That is why she has requested another loan from MiCrédito.  With the loan, she will be able to meet her goals. 
In the future, Johaana wants to have a staple grains distributor.  In addition, she plans to keep working with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to invest in her business and improve her store's infrastructure.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a widowed woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy animal feed and fertilizer. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.en: Sifa is a group leader.  She is 36, married with four children ages 1 to10 years.  Two of her children go to school. The group is called TWIYUBAKE which means “Develop themselves” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for a better future. Sifa sells charcoal and has been doing this business for the past 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoals for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as humble. He operates a restaurant, and he has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cow

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a young and hopeful 23-year old, with big dreams. He is the last-born of four children, raised by a single mother. At 23, Michael is full of energy and is already doing small jobs here and there in the hope of landing 'something big' one day. 
His ambition is what has led him to join hands with other members of a self-help group who share similar hopes and desires. The group is constructing an abattoir in their neighborhood. "We will slaughter chicken and other birds like turkey. We'll then pack the meat and then distribute to shops and homes in this area." says a beaming Michael. 
He is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy a bleeding cone, which is used to ensure quality during the slaughtering process. Michael will work in the abattoir and says that the project will give him, and his peers, a chance at earning a sustainable income.

loans.use: to buy a bleeding cone

loans.name: Beaty

texts.en:
Beaty has a small farm in South-rift area of Kenya, where she lives with her family. She keeps dairy animals and grows food crops and fodder. She sells her farm produce at Sondu, which is the local market closest to her home. She enjoys farming and using farm produce to satisfy her customers’ needs. 
The biggest growth constraint that Beaty has been dealing with, is lack of access to capital, to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds and fertilizers. 
With your lending, Beaty will be able to use the loan amount to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 39 años de edad, conviviente cuenta con 2 hijos uno de 09 años Y 01 año, viven en el caserio Palo Blanco a orillas de la carretera Fernando Belaunde Terry que pertenece al distrito de Pucará, Provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú. El caserío de Palo Blanco, es un caserío mediano, en el cual la población se dedica a la agricultura , ganadería, comercio,entre otros, caserío mediano con aspiraciones de superación.

Ella se dedica a servicio de enllante y desenllante, cuenta con un taller propio, cuenta con varios años de experiencia en este rubro, con muy buenas referencias de parte de su clientela, el destino del prestamo será invertir en la compra de una vulcanizadora eléctrica, para realizar su trabajo adecuadamente, esto le permitirá atender a un mayor volumen de clientes, por lo que tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 39 years old. She lives with a partner and has 2 children, ages 9 and 1. They live in the village of Palo Blanco, alongside the Fernando Belaunde Terry highway in the district of Pucara and the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The village of Palo Blanco is a medium-size village in which the people work in agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce, among other things. It is a medium-size village with aspirations of improvement.

She provides tire services, putting tires on [rims] and removing them. She has her own workshop, and she has a number of years of experience in this work, with very good references from her customers. The destiny of the loan will be to invest in an electric vulcanizer  to do her work properly. This will allow her to serve a greater volume of customers, from which she will have greater income and will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in an electric vulcanizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Paurito Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer  de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 9 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, activa, constante, amable, de buen trato, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘Paurito’ una comunidad rural a 30 kilómetros al suroeste de la ciudad, a una altura de 356 metros sobre el nivel del mar, pueblo de artesanos dónde se teje el sombrero de SAO, que es un sombrero hecho con las fibras de las hojas del árbol.
Maria es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física mediana,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus tres hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de madera, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y energía eléctrica. La necesidad de superación la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; panadería, servcio técnico eléctrico,  venta de comida, elaboración de masitas, venta de sábanas, llantería y servicio de té, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Ella es una vendedora independiente que asegura y certifica la originalidad de todos sus productos. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos por catálogo, de las marcas; revlon, L'Oreal, Epicare, Max Factor y otros…, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante durante toda la semana en diferentes ferias y comercios de la localidad. Los productos con mayor demanda son; Esmalte de secado rápido, Sombras en crema, Brillo de labios, productos para verano, y otros, “pretendo ofrecer a mis clientes los mejores productos, al precio más competitivo, cuento con experiencia y conocimiento en el sector de la belleza, para proporcionar el asesoramiento personal que pudieran necesitar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mayoría de las ventas las realiza a pedido y por catálogo eso hace que no tenga que cargar todos sus productos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para comprar productos por mayor. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta en el mercado para la venta de productos de belleza, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y pagar los gastos de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad y con los beneficios abrir una tienda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria is a 35-year old woman. She lives her with husband and their three children, who are 3, 9 and 14 years old respectively. Maria's business is selling cosmetics.

Maria is a good mother. She is independent, active, tenacious, friendly, well-mannered, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her business in the ‘Paurito’ neighborhood, a rural community located 30 kilometers southeast of the city and 356 meters above sea level. It is a town of artisans where "SAO sombreros" are made; they are wide-brimmed hats made from the fibers of tree leaves.

Maria is olive-skinned and has brown eyes and chestnut hair, which she wears tied back behind her neck. She is short and of medium build. Maria's native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish when out and about and to run her business.

Maria shares her life with her husband, who works as a driver, and with her three children. The two eldest children go to school, and the youngest is not yet school-aged. They live in their own home, which is built of wood, brick and cement and has a corrugated iron roof and a dirt floor. They have well-water that is pulled up with a pump and they have electricity.

A need to improve her situation brought Maria to lead a communal bank of people with businesses such as: a bakery, electrical services, food sales, making pastries, selling sheets, a tire shop and tea service. Together they request loans and improve their businesses.

Maria is an independent sales woman who guarantees and certifies her products' origins. Her business is selling catalog cosmetics as a street vendor. She sells products from Revlon, L'Oreal, Epicare, Max Factor and others. She travels every day of the week selling at different markets and to businesses in her area. The products with the greatest demand are quick-drying nail polishes, eye-shadow creams, lip gloss, summertime products and others. “I intend to offer my customers the best products and the most competitive prices. I have experience and knowledge in the area of beauty, so I can provide the personal advise my customers may need," Maria says. An advantage of her business is that the majority of her sales are done on orders and by catalog, so she doesn't have to carry all her products around with her. The disadvantage is that she doesn't of the capital to invest in wholesale products.

Maria's dream is to open a sales stall in the market to sell beauty supplies. She wants to invest in her business by purchasing a stock of wholesale seasonal cosmetics so she can meet her customers' demand and cover her family's expenses. This is Maria's first loan cycle with the institution in the two years she has been running her business.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale cosmetics so she can sell a greater variety. With the profits, she wants to open a store in the local market.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics so she can sell a greater variety of products and, with the profits, open a store in the local market.

loans.name: Morizon Antonio

texts.es: Desde muy joven Morizon sitió vocación comercial y con ayuda de su padre aprendió sobre el manejo de la carnicería. Hoy en día cuenta con 25 años de experiencia en todos los cortes de carne de res y cerdo, los cuales distribuye todos los días en las tiendas, restaurantes y graneros del municipio de Soledad.   Morizon considera que a través de un trato amable hacia el cliente y la presentación de los mejores cortes de carnes, le han permitido tener éxito en su carnicería y mantener una clientela fidelizada.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que adquirirá una motocicleta y planea realizar los domicilios a sus clientes.  Esta inversión es muy importante puesto que minimizará los gastos de transporte y el tiempo de entrega.  Morizon de 52 años es padre de tres hijos mayores de edad y su meta familiar es comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Morizon sought a commercial vocation, and with the help of his father, he learned about the management of the butcher shop. Now he has 25 years of experience with all the cuts of beef and pork, which he distributes every day to the shops, restaurants, and grocery stores of the municipality of Soledad. Morizon feels that his friendly treatment of his customers and the display of the best cuts of meat have allowed him to have success in his butcher shop and maintain a loyal clientele.

He is now applying through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for his first Kiva loan, with which he will acquire a motorcycle. He plans to make home deliveries to his customers. This investment is very important, since it will minimize the transportation costs and the delivery time. Morizon, at the age of 52, is the father of three adult children, and his family goal is to buy his own house.

loans.use: to acquire a motorcycle, since he plans to make home deliveries to his customers.

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is a 32-year-old woman. She is married with one son and lives in the village of Falakata in Alipurduar district. She received education up to grade 10.  Her son is a toddler.  

With her husband, Suchitra has been successfully operating a grocery shop in their locality. She sells a variety of grocery items and daily use consumer goods in the shop. This store is the only source of income for the family. Thus she wants to enhance their business by adding more stock for the shop.  She hopes that adding different products will improve their earnings and the family's status. 

Suchitra is asking to take out a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase more grocery items to increase her business sales as well as her income. Suchitra is an optimistic lady, always aiming for the best for her family’s well-being. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase stock of grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sophiko

texts.en:
Sophiko is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and grandparents in the Sighnaghi district of Georgia. Her family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard. The produce wine and sell it locally.  The whole family works hard to insure a good harvest. 

Sophiko wants to start an additional business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for starting a trading business. 

She will use the loan to purchase stock of clothing to resell. Sophiko hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her working capital for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the truck he uses for his business.

loans.name: Jose Wilmar

texts.es:
José es un joven de tan solo 19 años de edad es la nueva era llamada a seguir con la hermosa tradición de la agricultura, heredo los terrenos y conocimientos de su padre y su tarea es mantener y  hacer crecer esos terrenos que con tanto esfuerzo, sudor, lagrimas lograron sus antecesores.

José se ha caracterizado por ser un joven responsable, respetuoso y muy apegado de su familia, ahora es el hombre de la casa y mantiene a sus padres su propósito es no solo tener terrenos de cultivos, se sueña con tener animales, consolidar una finca y tener una decencia que continúe está noble labor del campo.

José quiere cambiar y aumentar la producción en su finca, aprovechar la juventud y su fuerza para doblegar el trabajo aunque le cueste mucho  valdrá la pena, el solo ver su finca llena de cultivos de calidad.

José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y agroquímicos, abonos, riegos, semillas, fungicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, gallinaza entre otros.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man, only 19 years old. He is the new generation called to continue with the beautiful tradition of agriculture. He inherited the plots of land and knowledge from his father, and his task is to maintain and grow the land which with a lot of effort, sweat, and tears, was achieved by his ancestors. 

Jose is known as being a responsible man, respectful and very close to his family. Now he is the man of the house and supports his parents. His goal is not only to have land for farming, he dreams of having animals, establish a farm, and to have children that will continue this noble labor in the field. 

Jose wants to change and increase the production of his farm, take advantage of his youth and strength to do the work, Though it will be very difficult it will be worth it, simply to see his farm filled with quality crops.

Jose wants to ask for a loan for the purchase of agricultural and agrochemical inputs, fertilizer, irrigation, seeds, fungicide, pesticide, insecticide, hen droppings, among others.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural and agrochemical inputs, fertilizer, irrigation, seeds, fungicides, pesticides, insecticides, hen droppings, among others.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es María es una mujer de 45 años de edad, madre cabeza de hogar, tiene 4 hijos y se dedica a la venta de alimentos fritos como lo son empanadas, buñuelos, pasteles, paralelo a estos alimentos vende refrescos, café, perico (es una café con leche) que quiere solicitar un préstamo para crecer, un préstamo que le permitirá tener una nueva línea de venta y mejorar el ambiente del negocio.

Con el préstamo solicitado María quiere comprar una parrilla para vender productos asados, mesas, sillas y surtido de carne, algo que la tiene muy motivada pues representara un crecimiento exponencial en su negocio y espera tener buenos resultados para seguir siendo ese pilar económico que es para su familia.
texts.en:
This is Maria, she is a 45-year-old woman, head of the house, she has 4 children and her occupation is the sale of fried foods, such as empanadas, fritters, cakes. Alongside these foods she sells sodas, coffee, perico (a coffee with milk). She wants to ask for a loan to grow, a loan that will allow her to have a new product and improve the business environment. 

With the requested loan, Maria wants to buy a grill to sell roasted products, tables, chairs, and an assortment of meat, something which really motivates her as it represents an exponential growth in her business. She hopes to have good results to continue being an economic pillar in her family.

loans.use: to buy a grill to sell roasted products, tables, chairs, and an assortment of meat.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata, a 24-year-old, young woman, is an inhabitant of Jogendrapur village in Falakata in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is married to 30-year-old Biplab. The young couple has no kids as of yet.

Her husband is a hardworking and an experienced farmer. Having limited education, he chose agriculture as his profession. He grows different vegetables on his farmland with the active support of Mamata. The family's earnings are mostly spent on household expenses; a very nominal amount is accumulated for their savings. They have concentrated on maize cultivation, a crop of good nutritional value, so this business will be very lucrative. In order to get a good and plentiful harvest and to earn more, Mamata needs to invest in their agribusiness, but she lacks the capital. 

So she seeks a loan from BJS, a Kiva field partner, to purchase good quality maize seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and other necessary inputs with the loan amount. She is confident that this venture will allow her to increase her monthly income, and the additional profit will help the family to increase their savings for any financial emergencies. 

With the profit, she dreams to construct a concrete house with all the basic amenities for her family. She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase good quality maize seeds and other farm supplies for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has a 4-acre farm in Makutano village in Kenya, where she lives with her family and conducts her farming activities. She keeps four dairy cows, 40 hens and four sheep. She also has a crop farm and a tree farm with 1,000 trees. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home and uses the money to supplement her husband's salary. She started farming 30 years ago, and through the years, she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

The biggest growth constraint that Rose has been dealing with is a lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs and farm implements necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy tools, improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 

With your loan, Rose will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs and implements that she needs to increase her farm’s productivity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and implements

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe B Cb Group

texts.en:
Fabienne is a group leader. She is aged 27 years. She is married with one child. She is a tailor and has been running a business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more machines to tailor more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

The group is called Abishyizehamwe, which means “solidarity” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their future for the better.

loans.use: to buy more machines to tailor more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Dapnine

texts.en:
Dapnine has a 2-acre farm in the north of Kenya, where she lives with her family and farms. She keeps one dairy cow, 12 head of poultry and 16 sheep. She also grows crops to produce food and fodder. She sells her farm produce at Kitale, which is a local market near her home. She started farming seven years ago, and through the years, she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

The biggest growth constraint that Dapnine has been dealing with is a lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 

With your loan, Dapnine will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is 62 years old, lives with his wife and has two sons that are independent. the Ten years ago, Eduardo decided to open an internet cafe in his house and then later expanded to selling some other products like video games. Eduardo is asking for a loan to make some improvements in his house to better accommodate and separate the business from his house. He describes himself as credit worthy, he says that he has taken other loans in the past and always payed them on time.t

loans.use: To make some improvements in his home to expand his internet cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 21 years old. She is single and doesn't have any children, but she helps her parents. She lives with them and, among other things, she pays the rent. 

Celeste has a stand where she sells purses. She needs a loan to buy more purses and other accessories for her business, and she really hopes you can help her. 

She is responsible for her business and has a lot of possibilities. She is healthy, and she would like to have a store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more purses and other accessories for her business

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Ее зовут Рачабгул. Ей 44 года. Она мать троих детей - троих сыновей. Старшему сыну 23 года, среднему 21 года, а младшему 15 лет. Ее сыновья ее опора и поддержка. Ради них она живет и работает. Рачабгул дома занимается животноводством, разводит крупнорогатых скотин. На данный момент поголовье скотов на скотном дворе уменьшилось, и она планирует купить еще пару голов телят. Для этой операции нужны денежные средства. Ее капитал не позволяют ей совершить задуманное, и она решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Meet Rajabgul, the 44-year-old mother of three children (three boys).  Her oldest son is 23 years old, the second is 21 and the youngest is 15.  Rajabgul relies on her sons as her main source of support.  It is for their sake that she lives and works.  Rajabgul is involved in animal husbandry and she raises cattle at home.  At the moment she only has a small number of animals and she is planning to buy a couple of calves.  However, she needs money for this transaction.  Her capital is not sufficient to make this purchase and she has decided to take a loan.

loans.use: to buy a few calves and young bulls.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married and has two daughters. 

She and her husband earn money by driving a car, but in her spare time Norma cooks pastries, which she sells to many schools and stores. She is healthy, and she has a lot of experience cooking pastries. 

Norma needs a loan to buy ingredients such as butter, flour and salt, and she really hopes you can help her. 

In the picture, Norma is in her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as butter, flour and salt

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Simon, who is in his late 20s, is married with one child who is still in school. 

He has been running two projects selling second-hand shoes and cosmetics for eight years now. He works from 8am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Simon's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling cosmetics and to increase his shoe stock. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his stocks of second-hand shoes and cosmetics. He dreams of developing his business.

Simon will share his loan with his loan group, Mti Mrefu, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stocks of second-hand shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Las Perlas De Oro Group

texts.en:
The Department of El Quiché is located in heart of the Western Highlands of Guatemala, where the soil is fertile and planted with corn, beans and cotton. Many of the women are involved in the creation of beautiful traditional textiles, as well as animal husbandry. Eight dedicated ladies have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Perlas de Oro” or “Golden Pearls” and are very excited to be receiving their very first loan that they hope will be funded by Kiva investors together with Friendship Bridge.

Cristina is the lively 37-year-old President of the Trust Bank, and she is married with five children. She takes her responsibilities seriously and has great leadership skills. She is from a family of six children and she is the third daughter. Cristina is the owner of a convenience store and she watches her clientele grow daily. She also sells snacks and raises animals (chickens, pigs and cows). Her goal is to create income and to raise the standard of living of her family. She has requested her first loan that she will use to purchase rice, beans, noodles, oil, sugar, drinking water and gas. These are the items that are most in demand in her store. Cristina is very pleased because the extra income will be really useful for her family, especially now that four of her five children are in school.

Education is very important to these women as most have had little or no formal schooling. They are very aware of the value of learning, both for their children and themselves. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education, is so beneficial for these women. Each month, a Facilitator from the organization shares useful information with the ladies, in their own native language, on everyday topics like budgeting, marketing and sales, as well as nutrition, women’s rights and self-esteem. 

Speaking on behalf of the women in the “Perlas de Oro” Trust Bank, Cristina expresses her gratitude to Kiva investors for their kindness and generosity in funding their much-needed loans. They are poised to step into a brighter future, benefiting themselves, their families and their community in El Quiché.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, noodles, oil, sugar, drinking water and gas for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kamola

texts.ru:
Камола живет на районе Зафарабод вместе тестю, свекровью, мужем, золовкой и детьми. У Камола один маленький сын. Ее родители пенсионеры и нигде не работают. Родителей и детей обеспечивает Камола и ее муж. Муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Он профессионал по своей работе. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи. Она шьет национальные платья по заказу. Для Камола это единственный источник дохода. Чтобы заработать на жизнь Камола много работает.
У золовке скора свадьба. Они готовятся к свадьбе, и не смогли приобрести все свадебные принадлежности. И Камола решила взять кредит, и помочь приобрести остальные свадебные принадлежности. Камола с большими надеждами обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Kamola lives in the Zafarobod district of Tajikistan with her in-laws, her husband, her sister-in-law and the children of the family.  Kamola herself has a young son.  Her in-laws are retired and no longer work.  Kamola and her husband take care of their parents and children.  Her husband works as a professional handyman and renovates houses.  Kamola herself provides sewing services and sews traditional outfits, working from orders she receives from her customers.  This activity constitutes her only source of income.  Kamola works very hard in order to make a living.

Kamola's sister-in-law will soon get married.  The family is preparing for this event, but they cannot afford the necessary items for her wedding.  For this reason, Kamola has decided to take a loan and to help her sister-in-law acquire what she needs for her trousseau.  Kamola places her hope in this loan.

loans.use: to buy some wedding items for her sister-in-law's trousseau.

loans.name: Erika Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Erika es una mujer ama de hogar, muy dedicada al cuidado de su pareja e hijo, pero como madre de hogar no recibe ningún salario. Una tarde tomándose un café con una amiga le sugirió que iniciara una venta de productos por catálogo que es una actividad que puede realizar sin descuidar su hogar.
Erika hizo caso a su amiga e inicio con un capital bajo la venta de mercancía por catálogo, vendía ropa, perfumes, pijamas, accesorios y todo lo que le encargaban sus clientes. 
Ahora Erika es una vendedora con algunos años de experiencia ha crecido poco a poco, pero en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo todo en la compra de surtido de catálogo, su idea principal es crecer su inventario tener una mayor capacidad de endeudamiento y ofrecerles a sus clientes comodidades de pago para que saquen mayor número de productos.
Todo ello lo hace porque quiere tener un hogar con mejores condiciones y asegurar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
This is Erika, a housewife, very dedicated to caring for her partner and son, but as a housewife she receives no income. One afternoon while drinking coffee, a friend suggested that she start selling catalog products, an occupation she can do without neglecting her home.
Erika listened to her friend and started with a small amount of capital, selling catalog merchandise. She sold clothing, perfumes, pajamas, and whatever her clients requested. Now, Erika is a salesperson with some years of experience. She has grown little by little, but in the moment is asking for a loan to invest fully in the purchase of catalog stock. Her main idea is to grow her inventory, have a larger ability to absorb debt, and offer facilities of payment to her customers, so they can buy a larger amount of products.
She does all of this because she wants to have a home with better conditions and secure the education of her son.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of catalog stock.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Это Жамила. Она проживает на районе Хуросон. У Жамили 5 детей. Она дома занимается животноводством. Уже 11 лет как она занимается животноводческой деятельностью. Сын Жамили решил жениться и привести в дом невестку. Жамила очень рада, что сын женится и вскоре она познакомится со своей невесткой. Чтобы сыграть свадьбу, нужны средства, поэтому Жамила обратилась за кредитом. За счет денег она сможет провести свадьбу сына. Она надеется, что ее поддержат и заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en: Meet Jamila, the mother of five children, who lives in the Khuroson district of Tajikistan.  She raises livestock at home and has been involved in this activity for the past 11 years already.  Jamila's son will soon get married and will bring his young bride home.  Jamila is looking forward to this wedding and to welcoming her new daughter-in-law.  However, the family will need money to celebrate the wedding, and for this reason, Jamila is taking a loan.  Thanks to her loan, Jamila will be able to pay for her son's wedding.  She hopes to receive some support and she thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding.

loans.name: Sadirali

texts.ru: Садирали, 42 года, женат, 2 детей школьного возраста. У него среднее образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Садирали на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы. На участке мерою 0,20 Га собственной земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). Садирали обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Садирали планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Sadirali is 42 years old, married, and the father of two school-aged children.  He has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which bring a source of income for his family.  Thanks to his very hard work, Sadirali currently has two cows.  He also grows potatoes on 0.2 hectares of his own land and makes a monthly income of about 12,000 som (KGS).  Sadirali has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two additional cows for fattening and resale.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further grow his business and improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy two cows and increase the size of  his herd.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
TERESA TIENE 68 AÑOS, VIUDA, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA JUNTO A SU HIJO. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

TERESA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TAMALES POR LAS MAÑANAS EN EL MERCADO ANTIGUO DE CAYALTI Y A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO(CARNEROS Y AVES DE CORRAL).EL CREDITO TENDRA COMO DESTINO LA INVERSIÓN EN COMPRA DE ANIMALES PARA VENTA Y OTROS GASTOS PERSONALES.CON ELLO TENDRÁ MAYOR VENTA Y ATENCIÓN A CLIENTES Y ASÍ PODER GENERAR INGRESOS PARA UNA MEJORA EN CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Teresa is 68 years old. She is a widow who lives in her own house with her son. She lives in a community where most people work in trade, agriculture and livestock. It is located in the Cayalti district in the province of Chiclayo which is in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru. 

In the morning, Teresa sells tamale (a traditional Mesoamerican dish) at the old market in Cayalti. She also raises and sells farmyard animals from her home (rams and poultry). The loan will be used to buy animals to sell and to pay for other personal expenses. This will enable her to increase her sales and provide better service for her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn enough to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell and to pay for other personal expenses.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 19 овец. На 1,20 Га земли она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Тамара вновь обратилась в рамках группы "Тамара" в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. В группе состоят всего 3 человека, Тамара - лидер группы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и постройку дома.
texts.en: Tamara successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it for its intended purpose.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her to get this financing.  She currently has two cows and 19 sheep on her farm and she also cultivates potatoes and corn on 1.2 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  As a member of the "Tamara" group, she has once more contacted Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and she is taking a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a few calves.  The "Tamara" group consists of three people, and Tamara acts as its leader. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her livestock headcount and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy some calves in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨Marenco¨, está constituido por dos mujeres y un varón, demostrando ser personas muy laboriosas, emprendedoras y responsables. Solicitan por décima sexta vez crédito para impulsar sus negocios. 
Coordinando el grupo esta, Patricia de 31 años, ajuntada y con tres hijos de edades de 10, 17 y 15, de los cuales un hijo acude a primaria y los demás están cursando segundaria. Tiene un taller de costura, donde elabora trajes con bordados, lo comenzó con dinero financiado de otras financieras, su mama le ayuda en el negocio armando los trajes, y con los créditos obtenidos anteriormente aquí, ha podido comprar máquinas y materiales para la producción. Ahora desea invertir en la compra de tela dacron, sedas, listones e hilo. Pudiendo así aumentar las ganancias. 
Los demás integrantes los conforman Josefa, de 60 años quien tiene un taller de costura. Y Henry de 29 años quien invertirá en su pulpería que tiene en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Marenco Group is comprised of two women and a man who have proven themselves to be very industrious, enterprising, responsible people.  They are requesting their 16th loan to boost their businesses.

Patricia, 31, is the coordinator of the group.  She has a partner and three children, ages 10, 17 and 15, with a son in grade school and the others in high school.  She runs a sewing shop and makes embroidered clothing.  She started out with loans from other financialy entities.  Her mother helps put the clothing together.  With the previous loans she has received she has bought machines and production materials.  

Now she wants to buy dacron fabric, silk, ribbons and thread so she can increase her earnings.

The other members of the group are Josefa, 60, who has a sewing business and Henry, 29, who will invest in the grocery store he has at home.

loans.use: To buy dacron fabric, silks, ribbons and thread.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовала его по назначению. Гульмира очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог в финансировании. На сегодняшний день ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 5,600 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 22 овцы. На 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает картофель, клевер и кукурузу. Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка. Гульмира является вторым членом группы "Тамара", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulmira successfully repaid her loan, after using it for its intended purpose.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her to get this financing.  Today, she makes a monthly income of about 5,600 som (KGS).  She has three cows and 22 sheep on her farm and she grows potatoes, clover and corn on one hectare of leased land.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy one calf.  Gulmira is the second member of the "Tamara" group which consists of three people.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her livestock headcount and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy one calf in order to increase her livestock headcount.
